And chefs, they do put on a show of merriment.

But alas, the dining room, a different tale doth tell,
For when I've gone for sushi, long have I waited,
Thirty minutes or more, a delay most vexing,
And though the staff doth acknowledge the delay,
'Tis little comfort, for I do hunger still.

One sushi chef, or waiter, doth not suffice,
To serve the multitude that doth come to dine,
And so, I must, with sorrow, give this place,
A rating of three stars, and naught but that."

In sooth, I took my carriage in for oil's change,
And was delighted with the cost and speed of range.
The site, most apt, to stroll to Costco's keep,
Whilst waiting, shopping or snacking, one doth reap.

FYI, good sir, seek out coupons on their page,
Ere thou doth go, 'twill save thee coins, as it did engage.

"Las Vegas' newest hotspot, packed like a can of sardines. House floor, vibrant sound, but no room to move. Shoulder-to-shoulder, couldn't dance, couldn't breathe. Moved to the Hip Hop area, equally cramped, but found a tiny corner to squeeze in. Got lucky, a girl invited us to dance in her reserved table area. Warren G performed, West Coast girls, knew every song, great time. Left right after, too crowded, not worth it. Don't buy bottled water, small bottle costs $9, total ripoff."

"Liked it first time 'round, gave it five stars. Good grub, ate it two days straight. This time? Quality lackin'. Ordered four Earl's clubs, no lettuce - zip, zero, zilch. Too much bacon, sandwiches way too salty. Officially sick of this joint. Won't be cravin' it next time."

"Decent spot, but prices are steep for what you get. Only had their Togo grub, which is solid. Can't say much for the ambiance, though. They let folks smoke hookah outside, and even picking up my order, I gotta endure the stench. Not bad, but could use some fine-tuning."
"Tacos, greasy and flavorless. Disappointment, my order. Dirt floors, English lacking."

"Kitty's Cafe, tucked away in the El Cortez Hotel and Casino, serves up classic Vegas fare with a side of friendly service. The old-style diner, complete with booths and a traditional counter, is a place where the staff knows their regulars by name and calls everyone "honey." The menu offers nothing too fancy, but the portions are generous. I opted for the grilled sourdough melt, loaded with turkey and ham. It was a satisfying meal, but not exceptional. On this particular visit, the kitchen was running a bit behind schedule, which made for a slower-than-usual dining experience. Late at night, Kitty's might be your best bet for a quick bite, but for the same price, you can likely find better options elsewhere. The days of those "$1.99 deals" are long gone, unfortunately."

"O, woe is me, fair friends! This Starbucks doth belong  
To NY NY hotel, and thus, doth not embrace  
The wondrous app that doth bring ease to our days.  
Alas, no fair reward for those who doth not carry  
Cash on their persons. Fie upon this wretched place!  
Yet, blessed be the coins that doth fill my purse,  
For they didst save me from the grasping jaws  
Of those accursed slot machines that doth reside  
Within these walls. O, how they doth entice and lure,  
But I, with fortune's favor, didst escape their snare.  
And thus, I shall return, for this Starbucks doth lie  
In our hotel's bosom, and I shall urge them, pray,  
To join the ranks of those who doth embrace  
The app, that we, the faithful, may receive our due."

"At another DDD joint, Melissa, our server, greeted us with a cheerful good morning. We waited the usual 10 minutes - a sign of a good spot. Coffee, rich and full-bodied. Diet Coke, perfectly carbonated. Eggs arrived swiftly, leaving me just enough time to jot down a few lines. Glasses remained full. A decent breakfast spot."

"A gentle stroll it was, from FireSky hotel, just across the way. Our meal began with green pork chili, savory indeed, yet lacking heat. Next, we indulged in lamb fondue, with succulent lamb racks, dipped in squash sauce, most delectable. Alas, the main course, braised short rib, though generous in portion, lacked zest, a pity for such tender meat. A pinch of salt, a dash of pepper, a sprinkle of seasonings, might have elevated the dish, nay, the entire meal, to greater heights. Three stars, I give, for though not perfect, 'twas not a waste, neither didst it leave us feeling cheated."

Tapas, great. Paella, too salty. First time trying it, thought it'd be good. Tapas, tasty, especially mushroom risotto. Oxtail, tender. Potatoes, yummy. Garlic chicken, good, but accidentally ate a clove of garlic. Vampires, beware. Paella, too salty. Service, meh. Cafe, better.

"Limited grub options before the Luxor show. Ticket agent, 20, suggested T&T. Said it was great. Should've known better. Mojitos to start. Waiter said they were good. I've had my share, but these were too sweet. Club soda couldn't save 'em. Chips and salsa subpar. Easy to do well. Had tacos and shrimp. Average. Server was friendly, offered free show tix. Already had 'em, but kind gesture. Won't be back. Asian joint had better menu."

"Best meal I had in Vegas. On vacation with my sisters, we wanted to keep costs down. Friend recommended this place, hidden in the food court. Not the greatest location, but prices are decent. Inside seating, bright lights, not the best ambiance. Service was meh, our waiter was a chatty Italian guy, more interested in the young ladies nearby than us. Forgot about us at the end, had to be reminded by a busboy. Food was great though, Caeser salad, filet mignon meatballs, and Quatro Stagioni pizza, all delicious. Recommend the grub, not the service."

"Enjoyed checking out The Dog empire during my extended weekend in Edinburgh.  Great concept, cool vibes, and solid grub.  Wished I had more time to sample everything!  \n\nHad a decent flank steak salad (2.5 stars), a bit chewy but the sweet balsamic reduction balanced the bitter arugula.  My man's mushroom risotto (4.0 stars) was rich and cooked to perfection.  Finished with tiramisu (3 stars), but it lacked the kick of espresso and the dark chocolate overpowered the light dessert.  Ended up scraping off the top."

"Fare was sumptuous, prices fair and low,
With coupon, at a restaurant, you know.
I would have given five stars, 'tis true,
But for the waiter, who seemed quite new.
His manner was brash, his words uncouth,
He seemed to think himself above the truth.
Alas, his bearing left much to be desired,
And thus, my rating doth drop, like autumn's fire."

"Beer selection top-notch. Rotating taps, so consistency lacking. Food surprisingly good, exceeded expectations. Large group, great time, drinks and trivia. Atmosphere and service subpar. Overcrowded, understaffed. Long waits for help. Server friendly, but overwhelmed. Returning, but not when hungry. Dive bar vibe, not impressive. Good beer and food, but that's it."

"I've been coming here for years. Dr. Finch has done a minor procedure on my dog Dozer, and I was pleased with his work. He's got a good bedside manner, and he's informative. Now, he's gonna do a bigger surgery on her, and I'm confident in his abilities. I've tried shopping around, but I keep ending up back here. Dozer's got a history with them, and I trust 'em."

"I've only had the breakfast here, specifically the corned beef and farmer's omelets. The grub's decent, nothing special. I appreciate the blueberry muffin option instead of toast. The server was friendly, no issues with bringing ranch dressing for my hash browns (a strange but tasty combo). It's also the only joint open past 10 pm that's not in a casino and won't break the bank. A good spot for a low-key meal with a friend. My only gripe is they don't serve dark chicken meat (white's too dry for my taste)."

"Food was good, service top-notch. But jeez, $18 for enchiladas? That's rich. Roach coach enchiladas, five bucks a pop, could give 'em a run for their money. Chips and guac, nine bucks? Good stuff, but not worth the coin. This joint's got some kinda complex, tryin' to be fancy with cloth napkins and menus on paper. But at the end of the day, they're just another mainstream Mexican spot, loads of cheaper options around. Won't be back, prices are too steep."

"Mert's, a place they'd show on that program, 'Diners, Drive-ins and Dives', hath a quaint, southern charm, that doth make strangers feel at home. But, alas, I pray thee, do not come hither for luncheon, lest thou desirest a quick repast, and then, perchance, a snooze. Forsooth, the victuals, though passable, shall not long keep thee awake, and the service, though fair, shall not thy hunger slake. 'Tis but a middling spot, where thou mayst snatch a meal, yet not a place to linger o'erlong."

"Harrah's got a sweet setup goin' on at Carnaval Court. It's like they knew what they were doin' when they put it smack dab in the middle of a tourist trap. Kiosks everywhere, sellin' junk nobody needs. But hey, we weren't drunk or nothin', just a buncha buddies lookin' for some laughs. So we figured, why not? Bought ourselves some of them fancy light-up shirts, just for the hell of it. And man, did we stand out. People were givein' us props left and right. \n\nWe hit the dance floor, shirts blazin', and let me tell ya, it was a real good time. Plenty of space to bust a move, and bein' outside kept things from gettin' too hot. Plus, them flare bartenders put on a show, makin' drinks like they was performin' magic tricks. And hey, if you wanna switch it up between dancin' and gamblin', this is the place to do it. They got tables set aside for that very thing. It's like they knew exactly what people come to Vegas for."

"Twas a pleasant eve, and I did dine
At this fine establishment, with a view so divine.
The staff, they were friendly, and the grub, it was tasty,
A rib-eye steak, cooked just right, and oh so hasty.

Blue cheese potatoes, they were quite good,
But the blue cheese, it did overpower the mood.
A cake for dessert, it was my desire,
But alas, the ice cream, it had lost its fire.

For the price, I did expect a bit more,
In terms of detail, and a bit more in store.
But still, 'twas worth the trip, for the view alone,
A pleasant evening, and a meal most fine, I'd known."

"A friend did recommend this place,
With dim sum, twice a year they doth grace,
Their food, quite tasty, yet not all was hot,
Some dishes, cold, my taste buds did not,

A chili oil, they did not have in store,
But nonetheless, their items, fresh and more,
Oysters, crab legs, lobster, nigiri too,
I asked the sushi man, if without rice, I could do,
He said no, but for me, he made an exception,
Thick pieces, a shame, my request, his perfection,

Octopus, I wanted, but felt shy,
So walked the line, a salad, did catch my eye,
Fresh fruit, aplenty, a delightful sight,
Desert bar, decent, but not quite right,
Dim sum, my love, next to sushi, a treat,
Perhaps this weekend, I shall return, to eat."

"Comedy's a crapshoot. Sometimes you hit the jackpot, other times you crap out. This show started strong. Our MC was a real charmer, funny as hell and knew how to work the room. He was raw, but not too rough. Then came the first two comedians. They were crass, swore like sailors and didn't give a damn if they offended anyone. One guy even kept going after a woman stood up and told him to move on. What a jerk. But our MC saved the day, patching over those two disasters like a pro. And let me tell you, Jay Reid, the headliner, made the whole night worth it. He worked that stage like a pro, using everything from the stool to the mic stand as props. His jokes were spot-on, tackling tough topics with style. And he hung around after to meet the folks. Now that's class."

"Came here for my 18th birthday with some pals. Happy hour's from 2-6 PM, Monday through Friday. Shame we got there at 7. Had the grilled chicken sandwich - chicken was a bit pink, but I was hungry and didn't wanna send it back. Shared a frozen hot chocolate too. Coulda been better, but I was chewin' on ice the whole time. Service was slow and it ain't cheap, but not by much. Gonna give it another shot soon."

"Verily, 'tis not thy grandfather's Flamingo, nor e'en thy uncle Larry's, whom we knew not so fondly in days of yore. Howsoever, ere my latest journey thither, the mere thought of lodging there did conjure images most dismal - the dreadful trappings of yesteryear, the frowzy, fanny-pack-clad gamblers, and the saccharine countenances of Donnie and Marie, their gazes locked in fervent longing, as if to forget that fateful night in days of old. Fear not, dear reader, for the Flamingo hath transformed, its decor now pleasing, the casino floor spotless, and fanny packs scarce. Methinks, too, that I might now condescend to bring a paramour, perchance even one I hold in esteem, and, withal, proclaim, 'Tush, why must we label our bond?' Most heartily, I urge thee, wayfarer, to give the Flamingo a chance, for 'tis a passable abode, and, haply, thou shalt be the first to espy Donnie and Marie's long-awaited, fiery consummation."

"Methinks I've dined here twice before,
At Treasure Island, where I did abide.
The Pho, alas, doth leave much to desire,
And with each spoonful, my taste doth conspire.

The veggie spring rolls, a decent fare,
With peanut sauce that doth leave me unfair.
Coco-nutty, thou sayest? Methinks 'tis true,
Yet still, my hunger doth crave something new.

My Pho Tai, a feast fit for a king,
With beef aplenty, yet scant noodles did bring.
My friend's Veggie Pho, a wondrous sight,
Bak choy, mushrooms, and corn, a delight.

Alas, the price doth seem a bit steep,
For in fair Los Angeles, a bowl most cheap.
Yet still, the waitress doth attend with grace,
And the establishment doth shine in its place."

"A pox upon this Target, say I, forsooth! 'Tis near my dwelling, thus I oft repair thither, yet loath I am to enter, for 'tis thronged with folk, a veritable sea of humanity, and long I must tarry in line, ere I may make my purchases. Alas, fair sir, how vexing 'tis to wait! Yet, praise be to the gods, for all else is well. Ample parking doth it boast, kind staff doth serve, and wares galore doth it possess, in one vast, bustling emporium."
"Employees yakkin' away, backs turned to customers. Service suffers."

Hark! What fortune brought me to this place?
A chance encounter, naught but grace.
The salad bar, a middling sight,
Yet meats, too salted, raw, and quite.
But service, oh! How poorly done,
Waitress appeared but thrice, 'twas done.
First, when we sat, then drinks did bear,
Last, the bill, with nary a care.
We had to ask, for meat to share,
Servers passed, without a single stare.
Alas, the price, the quality doth lack,
A sorry state, this Las Vegas stack.

"Upon our quest for sustenance, we chanced upon this cozy nook,
After the Bacchanal's queue did our plans beset.
With hunger pangs, we entered, and beheld the sight,
A modern eatery, with music loud and bright.

The portions generous, yet the fare did not impress,
Save for the tator tots, which crispy, crunchy were,
My pastrami sandwich lacked zest, the flavors did not blend,
A pity, for the meal did not reach its full potential, my friend."

"Verily, this place doth please mine eyes,
A haven of knowledge, full of surprise.
The four ecosystems, neatly divided,
Didst spark my curiosity, and I didst decide,
To explore them all, with haste and speed.

Alas, the polar room, didst lack, I found,
In comparison to others, 'twas profound.
The entry fee, a bit steep, I must confess,
For what they offer, doth not impress.

But fear not, dear friends, for all is not lost,
The gift shop doth make up, for what it cost.
Bags made from juice boxes, a curious sight,
Insect snacks, a delicacy, no doubt,
And small crystals, shining bright and fair,
A treasure trove, beyond compare.

So heed my words, and save thy coins,
For the elevator ride, doth not entice.
To Mount Royal's peak, thou shalt ascend,
And there, the same view, thou shalt attend."

"Hark, fair maiden! Do not judge this place by its outward show,
For within its walls, great treasures lie in store,
A veritable trove of goods, both new and old,
Clothes, paintings, and home decor, to make thy heart enfold.

They change their wares with seasons, so 'tis said,
And now, they prepare to expand their rugs and portraits' stead,
A boon for those who seek to renovate their nest,
And make it a haven of comfort and joy, at the least.

I visited this place, and found it full of delight,
A place where bargains await, with patience and insight,
So, gentle reader, take heed of my words,
And come hither, to seek out thy own sweet deals, in good cheer."

"Hark, what news is this? The Chicken Strip Cheese sandwich, once a staple of this fair establishment, hath been replaced with something most vile and foul. Alas, poor Hooters, how art thou fallen from grace! Yet still, the wings and steak fries remain, a glimmer of hope in this darkest of hours."

"A humble abode for travelers on a quest for thrift,
This hotel doth offer lodging with the barest essentials.
'Tis a place where one may rest their weary head,
And find solace in slumber, free from frivolous frills.

In the vicinity, diversions doth abound,
Pizza, Subway, Fatburger, and a cinema profound.
Alas, the latter didst taste most vile and foul,
And left us waiting, in a state most woeful.

But for those seeking refuge, free from pomp and fanfare,
This hostelry shall serve its purpose, without a single care.
So pack thy bags, and come hither with haste,
For here, thou shalt find rest, and a good night's repose at last."

"Methought I saw this place upon the telly,
And thus my heart didst yearn to give it a try.
Forsooth, the victuals of the sea didst please,
But alack, they lacked the zest I didst prize.
Go early, lest thou find thyself in queue,
As we didst dine at eleven, and anon,
A crowd didst gather, eager to partake
Of the feast that doth await thee, gentle sake."

"A hearty three-star dish of red curry tofu,
No five-star fare, nor four-star too,
But still, they cooked it well, I must confess,
The one dish that I ordered, they did impress."

"We swung by Cold Stone around 8:30 PM. The line was out the door, but we were determined to get our ice cream fix. I insisted we wait in line, and it took about 15 minutes to get our order. The place was packed, but the staff were hustling to keep the line moving. I ordered the smallest size, but the employee accidentally gave me the next size up for free. Not complaining. The seating area was limited and dirty, but I couldn't blame them - they were busy making orders. We opted for takeout. I'm a fan of Cold Stone's ice cream, and I'm used to the long lines. It's worth the wait for that sweet, sweet "All Lovin' No Oven" flavor."

"This joint brought to mind Whiskey River, minus the beachside riffraff. Folks were kickin' back, enjoying themselves. Dance-offs on the floor, 99 cent Jaeger bombs, and rumors of 99 cent tacos. A wet T-shirt contest, too, though it was a bit of a bust. Still, I'd return."

"Grandview Saloon's got a killer view of Pittsburgh from its patio. Interior views ain't too shabby neither. Their drink selection's decent, food's alright, but nothing special. Patio's nice, but inside's a bit drab. Shame, 'cause a little TLC on the decor and menu'd make this joint one of the city's best. Not the spot for a fancy anniversary dinner, but good for showin' off the city to out-of-towners while sippin' a cold one."

"Hark! What service doth this place provide?
Friendly, great and most attentive, they do strive.
A Caesar salad we didst partake,
And duck, oh so succulent and fair, didst make our day.
But alas, the scallops, a poor choice indeed,
For they were naught but mediocre, a dish to be decreed.
An ordinary meal, at best, doth this place provide,
Not worth repeating, in sooth, I do decide."

"Hark! I've been frequenting this place all week long,
And in foul weather, 'tis hard to tell if 'tis open.
Some things I love, and some, alas! I do not,
The flowers, a steal! Beautifully arranged, yet brief.
Two or three days, their beauty doth fade and wilt,
But oh! The produce, a bargain indeed!
Tasty tomatoes and peaches, in season, a treat.
Yet, alack! Not all is local, a shame,
For I sought a local apple, in vain.
Stickers of sku, from California or Washington,
A warning, that not all is of this land.
But fear not, for'midst these, local farmers be,
Worthy of praise, and thus, I shall visit thee."

"I dig The Coffee Bean, usually. But this one's off, and all the joe inside the Venetian's no good either. Maybe it's the water, maybe it's a plot to drive me loco. Whatever it is, it's messing with my mind. But, it's still better than the room service swill. And I get it delivered to my door every morning by a real stand-up guy. So, for the coffee, one star. But, for the service, two more. That's three stars, total."
"Good joint, lots of useful stuff.  Great savings too.  Place is well-organized, but can get messy with all the other shoppers.  Only issue is the long line to check out.  Worth the wait, though."

"Clean joint. Good service. Koi pond's a nice touch. But the sandwich? Forget about it. Turkey's like something you'd grab off the shelf at the grocery store. Not worth it. Prices are average, but you can do better elsewhere."

I wanted to love it, but it was just okay. Expectations were high after reading rave reviews on Pop's site. I envisioned a fun, delicious experience with a gruff but charming grill master asking me "wit" onions? in a genuine Philly accent. Instead, the grill master was just gruff and didn't hear my order. No onions on my cheese steak. 

The cheese steak itself? Meat wasn't fatty or greasy, but a bit bland. Enjoyed the cheese whiz and the bread was great. Including onions would've made it tastier. Since eating it, I've felt a bit off, but that's not always a sign of whether I'd return if the food's good. (Masochist!) 

Would I try it again? Sure, but I'll also try their competition and yelp the results.

"Twas a Tuesday eve, and Cabo did bustle with life,
A hub of activity, full of mirth and strife.
We two, a party small, didst swiftly gain a seat,
And savored dishes fresh, though not quite meet.

The taste, it didst please, yet failed to reach
The lofty standards set by Charlotte's speech.
But, contrary to some, our waitress didst show
No haste, nor urgency, as we chatted slow.

Parking, alas, a challenge it doth pose,
In NoDa's crowded streets, a winding course.
Yet, overall, Cabo doth provide a merry space
For drinks and bites, though not a place to race."

"Hark! Upon our return from fair Mexico and Cuba's shores,  
We chanced upon this airport, easy to explore.  
Signs guided us through immigration, quick and neat,  
Our research papers ready, just in case, to greet.  

The line was long, but moved with haste, no time to waste,  
The officer, stern-faced, scanned our passports, no need to boast.  
Through customs, we swiftly went, forms handed with grace,  
Rechecked our bags, and onward, to our next place.  

But alas, security, a lengthy wait didst impose,  
Lines long, yet personnel, their duties didst dispose.  
Friendly and kind, they worked with diligence, no slack,  
Moving all along, to San Francisco, our next track.  

A pity, time was short, no BBQ to savor,  
Thanks to security, our hunger didst not devour.  
Yet, memories linger, of our trip so fine,  
Five stars, all places, a true divine.  

And Beyonce, Jay Z, they too, didst follow suit,  
In Cuba, footsteps, their love, didst ignite."

"Hotel's seen better days. Exterior's worn down, in need of a refresh. Rooms ain't so bad, but tile grout's a bit dingy. Didn't hear neighbors, but food's good, especially for a hotel. Decent bar, local brews on tap. Service is friendly. Location's convenient, but it's a hike to downtown attractions. Took advantage of free shuttle, driver Christian's friendly and knowledgeable. Easy access off I-277. For the price, it's not bad."

"Cozy joint, dimly lit. Bar and dinin' area separate. Service sharp, attentive. Beer selection diverse, sample before committin'. Food just alright. Turkey sandwich, salad. Turkey dry, flavor lackin'. Salad forgettable. Not bad for a bar, could be worse."

"Hark! A place I've longed to try,
With praise and menu, did entice me nigh.
But lo! The prices, oh so high,
Did make me gasp in utter surprise.

The patio, we did sit upon,
For in the main room, none were seated anon.
Our waitress, kind and attentive, she,
Did note my water, with debris did be.
And hubby's glass, with dirt did abound.
She brought us margaritas, frozen, twain,
Of peach and strawberry, most wondrous, indeed.
Much better than the rocks, I do declare.

No chips or salsa, free of charge,
A shame, for Barrio, it doth compare.
No happy hour, alas, a disappointment true.
The street corn, good, but not the best,
The butternut squash tacos, divine, anew.
My hubby, he did prefer them, I do swear.
But oh! The price, $12, for three, so small,
And guacamole, made from two avocados, at all.
How they survive, in this economy, I know not,
Perhaps, when tourists leave, in summer's heat, they doth slow."

"Hark! What news is this? A place most fair,
Where children may draw on a Magna Doodle rare,
And staff, kind and courteous, doth attend,
In a restaurant clean, as new-born pretend.

Pasta, a feast for the taste, doth abound,
With choices five, and sauces, likewise found,
Whole wheat, a healthy delight, doth join,
And toppings, diverse, to make it thine own.

Karaoke, on Friday and Saturday night,
Doth bring mirth and joy, a wondrous sight,
Food, decent, and prices, fair, I say,
If thou dost not crave extra toppings in array.

But alas, a few flaws, I must confess,
The kids' menu, hidden, and small, I address,
Drinks, in adult cups, a curious sight,
And slow cleaning, of spilled milk, a plight.

Pasta, pizza, and paninis, the menu doth bear,
Little else, to tempt, or to entice, I declare,
Cannelloni, a dessert, bland, I fear,
A shame, for such potential, did appear.

Yet still, this place, doth hold some charm,
For families, and those who seek no alarm,
So visit, and see, if it doth please thee,
This restaurant, new, and clean, as can be."
"The bouncer gave us the cold shoulder. He was rude, real rude. But we weren't gonna let that ruin our boy's big day. So, we convinced him to let us in."

"A shop most wondrous, full of Korean delight,
For those who seek such treats with great insight.
But lo, a mistake didst the previous speaker make,
In calling this place Japanese, a grave mistake to take.
Korean and Japanese cuisine, though similar in some ways,
Are not the same, and thus, their differences stay."

"Methinks Red 8, a Chinese eatery of some renown,
Doth serve a savory Oxtail soup, most delectable,
With Mongolian beef and rice, a feast most fair,
In atmosphere and service, they do excel.

But, alas, their desserts, a weakness they do bear,
And prices, somewhat steep, yet still they fare.
I would not seek this place, for Chinese cuisine,
But, if invited, shall return, to dine once more.
A worthy venture, still, to cross it from my list."

"Alas, dear friends, 'tis true, the deals of old,
In Vegas, they do fade away, like mist at morn.
Gone are the days of feasts most fair and cheap,
Ah, Sahara, how I miss thy bounty, now so meager.

In Henderson, we didst visit kin, and sought
Sunset Station for a savory repast.
Prime rib, they didst offer, for a mere $9.99,
A price, I thought, most reasonable, and thus, didst dine.

The wait, it was not long, but fifteen minutes, still,
Didst seem an eternity, till our table, we didst fill.
My prime rib, cooked medium well, lacked somewhat,
In flavor, and thus, I wished, I hadst ordered it rare.

The service, good, the food, not bad, yet still,
I wished the price, a bit lower, didst fulfill.
T-bone steak, they offered, for $12.99, a sum,
In Vegas, high, for such a meal, I didst reckon.

Yet, Grand Cafe, far better than Denny's, doth stand,
For local fare, 'tis a place, where I wouldst take a stand.
So, if thou art in search of a meal, most fair,
And prices, that do not break the bank, do dare,
To venture forth, and dine, at this, my chosen place,
Where value, doth meet, with taste, in a most pleasant embrace."

"Methinks I didst wish to enjoy this place, yet found it most vexing. Perchance 'twas o'er-praised? Fare was but middling, naught to set it apart from other spreads. \n\nBy the words of others, mayhap shall I give 'tis place a second chance when next in Vegas, but wouldst sooner return to Rio's seafood feast ere dining here anew."

"Food's good. Best part. Had endless shrimp - shrimp alfredo times two, breaded shrimp, shrimp scampi. Worst part? Wait to sit and be served. Thirty minutes to sit, fifteen to be served. Need better service for a higher rating from me. Food's good, hot. Once served, service was decent. Cheddar biscuits, excellent."

"Fresh fish, well-served, doth make my heart sing!
A bit pricey, mayhap, but worth every penny, I do declare.
Three visits, and thrice I didst enjoy the fare,
Good sashimi, indeed, doth please mine eyes and taste."

"Alas, my stay at this hotel was not pleasant,
The room was nice, but the journey to get there, oh so tedious!
Through the casino, with luggage in hand,
A bridge o'er the pool, a most tiresome stand.

The bathroom, alack, was quite motley,
Old and worn, not fit for a Hilton, I reckon.
The casino, fresh and new, did please,
But check-in, alas, was a most dire tease.

The pool, a haven, staff, kind and sweet,
Housekeeping, tidy, a job well-done, neat.
But, alack, my stay, was not worth the fray,
For check-in, a nightmare, drove me away."

"Alack, the choice was scant, the parking lot full,
Yet in the shop, a dearth of people did pull.
The staff, kind and courteous, did my heart cheer,
And lo, I found some cups of juice, so fine and clear.
For sixty-nine pence, a bargain, I did say,
And thus, my quest for drinkware, did end that day."

"Aye, fair readers, listen well, for I have tale to tell,  
Of coffee sought, and cakes so swell,  
At Aria, where I did abide, on business bent,  
With fianc\u00e9, dear, my heart's consent.  

We chanced upon this patisserie, so bright,  
With cakes, a feast for eyes, a wondrous sight,  
And thus, next morn, my heart did crave,  
Some coffee, strong, to lift my brave.  

Downstairs I went, with haste, to claim,  
Two Americanos, my heart's fond aim,  
But lo, the barista, with machine so fine,  
Punched buttons, swift, and coffee poured, divine.  

Alas, the taste, not great, I must confess,  
Yet, baked goods, if sought, I would address,  
For though the coffee failed my hope,  
The cakes, a marvel, did my spirit cope."
"Beer's decent, but pricey. Wait for Costco restock. ($30 at brewery, $20 at Costco). Might come back if they open a real joint. Staff's friendly, but that's about it."

"Verily, 'tis a place thou mustst visit at least once in thy lifetime. Forsooth, 'tis a merry experience, and the flesh, it doth please thy taste buds well. But mark thee well, good sir, avoid thou holidays, for service and victuals, they doth suffer in quality."

"Twas a princely sum we paid, my friend,
For plates of food, though small, yet tasty.
Fifty to sixty crowns, they did demand,
For portions entree-sized, not quite bountiful.
The restaurant, grand and red, did gleam,
We sat at bar, and watched the cooks perform.
The victuals, good, but value, poor, indeed,
A casual dine, they claimed, the prices should decrease.
Thus, three stars, I give, for price, a sin,
Yet, knowledge gained, I entered in."

"Bagel joint. Not the best. Went with the missus. Waited for our grub. Dusty vent. Dirty floors. Slow service. Guy was nice, but slow. Twenty minutes for two bagels and a muffin. Bagels were good. Variety was nice. Muffin was meh. Prices were fair. That's it."

"Disappointment at Pho Bosa. Read good reviews, took the family for some pho. Waitress said no pho available. How can that be? Name's Pho Bosa, right? Should've been told sooner. Food wasn't great either. Staff was friendly, but won't be back."

The stench of the joint can be overwhelming, but the instructors here are top-notch. Shame about the front desk crew, though - they're as friendly as a wet cat. If they had their act together, I'd still be coming here. But it's a hike from my place, so I'll have to look elsewhere for a more welcoming vibe. 

Other than that, they've got a tidy changing area with two showers, fully stocked with body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. You can scrub off all that funky sweat after your workouts. 

Worth checking out: Summer and Stacy. They're both great in their own ways.

"Hark! A meal most fair with Rob didst share,
The victuals, verily, didst please mine eyes.
Eggs, bacon, pancakes, a feast most rare,
Yet, alack! Their pancakes, not my heart's desire.
But, lo! Their sausage gravy, a delight most true,
Didst make my morn most bright and gay."
"Place wasn't what we expected. Pizza, Classic Maggie, was good but not great. Hubby's burger, charred to hell. Waitress MIA. Typical bar grub and beer selection. That's it."

"Been here a few times. Love their beer. Only serve their own. Food's alright, nothing special. Didn't like the wings. Atmosphere's great though. Good place to grab a drink. Food's a bit pricey, but it's Ahwatukee. Highly recommend their craft brews. That's all they got. Uncle Bear's brewed beer. I'll be back, but not too excited. Okay spot for friends. TVs everywhere, good for football. Allow dogs on the patio, leashed. Bring an 8x10 pic of your pup, frame it, and they'll hang it up in memoriam. That's cool."

"A hearty meal we had at Turkish Kitchen,
For those who sought a bite without a fuss,
Bread and dip did they bring first,
And oh, the dip, it was quite divine,
I pray, what secrets lay within its mix?

Turkish ravioli, I didst choose,
Though not on menu, 'twas my wish,
Salad and rice, they didst provide,
But awkward, wasteful, in a way, 'twas,
Ravioli, overcooked, didst fall apart,
Flavors, fine, but not up to par,
Compared to others, a disappointment,
Kebabs, perhaps, I should have had,
But not in the mood, I didst decline,
Others, content, with their repasts,

Strange, the beer, in varied glasses came,
Small, and not of standard size, 'twas,
A decent choice, for those who seek,
A meal, cheap, and cheerful, 'tis,
But not the best, in Edinburgh's eyes."
"Friday happy hour spot. Chambord marg on point, achiote chopped chicken salad, divine. Trio appetizer, good when half-priced. Manager, hostess, server - all cocky. Two margaritas, forget 'em."
"Pizza? Hype? Don't get it. Just a regular pie, toppings nothing special. Pepperoni, sausage, the usual. Better pies elsewhere, but hey, if you're hungry after Marquee, it'll do."

"Ay, my experience here was but a middling one, fair friends. I didst order Pho, yet the broth didst not please mine taste, 'twas but a mediocre concoction. My dearest boyfriend, however, didst enjoy his Cashew Chicken, 'twas his first time, and he didst relish it. Our friend didst partake of Chicken Fried Rice, and verily, 'twas good. The prices, fair and reasonable, doth make this place an excellent haunt for college students. I shall return, but not for the Pho, I pray thee.

Alas, I must give but three stars, forsooth, for two reasons doth trouble me. Firstly, I didst order Thai Iced Tea, expecting a refreshing draught, but lo, 'twas naught but a small, cold bottle from the fridge, a poor excuse indeed. The woman behind the counter didst say, "I am too lazy to make a proper one," and thus, my hopes were dashed. And secondly, the restaurant didst boast an excessive heat and humidity, with doors open wide on a rainy day most foul. I didst sweat uncomfortably, and 'twas a most unpleasant repast. Workers didst labor nearby, fixing ceiling tiles, a sight most unseemly, and I didst deem it unfit for folk to dine so near.

Farewell, good eatery, thy food was good, but alack, thy atmosphere, most lacking. Yet, shall I return, for 'tis a convenient and accessible spot, on Green Street, a thoroughfare most meet."

"Hark, my dear friend, I didst venture forth to Kings on Saturday eve,
For an early feast, ere my Xmas shopping didst begin.
'Tis a place I've visited oft, for my seafood desire,
Yet, alack, their service doth leave much to be desired.

A platter of seafood, chilled and fresh, didst we partake,
With crab legs, oysters, clams, and shrimp, a veritable lake.
A bargain, indeed, in this fair city of vice,
Yet, the entrees, alas, didst not quite meet my device.

Grilled shrimp and scallops, a skewer didst they provide,
A burger for the youngling, and a combo, fried and hide.
But lo, the latter dish, didst disappoint mine eyes,
Over-breaded and gummy, a sorry sight didst arise.

I shall, in future, stick to what doth please mine taste,
Sanddabs, or specials, that doth bring me joy and haste.
Forsooth, the shellfish platter, that doth be mine heart's desire,
And thus, my friends, doth end my tale of woe and fire."

"Burger Factory's just down the road from my joint. Place is hoppin' all day long. Menu's got something for everyone, perfect for them office groups with folks who can't agree on nothin'. Portions are big, so if you're lookin' for a hearty meal, this is your spot. It's a greasy spoon, but hey, that's what we like about it."

"Ping Pong Thai, a place of sustenance and delight,
A restaurant of Thai cuisine, with flavors so bright.
For years, I drove by, with thoughts of ping pong shows,
But alas, no balls were seen, only food that glows.

The Panang, a dish of watery consistency,
Bland, yet satisfying, but not quite a gem.
The Pad Kee Maw, a spicy, savory treat,
Worthy of praise, and worth every bite, so neat.

The service, slow and unresponsive, it seems,
Like chasing windmills, or so it appears.
To-go orders, swift and efficient, a contrast,
Leaving patrons feeling like just a statistic.

Oh, how a ping pong table would elevate the score,
A champion from Thailand, what a tale to explore!
Alas, no such luck, but still, the food is grand,
A visit, worthwhile, for the taste buds' demand."

"We keep going back 'cause it's close by and the happy hour's a good deal. But every damn time, I get pissed off about something. They only got three beers on tap, for one. And the service is always hit or miss. They're all over you at the start, then you gotta chase 'em down for the check. Don't make sense. Feels like they're tryin' to screw us over. The grub can be iffy too. Last time, we got two regular dishes and two happy hour specials. The cheap calamari was the best thing we had. The expensive elk meatballs? Bland, dry, and never again."
"Counter guy, helpful. Steered me right, enjoyed my meal. Tilapia, chicken adobo, both tasty."

"Linq's got a new joint, 'tween Harrah's and Bally's. Supposedly, they're servin' up top-shelf liquor in them slushies, but I ain't too sure. Felt like I needed more to get good and drunk. More flavors though, that's for sure. Went with Patron Grand Marnier 'cause it was sour. Staff's friendly, dressin' cute, but they need more signs on them cups. That saxophone cup, damn! It's the sexiest, baddest cup around. ;)"
"Drunk or high? Neither, yet still weird. Second Cirque show, first in Vegas. Acrobatics, great. Production set, beautiful. Trippy, yes. Creepy baby giggles and head. Not their best work, perhaps."
"Ordered delivery through YouBuyAndWeFly. Reasonable price, good eatin'. Had hot 'n' sour soup, sweet 'n' sour pork, orange chicken, chicken chow mein. All good."

"This joint's got a live band, nightly. Great for dancin', just like a weddin'. If I were gettin' hitched, I'd bring the whole crew here. But, it's a cash bar. That's the only downside. Tables fill up quick, but the room's not closed off from the casino. You can always grab a drink and watch the show. Slot machines are nearby, too. Reminds me of old Vegas, when every casino had music playin' in the bars. Nowadays, it's all about the mega clubs and VIP lists. So, it's nice to see some classic Vegas entertainment. Bring your crew, grab a table, and get ready to dance. This is Vegas at its finest."

"Spice Island, been goin' there since it first opened. Early 20s, that makes it a Pittsburgh institution. Menu's mostly the same, except they added booze. Why fix what ain't broke? My favorites are veggie - fried tofu, either sauce is great, and the veggie curry trio. Coconut rice, worth the extra cost. You'll be back for more."

"ABC store's decent here in Mecklenburg. They got all the hooch you need, but they ain't got my favorite cognac. That's alright though. Service is good, friendly folks. Price is a bit steep, but not too bad. Just a little bit more than I'm used to, that's all."
"Scones, divine. Coffee, fine. Dogs, no. Allergic, me. Sign, needed. Service dogs, okay. Scones, delicious. Daily, made. Go, there."

"Entered the revamped joint, made my way to the great hall. Pictures and paintings, visually stunning, esoteric beauty. Contemporary spot, quiet, smaller than expected, but packs a punch. Worth the 80K spent on reno. Medieval vibes, Scottish history, medicine, war, and recording significant events. Busy gift shop, full eatery. Learn something, spend a few bob. Art, science, medicine, Royal Navy, death masks, migrated families, art history. Visited a few months back, keen to return. Above all, go for the culture, cafe buzz, either way, rewarding."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous sight, this Cheesecake Factory of old,
Whose multiple levels do astound, a marvel to behold.
Located at The Forum Shops' end, connected to Caesar's palace,
'Tis a place of wonder, worth the journey, though long and arduous.

But alas, dear friends, there be two drawbacks, I must confess,
The waiting list, a trial, and the distance, a great test.
Yet fear not, for all else is well, the staff, the food, so fine,
A place to dine, and pass the time, in this fair city of sin.

Nearby, an aquarium grand, and an animatronic show,
Do entertain, and make the wait, a trifle, don't you know.
So if thou art in search of sustenance, and a familiar name,
Come hither, to this Cheesecake Factory, and claim thy fame."

"Hark, what eatery is this, that doth join our midst?
Cafe Zupas, thou art a welcome guest!
Thy bbq chicken salad, a culinary delight,
Didst please mine taste buds, with flavors so bright.
And yonder fun drink bar, where I didst create
My own Italian soda, a wondrous treat indeed!
My spouse, he didst enjoy his summer chicken salad,
And turkey bacon panini, a savory delight.
The chocolate covered strawberry, a sweet surprise,
Didst end our meal most satisfyingly, I do confess.
Cafe Zupas, thy fare is quick, healthy, and fair,
A true delight for those who seek such cuisine rare."

Siam Terrace, a Thai restaurant in Urbana, is one of my favorites. Their red curry, my go-to dish, is a standout. Don't let that sway you, though - the rad nar, pad thai, and other options are also top-notch. It's not a five-star joint, but it's close. The atmosphere can feel a bit cramped with larger groups, but it's still a great spot. The appetizers are solid, with the shrimp being a highlight. It's affordable, too - prices start at around $8.99 for vegetarian, chicken, or tofu options, and a bit higher for meat entrees.

"I found this joint when I lived in Fort Worth, Texas. It's a Brazilian churrascaria, meaning it's a cowboy barbecue. Sounds plain, but it's not. It's an all-you-can-eat meat fest, and I mean that in the best way possible. They got servers walking around with swords of meat, and you got a little disk to flip from red to green, meaning you're ready for more. The salad bar's got some great stuff too, like prosciutto and nice cheeses. And yeah, they got a full bar, and it's top-notch."
"Tangier, a place of wonder. Brewed tea, sweet dates, fresh bread - a feast for the senses. Gracious host, generous with his wares. Decorations, a delight to behold. A journey worth taking."

Tried a few tacos at this joint, three for ten bucks. They were all different, but the Suadero Azteca, that's the queen's special, stood out. Damn thing was flavorful and tender, topped with some real good veggies. Get your own, don't share. Fried fish and shrimp were solid too. Great spot for some unique tacos, but it can add up. You gotta ask for chips and salsa, they won't bring 'em out otherwise, but they're good when you get 'em.
"Good name, good grub. Take out, sit down, or have it delivered. Family-owned Asian joint with all the classics - teriyaki, orange chicken, and more. Worth a visit, always delicious."
"Solid joint for breakfast, better than those chain places. Omelets are good, biscuits and gravy if you're feelin' reckless. They got sandwiches, salads, and smoothies too."

"Went to Il Pizzaiolo with some colleagues last week. Heard great things about the place for years, so it was time to check it out. Had a swell time. 

Started with some vino. Waitress gave us the lowdown on the house wines - #1, #2, and #3. We went with the Pinot Noir and it was pretty damn good. Shared a couple carafes with a buddy. 

Split some apps - Panzarotti and Fiori de Zucca. The fried zucchini was alright, but the Panzarotti was the real deal. Like a fried risotto and mozzarella ball. Damn good. I even grabbed the last one, risking embarrassment. 

For my main course, I got the Ravioli alla Caprese. Simple, but done right. Can't wait to get back to Il Pizzaiolo."

"Went to #1 Brothers for pizza, but they didn't answer the phone.  So, I went to Ari's, the Japanese restaurant in the same plaza.  Good thing too, 'cause the service was top-notch and the sushi was damn good.  I told the girl on the phone about how I'd ordered the spicy tuna handroll before and it was a bit disappointing.  She said she remembered me and knew exactly what I wanted.  And she did.  It was perfect.  I also told her about my favorite specialty roll at my old sushi spot and she suggested something similar.  It was almost as good.  This place is now my go-to sushi spot.  Thanks, Ari, for treating me like a valued customer and not just another face in the crowd."

"Place is good. Go there regular for pedis. Julie and Tammy do good work. Service is top-notch. Only had one issue with a rough pedicure, but Julie fixed it quick. Salon's always clean. Pay $20 plus $5 tip. Price went up to $22 for summer, still worth it."

Hark! What service most excellent didst thou render,
When I, a novice, sought thy hue of paint,
For my humble abode. Thy skilled hand didst guide,
And with swift ease, didst answer all my queries.
Thou didst mix the pigment, and with grace,
Didst present it to me, in a timely space.
My questions, thou didst answer, with a smile,
And I, most grateful, didst depart, in haste.
Thy price, most fair, didst bring me joy,
And thus, my heart doth sing, in praise of thee.

"This joint's got all I need, just a short hop from my digs. Reliable too, when the missus wants some Asian flair in the kitchen. Friendly folk workin' there, happy to lend a hand if you can't locate somethin'. Fresh goods? Meh, they're alright, but the rest? Top-notch."
"Pizza joint with a friendly vibe.  Tasty pies, too.  Olive oil base is top-notch.  Tomato sauce pizzas are meh, but everything else is great.  Salads are big and fresh."

"Been comin' here for years, close to the house and all.  Got a good local crowd, lotta take out too.  Menu's limited, but what they got is hot, fresh, and flavorful.  Hubby loves their sushi. 

You get there, they greet ya, seat ya quick.  Check the specials on the chalkboard by the door.  Like the decor, facilities, plates, utensils, glasses, all clean. 

Staff's efficient, accommodatin'.  Menu's concise, but got enough for most.  Prices are decent, portions are good.  Be back."
"Good burgers. Fresh. Not some greasy mess like that 5 Guys crap. Pricey though. Can't top In-N-Out for quality and cost."
"Dairy Queen doesn't need a review. It's like your mom and pop's place, but for ice cream. Clean joint, quick service, and worth the seven bucks for a waffle cone and a scoop in a cup."

"Liked this joint a lot. Atmosphere was cool, grub was top-notch. Not your average diner. Suggest making a reservation, it was hoppin' when we went. Good spot for kiddos, too. Food was a hit with everyone, great brews, and the dessert menu knocked it outta the park. Service was A+. A swell pick to show our Cleveland pals the Montreal vibe (kid-friendly, of course...)."
"Scottsdale, AZ, had a good one too. Bartenders were top-notch, TVs plentiful, beer selection impressive."

"Mondays, I hit up my local Salisbury's for the weekly shop. It's a big store, but half of it ain't food. That don't make sense to me. Supermarkets should be about grub, not TVs. But hey, it works for 'em, I guess. Just gets frustrating when choices are limited. Freezer section's tiny too. Poor student like me's gotta settle for whatever frozen chips they got. And don't even get me started on the lack of supermarket brands. Sometimes I wanna grab the cheaper option, but they ain't got much to choose from. 

But, I do love their "Oops!" section. It's like finding gold. Reduced meat, perfect for tossing in the freezer. 

Staff's friendly, always chattin' it up. Nice change of pace from the usual supermarket crew."
"Plenty of options here. High-end Euro brands, fancy schmancy stuff. Malt balls, three flavors, not bad. House brand hot cocoa mix, decent. Fun to look around, know all this exists."

"Pets all my life. Observed that when front desk nice, doctors not. Vice versa. Not case at Alta Vista. Hours great. Front desk, techs, doc - friendly, courteous. Price reasonable. Clean, no wet dog smell. Sunday afternoon, pleasant experience."

"View's great here. Food's probably good too, but I didn't try it. Sat at the bar, had a couple dirty martinis with a twist. Service was top-notch, even when one of us had a little mishap with their drink. Doorman at the elevator's cool, just be nice to him and you'll get upstairs for more drinks and a sweet view."

"This joint was our jam, my man and me. Staff was on point, hooked us up with samples of their top sellers. Six dishes, not too shabby for under 25 bucks. Good vibes all around, folks of all sorts gettin' down. Only gripe, cleanliness wasn't their strong suit."
"Atmosphere's top-notch. Bar's where we post up, my man and me. Nachos or enchiladas, don't matter. Service and grub, solid."

"Bun Bo Hue, three stars. Not the best, not the worst. Soup base lacked spice, pork blood was scarce and dry. Rice dish, decent. Coffee, now that's worth mentioning. Coconut flavor, damn good. Check-in, two bucks. That's the way."

"A fine dining establishment within the Golden Nugget inn,
Our service was of high quality, and our group did swell.
The victuals were quite tasty, I must say,
My caprese salad, a delight, started the day.
Scallops and Brussels, oh so sweet,
Grits, a perfect complement, could not be beat.
Lobster, a feast for the eyes, and the taste,
My husband devoured it, no waste.
Crab legs, a wonder to behold,
My nephew, a young lad, had six, stories untold.
Desserts, not the best, but still quite nice,
Pecan ball, a scoop of ice cream, not too thrilling a spice.
Bread pudding, better, with caramel on top,
A hint of rum, a delightful drop.
A minus, alas, for the pineapple cup,
Stained with lipstick, a sight most unpleasant to sup.
Yet, for a large group, the servers did well,
Our meal, overall, was quite swell."
"Good spot for Target. Went there often when I lived nearby. Service and stock were top-notch. Part of Surprise Town Center's shopping hub, surrounded by other great stores."

"Walked by the joint on 7th after five, but it was shuttered tight. Ended up at another spot instead. Got myself an XL bean and cheese burrito, American style. Damn thing was delicious. Can't figure why it's only got two stars."

"Mama-Mia-American-Pizzeria, a joint Jungleboy digs. Colorful, multi-level spot with funky decor. We grabbed a table for two and ordered a 9-inch pie with pepperoni, mushrooms, and chili peppers. Damn good pizza, crust included. Friendly service, too. They checked in on us, kept our drinks full, and let us take leftovers to go. Only gripe: it got chilly by the door. But hey, that didn't stop me from wavin' at the peeps outside, wondering what the hell was goin' on in there. Recommended for a quick bite or a fun night out with the fam."
"Cozy joint with a diverse menu. Sat on the patio, lovely atmosphere. Sliders, top-notch. I'll be back."

"Met up with an old buddy at this joint, had a couple cold ones. Beer selection ain't huge, but what they got is good stuff. No need to spend an hour deciding, just grab one and enjoy. Place itself is dark and cozy inside, but the real magic happens outside. Feels like a backyard BBQ, with giant Jenga, chess, cornhole, and three ping pong tables. First thought it was some dude's yard they slapped a bar on, but after playin' some games, realized it's actually pretty damn great. Perfect spot for an afternoon hangout."

"Saturday afternoon, had a swell time at the local pub. Grub was top-notch, beer was pure gold, and the staff knew their stuff. Did a tasting, had a blast jawin' about brews. Place could use a bit of sprucin' up, but the waitress said they host beer dinners and I reckon they'd be a real treat."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous sight, this new establishment in our fair 'hood,
A renovation most grand, of a structure quite odd, yet full of charm.
Uptown doth flourish, by my troth, and this place doth play its part.

Aye, on First Friday eve, our merry band of seven didst gather round,
And lo, our number didst swell, to eight, nay nine, in this joyful crowd.
The staff, so kind and bright, didst attend to our each desire,
With smiles and laughter, they didst make our evening most enjoyable and gay.

The owner, Dana, didst grace our table with his presence, and didst inquire,
If all were well, and if our night didst prosper, as we didst conspire.
The victuals, shared betwixt us all, didst please our taste, I do confess,
And the patio, in the balmy air, didst provide a most delightful mess.

Verily, these moments, these are the times that make our life most sweet,
For in such places, with such folk, doth one find true joy, and peace doth meet."

"Wait wasn't too bad, 'bout forty minutes, even though it was nine o'clock on a Tuesday. Prices were a bit steep, but hey, it's Vegas, right? Did a light dinner with five of us, couple tapas plates each. Gin and tonic, real smooth, nice presentation, nerdy cool ice cubes. Marinated mussels, came in a little tin, steamed mussels, good, order bread to soak up the juice. Meat platter, house cured meat was the best. Brussels sprout salad, delicious! Sautéed shrimp, good, skirt steak with grilled bell pepper, tasty. Asparagus, good, but ten tiny spears for twelve bucks? Nice sauce, good with bread. Quail, small but yummy. Tomato bread, oh man, so good! Service was great, atmosphere was chill. Lovely evening."

"Went to Lenscrafters after striking out at Chandler Mall. Donna, a peach of a gal, helped me out. Tried on a bunch of frames, took a break to feed the baby, and Donna got to work on my insurance. Turns out, the optometrist screwed up my coverage. Donna made some calls, but they were closed. Told me to come back the next day. She had it fixed by then. Got my specs and was happy with the service. Donna and Heather, those two were the real deal."

"This joint's my fave for lunch meetings and dinners with the missus. Got a real local vibe, friendly staff, clean digs, and grub that hits the spot. That green tomatillo salsa? Can't get enough. Salmon and shrimp tacos, highly recommend 'em. Service ain't always the best, but that's part of the charm. Young servers, learnin' the ropes, addin' to the laid-back atmosphere."

"Good grub, friendly joint, modern vibe, gay as hell. That's Switch in a nutshell. Been meaning to try the place for months, but the missus ain't a fan of Sunday brunch. Finally made it last week, too late for the brunch menu and cheap Bloody Marys. But hey, we got a carafe anyway, decent drink for six bucks. Generic, sure, but worth every penny. Had myself a damn fine burger, loaded with guac, salsa, and jalapenos. Nice touch with the house-made ceasar salad too. Service was top-notch, friendly folks. I'll be back for more, especially for that sweet brunch action."

A plague upon the house of MadHouse, say I!
For when I venture to their website nigh,
My browser doth cry out in warning loud,
Of trojans lurking, danger proud.

I fear the site is infected, full of woe,
And thus, good sirs, take heed of this, I pray thee,
Lest ye be stricken down by digital foe,
And cursed with maladies of cyber-sea.

Take note, fair owners of MadHouse, heed my words,
And purge thy site of malice and misdeeds,
That thou mayst once again be safe and sound,
And visitors, untroubled, may thy wares behold.

"Hark! All ye seekers of greenery and blooms,
In Las Vegas, there doth lie a nursery most supreme,
'Tis Star Nursery, where thy garden's dreams are made,
A place where flowers, shrubs, and trees are arrayed.

A youthful passion for plants did once ignite,
When fifteen summers had I seen the light,
I worked at nursery, 'twas my first employ,
And thus, my love for landscapes did enjoy.

Now, as I stroll through rows of flora fair,
My heart doth sing with joy, and memories rare,
For all the plants and materials herein found,
Are of the highest quality, and well renowned.

So, gentle readers, heed my words of cheer,
And shun the mediocre, the lowly gear,
At Star Nursery, thou shalt find the best,
To make thy garden flourish, and be blessed."
"Vegas, baby. Get yerself a fine 'adult slurpee' outside the Imperial Palace. Bring it on in, sing some karaoke, and enjoy. That's how you pre-game, my friend."

"Defalco's, a solid spot, but slow, and limited healthy options. But hey, you know what you're getting into when you walk into a fast food joint. Food's top-notch, like you're in Italy. Ordering system's old school, like back east, adds to the wait. Worth it though. I'm from NY, and good Italian delis are scarce in Phoenix. Friend introduced me, and now I crave it when I'm near. Tried the eggplant, chicken, and cheese steak, all good. Bring a friend, order different sandwiches, share."

"Travel Zoo coupon, app/entree/dessert. Combo app, naturally. Alligator, tough. Frog's legs, tough too. Crabcake, great. Gumbo, good. Jambalaya, great. Not New Orleans, but close. Atmosphere, New Orleans-esque. Portions, large."
"Politician's paradise. White-haired men, dignified. Special occasions, celebrate here. Waitstaff, polite, charming, witty. French cuisine, exquisite. Escargot, a must."

Hark! This place we frequent on Fridays eve,
With friends, who gather 'round, a merry throng.
The victuals here, of quality quite high,
Lamb meatballs, Johnny's nachos, doth satisfy.
Even their ranch dressing, a delight,
Forsooth, I say, a fan of ranch, I be not.
Guinness stew, a hearty brew, doth warm the cockles.

Alas, a quibble, there doth lie,
In price, a tad too steep, doth make me sigh.
Beers, six silver pieces, a pint, doth cost,
And sandwiches, twelve, a sum, doth boast.
A shave, a couple bucks, wouldst make it fair,
And five stars, they wouldst surely snare.

Yet, service here, doth shine so bright,
Friendly servers, keep up, with all our plight.
They split the checks, with ease and grace,
And laugh with us, in this merry place.
So, four stars, I give, with nary a frown,
For here, we shall return, again and again, anon.

"Rice, price, and spice bring me here. Salmon bowl with brown rice and heat, under $7. Line up, menu on the wall, Japanese fare, chicken teriyaki, options galore. I go for salmon, $5.99, not fried, decent lunch price. Teriyaki sauce too much, light on the sauce. Upgrade to brown rice, $0.25. Condiments, hot chili powder, sauce, sliced green onion. Appreciate the onions. Low scores, Japanese flavors lack punch compared to Chinese and Thai."

"Popular joint, long line. Can't do much about it. Servers were attentive, cleared plates. Minor gripe: they leave utensils on the table. I like to keep 'em clean. Nice touch with the replacement utensils, though. Variety of grub, expensive dishes. Worth the $40 per head. Crab legs, lobster ravioli, prime rib, creme brulee. Complimentary drinks too. Raspberry iced tea, sodas."
"Great joint. Good prices, friendly bartenders - some real lookers too. Screens are top-notch, grub's delicious."
"Clean, new joint. Plenty parking, friendly staff. And, yeah, fat-free. Good spot."

"Marquee's a hot mess, but glamorous, =)
No dress code, some girls in flats and leggings, guys in tennis shoes and tees.
Lines to get in are ridiculous, but bouncers keep it under control, chaos organized.
Navigating's a challenge, stairs are killers, dance floor's too crowded, feels like a can of sardines, but worth it.
DJ and entertainers are great, sound system's crazy, bartenders are good looking and nice."
"Clean, nice joint. Good grub. Went on a Thursday, reserved a table, and had the place mostly to ourselves. Get the Manchurian Chicken - it's tasty."

"Hark, fair friends! Take heed my words of wisdom ere ye step into yon box office. 'Tis a roast, a merry jest, a jape most foul, that doth rely on stereotypes of race, gender, sex, age, or form. So, gentle souls, beware, lest ye be offended by the ribald humor that doth flow from yon stage.

"Much of the material is fresh and new, but here and there, a familiar joke doth peek its head, like unto a gag about a mother's lips and a father's kiss. Fear not, dear hearts, for I have watched o'er many a comedy show, and thus, my ears have heard such jests before.

"But fear not, for 'tis a merry romp, a hoot most hearty! Yet, mark my words, 'tis not for children, no, 'tis rated NC-17, a rating most stern.

"The venue, alas, is small, and thus, thou art not hidden, nor canst thou hide. So, prithee, be prepared to join the fray, to be a part of yon merry jest, a willing participant in the roast most ripe!"

"Hark! The crab cake, a dish most divine,
In this fair town, doth reign supreme.
And if thou dost desire a salad,
With salmon, blackened, 'tis a dream.
A game changer, indeed, 'twill be.

And if beef be thy heart's desire,
The marinated flank steak, a delight.
Heaven on a fork, 'twill surely fire.

The bar, spacious and well-appointed,
Doth offer full service, food and drink,
And many a TV, for merriment.

Bon appetit, my friends, enjoy!"

"Mocha, decent brew, in hipster haven found, 
Loud, angry tunes, my youthful days rebounds. 
Fare, fair priced, and drinks, a cheerful sound. 
Gingered whiskey, remedy, I'll return to drown."

"Verily, the Excalibur doth boast a virtue rare,
A price most fair, a value beyond compare.
Through Expedia, the room didst cost but $27,
A sum most reasonable, a price most humble, indeed.
And though the resort fee doth add $15 more,
'Tis worth it, for the perks it doth provide in store.
A $20 credit, for food and drink, doth come,
To be used at bars, or the steakhouse, a sumptuous some.
A free play, at the Dungeon, doth await,
A midway arcade, where fun doth never abate.
Alas, no match plays, in the coupon book, didst lie,
But still, the deal doth seem most fortuitous, and nigh.

The room, spacious and grand, doth please the eye,
With a large TV, and ethernet, for speedy surfing, nearby.
The beds, soft and inviting, doth cradle thee,
With three pillows, for extra comfort, dost see.
The elevators, quick and efficient, doth take thee high,
To floors 18 and up, for a rapid, smooth ride, doth fly.

The casino, alas, doth disappoint,
With shuffler machines, that doth impede the play.
Most minimums, $10, doth set the bar,
For table games, a sum, not quite so rare."
"Went to this joint for the first time. Service was top-notch. Staff was friendly as hell. Definitely coming back. Would recommend it to anyone."

"Methought I had a reservation at a steakhouse of note,
But my heart was not in it, so I didst decide to roam.
I walked along the strip, and saw many a place,
But none didst strike my fancy, nor didst win my grace.

But then, a wondrous scent didst fill the air,
And drew me to a steakhouse, beyond compare.
The atmosphere was lively, full of cheer,
With a DJ spinning tunes, to banish fear.

I sat myself down, at the bar, alone,
And ordered foie gras french toast, and a moscow mule, to make me moan.
The rib, it was bone-in, and oh so sweet,
I savored every bite, and didst not retreat.

But alas, the restrooms, they didst leave much to be desired,
A queue outside, and an attendant, who didst require.
May I use the bathroom, sir? I didst ask,
But nay, they didst command, with a stern task.

I shall return to Vegas, soon, to celebrate my son,
For this steakhouse, it didst win my heart, and won.
So, I shall come again, with joy and glee,
To dine and revel, in this place, so free."

"Haven't been to Nello's in a while. Friend suggested it for lunch. Busy place, but we were seated quick. Gotta get the pizza, right? Ordered a large, thick crust with bacon, basil, mushroom, and half with sausage. Damn good, but they forgot the basil. Bummer. Garlic bread was solid though. Waiter was easy on the eyes and gave top-notch service."

"By Jove, what a find in Las Vegas' midst! 
To Rio we went, a show to behold, and supped before. 
No reservations made, our folly, yet kind hostess offered us a place at the bar, cozy and inviting. 
A meatball appetizer, recommended by a fellow patron, oh so delectable! Worthy of return, I say! 
Then, the specials, one scallop dish for me, and sea bass for my mate, both bursting with flavor, freshness abounding, truly divine! 
Back I would go, in a trice, for such a feast! 
Locals, take note, T.Rewards card and NV ID, 25% off, a steal! And show-goers, 20% discount, with ticket stubs, a bonanza indeed!"

I headed to downtown Vegas for a show, stopped for grub at Bar + Bistro. My bad, it was First Friday in the Arts District, and they had a limited menu. Oh well.

I went for two tapas plates and a sweet treat. Started with their roasted tomato soup - damn good. Then, their 5 cheese mac and cheese, a mix of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego, roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp. Gigli pasta. Tasty stuff.

Finished with a warm chocolate ganache cake. Also, damn good. Came with a tiny scoop of sorbet. Perfect.

Would've liked to try the full menu, but I still got a taste of their good eats. A bit pricey, maybe. Liked the decor though. Palettes for tables, metal wells. Thought I spilled something a few times, but it was just paint splatters. Got me every time.

"Late night Tempe, we needed grub. Not in the mood to drive, opted for delivery. Took an hour, pretty standard. Food arrived, everyone loved it. Chicken bruchetta pita, excellent though small. Two pitas recommended for the hungry. Traditional hummus, subpar. Four stars instead of five. That's my review."

"Coffee joint with high ceilings, good coffee, and friendly staff. Close to my office, so I stop by for lunch sometimes. Their little toasts are top-notch, loaded with stuff like egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, and various meats. Desserts look great, but I'm usually too full. Pricey, but the grub's good, so that helps."

"Went to a friend's birthday party at a comedy club. Liked the cozy atmosphere. Not usually a fan of comedy, but laughed at three out of four acts. Next door, a Fetish Ball was happening, which confused me at first. Thought it was part of the comedy club's dress code, but then saw the neon sign and realized it was separate. Great spot for a weekend night out. No need for assless chaps, but they're not forbidden either."

"Thai cuisine most delectable, served by a maiden fair and bright. Green curry with veggies and tofu, my heart did sing with delight. My comrade, broccoli chicken and spring rolls did partake, and her taste buds did dance with joy. Atmosphere, a humble abode, but 'tis not why we doth seek. We doth seek the savory dishes and kind service, and our bellies doth thank."

"My pug's gotten top-notch care at Squaw Peak. Staff's kind, appointments are easy to come by, and the wait's never long. They treat my dog like he's their own, just like others have said. 

Found a pup at work, brought him in, and he had distemper. Vet said putting him down was best. Asked about the cost, and the vet covered it, no charge. 

They've been cool about billing me for vet care and letting me make payments when I'm struggling financially. But I wasn't stoked about getting a collections notice after making a payment that covered most of what I owed. Billing person said I could make another payment this month, $70, and just needed to call in and arrange it. Considering how well they've treated me, figure it was just a mistake."

"Hark! At last, I've arrived at this famed eatery,
Whose praises my friends have oft sung to me.
The victuals, they be of fair quality,
And the surroundings, not of the usual ilk,
Of Japanese taverns, that doth oft astound.
I shall return, forsooth, anon, with haste,
For this night's repast hath won my heart, in sooth,
In love with it, I am, and that's no jest."

"Hark! What eatery is this, so full of charm?
The window seat, a view of fountains in the park.
Foie gras, a delight, and hamachi, quite fine.
But alack, the duck, a disappointment divine.
Underseasoned, o'ercooked, a shame to behold.
Yet, our server, attentive and quick to unfold
A new dish, sea bass, a savory treat.
A worthy substitute, our taste buds to greet."

"Came in with a big group on June 22nd in the evening. Sat at a table with games to pass the time. Hubby got the miso salmon, I had a burger and fries. Food was good, service was good too. Till the bill came. They sorted it out for all of us, which was nice. But then I saw they added a gratuity. Now, I ain't got no problem with auto grat, but I got a problem with not tellin' us about it. Some folks double tipped without knowin', which wasn't their intention. Told the others on my side, they appreciated the heads-up. Maybe it ain't the restaurant's policy, but the server's. Still, shady practice, that."
"Best steak in Vegas. Seats comfy, place hoppin'. Lobster apps pricey, but damn good. Staff sharp. Can't wait to go back, sans lobster."

"3.75 stars. First LV store I visited, aside from the one in Japan. Security guards gave me the hairy eyeball, bored outta their minds. Other nice stores at Caesars, they'd smile, say have a good night. Purse bar was cool, associate showed us 7-10 bags, took off the protection tape. Forgot her name, but she was patient, helpful. Disappeared for a bit after we decided, but still recommend it if you're serious. Even if they ignore you, like they did me."
"Good spread at their lunch buffet. Veggie and meat options, plenty to choose from. Desserts are top-notch, especially the garlic naan. Friendly staff too."

"Methinks 'tis a fine establishment, with ambiance most pleasant,
And victuals that doth please mine taste, in quantity not too copious,
Lest choosing take an age, and thus, my friends, I do recommend,
The Raspberry Soda, verily, most delectable and sweet."

"Leaving this joint, I've always been a happy camper. Their bar's got some serious style, bottles lit up like a Christmas tree. But the lighting's crap, like someone's shining a flashlight under their face. Not exactly flattering.

I go for the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna, it's a real treat. Slaw's got a great taste, soy dressing, and a kick of wasabi. Not a fish place, but I'm on a seafood binge and their Blacked Fish Sandwich hits the spot. Cooked to perfection, love the sauce. Steamed broccoli's fresh and tasty, but skip the honey roasted carrots, they're drenched in sugar syrup. Gross.

Dessert's not my thing here. Too much white chocolate for my taste."

"This joint's the real deal in Sun Prairie. Been here six times, never disappointed. Steak, fish, whatever you want, it's all good. Kids' meals are just right, they actually eat 'em. Menu and beer selection change up, so it's always worth comin' back. Get busy on Fridays, but that's what happens when a place is doin' things right. Fills a gap in this town."

"Filet Mignon, damn good. Sauce, didn't need steak sauce, but still good. Service, top-notch. Waiter, friendly. Water, always full. Price, reasonable. Frites, too salty. Great spot for lunch, sunny day."
"Clean joint. Spacious rooms. Fair price. Quiet location, less foot traffic. Fresh air. Plenty to do: beach, mall, bars, clubs, spa."

We waited 30 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. Sat outside, great for people watching. Ordered caesar salad, arrived fast, delicious, loved the cheese and dressing. Also got quiche lorraine, brought back memories of my childhood, amazing, filling, couldn't finish it! Friendly, attentive service. Food came quick, barely finished my salad before lunch arrived. Boyfriend had warm chicken and brie sandwich, with apple and caramelized onions, absolutely delicious. Great experience, great food, elegant atmosphere. Will definitely dine here again in Vegas.

"Hark! What store is this? A place most wondrous,
Where kitchen wares of finest sort are found.
Chrome and shiny, all so fine and fair,
A sight to behold, beyond compare.

And as thou shopp'st, a cup of coffee they'll bring,
Whilst demonstrating their most excellent brewing machine.
A pleasant experience indeed, doth make thy day sing.
For in this store, all things are quite divine,
A veritable haven for kitchen queens and kings."

"I like my clothes with a bit of city swag, but I ain't got no problem with that. This place had some nice gear, and I loved the idea of looking sharp without breaking the bank. It was a big joint, lots of variety - from streetwear to suits and everything in between. They even had some accessories. My only beef was the lack of service outside of the fitting rooms. But hey, at these prices, I ain't gonna complain too much."

"Hark! Union Pig & Chicken doth boast most wondrous BBQ,
In Pittsburgh's fair city, none can compare thee.
The brisket, soft and tender, doth fall apart with ease,
Yet some pieces, alas! Do suffer from excess fat, methinks.

The service, decent though slow, doth not detract from the feast,
For Union's sandwiches, they be a true delight, I swear.
And mark my words, good sir! The mac & cheese, a must-try dish,
For it, thy taste buds shall sing with joy, in sweet surprise.

So gather 'round, friends! And heed my words of cheer,
For Union Pig & Chicken, a culinary gem, doth appear."

"Hark! To this place didst I come with mine husband and our two teenage sprites, that we might partake of their sweet and frozen delights. And verily, each of us didst choose a different concoction, that we might share and savor together. The employees, kind and courteous, didst serve us with a smile and a song. But alas, good sir! The cost of these delectable draughts doth trouble me sore, for they be priced too steeply, methinks. Yet still, I wish they were less dear, that I might indulge in them the more oft."

"Walnut Grill, a joint I frequent for a post-work tipple or a swift, satisfying meal. Their menu, a twist on classic American fare. Wine list, top-notch. Atmosphere, lively. Recently expanded bar area, more seating, cozy booths. Servers, attentive, memorable. Live music, some nights. You'll find me here, regularly."
"Manager read my review, called me up, and apologized. Haven't been back since, but he said it'll be different next time. Fired the server who messed up my order. Lookin' forward to tryin' it again."

"Hark! 'Tis wondrous news, a Steak N Shake doth come to our fair valley! My heart doth sing with joy, for their Frisco melt, a feast most divine, doth please mine taste buds. The place, it doth shine with cleanness, and the service, it doth flow with friendliness. A strange sight, indeed, yet one I doth welcome. 

Alas, they doth not keep open, like other Steak N Shakes of old, for twenty-four hours a day. A pity, that. Nor doth they possess the peppers, a fact most vexing. Yet, despite these shortcomings, I doth find solace in their smaller menu. A milkshake, though, of poor quality, doth mar their reputation. Fear not, dear friends, for I shall look past these flaws, and savor my Frisco melt, with fries and cheese sauce, anon!"
"McDonald's, yeah. I get it. But this one's got my loyalty. Fast service, friendly too. Coffee, hash browns, in and out in five minutes, tops."

"Ox tail soup, that's what they're known for. California Hotel, late night spot. Fans of the soup, this is the place. Hawaiian and Filipino influence on the menu. Check in on Facebook, it'll say Home of the Ox Tail Soup. Tips: 1. Wait in line, be prepared. 2. No peanuts, that's the way to go. 3. Validate your parking ticket, don't forget."

"Hark! The place doth please mine eyes, and food, most wondrous fair!
I chose the market fish, a dish divine, so tender and so rare.
The meat, oh how it melted in mine mouth, like snow in spring's warm air.
And other dishes, duck and pork, didst tempt mine taste, so bright and bold,
A feast fit for a king, or queen, or noble of the land, I do avow!"

"Clean joint. Fridge's stocked, gym's decent. Internet's a pain though - gotta renew every 24 hours, and it costs ten bucks a pop. Breakfast's meh, unless you customize it. Room service tray got left outside my door till the next day. Other than that, no complaints. Location's good, staff's attentive, stay's pleasant."

"Local fella at a liquor store turned me onto this joint a couple years back. Been comin' here ever since, whenever I'm in Vegas. Only had the pizza and wings, but they hit the spot real good, especially after a long night of drinkin'. It's just down the street from the Stratosphere, so it's easy to find. You can tell it's a local hangout, but don't let that scare you off. Good eatin', no frills."

"Methought their crab legs were most delectable,
In line I stood, a lengthy queue to behold,
Cracked they were, no labor did they require,
A feast fit for a king, or so I did infer.

Sushi, fresh as dawn's early dew, they had,
Bite-sized desserts, a delightful array,
Gelato in flavors diverse and bright,
A treat for the taste buds, a wondrous sight.

White chocolate, edible silver balls,
Soft center, a delight that enthralls,
Picky I may be, yet much did please,
At Todai, a buffet of wonder, if thou please.

Alas, the price, a trifle high, I thought,
Bellagio, a better choice, I had sought,
Aquariums circular, a sight to behold,
Tropical desserts, a culinary gold.

Escalator down, to the buffet thou shalt find,
Todai, a feast, for reasonable price, doth bind."

"In fair Las Vegas, where night never fades,
A haven for hunger, 'gainst fast-food shades,
Quality dishes, fit for royal taste,
Pit stop, fill up, drink up, and haste!

Back to the Strip, with spirit renewed,
Leave Mickey D's and Denny's unprowed,
For here, a meal that doth satisfy,
And portion sizes, most generous, doth lie.

So heed my words, fair traveler, and make haste,
To this eatery, where hunger finds its feast,
And leave the rest, to their own devices,
For here, thy belly shall be well-pleased."

"XS, we ended up there after Hakkansan turned us away. Not disappointed, no sir. Inside, gorgeous. Outside, great spot for tunes and fresh air. Danced the night away with Rusko. Definitely worth a visit."
"This joint serves up one of the best spreads in town, and for a steal too. I'd come back for more, no question."
"East coast, noodles, good. Thinking 'bout 'em still. Next time, straight there."
"Good grub here, mate. Vodka cokes for 12 bucks, can't beat that. Had a blonde server, Marcia or Mercy, something like that. She was pleasant."

"Hark! 'Twas a fair day, and I didst venture forth
To partake of sustenance at yonder inn.
The hour of noon had struck, and thus the crowd
Did swell, and service slowed, yet still, I found
