The staff to be most courteous and kind.
A smile did light their faces, and their speech
Was gentle as they tended to my needs.
The cashier, with haste, didst take my pay,
And swiftly gave me change, with thanks, I pray."

"I checked out some Yelp reviews, then hit up Ingleside Grooming. First impressions weren't great - the lady seemed annoyed with my questions. But I still wanted her to groom my pet. Next day, I was late dropping her off. Told her my pet gets nervous and poops at Petsmart/vet. She was cool about it. Felt good. When I picked my pet up, the same lady gave me the lowdown on how well-behaved she was and how great she looked. Cost was fair too. Give 'em a shot."

"Yelp led me here. Glad it did. Great Sonoran dogs. Two filled me up. First visit, sketchy comms. Asked about dog varieties, got a shrug. Second time, better. Helpful staff, clean joint. Not the ritziest hood, but worth it for the grub."
"Saw a billboard on our way, Seinfeld was performing that night. Couldn't pass it up. Got seats near the back, but the view and sound were still top-notch. Great spot for live acts."

"Liked the show. Some cheese, but mostly excellent. Something for everyone, done with taste and art. 

Twins killed it, big girls owning the stage. Rest of the bodies, lean dancers, real breasts—hooray! 

Choreography, beautiful, tasteful, poignant. Not just shock, but love, lust, joy, pain, pleasure, desire, distress, giving, taking, physical, emotional, silly, fun. Human animal, full circle. 

Standouts: African dancer, suspended bondage, water gymnasts, transvestite torch singer. That red cape, spectacular. 

Must-see. Would go back, enjoyed every minute."

"10am at Poppy's. Bagels, a dozen. My plan? Play Bagel Fairy all day with the best damn bagels in Charlotte. 

Fair distribution, but I had to test the merchandise first. Two in one sitting, no regrets. Coffee was mediocre, but who cares when the bagels are top-notch? A+ in the bagel department. Shame about the cheese and slices though, Bore's Head just doesn't cut it. 

No more Bruegger's for me. No more torturing Owen. Poppy bagels, Poppy love."
"Cool joint, good people, comfy vibes. Affordable drinks and grub, tasty too. Happy hour deals, sweet. Gets packed, but always a blast."

"I did something in Vegas I don't usually do. Ate dinner solo. Party of one, they call it. And it was great. Booking was easy, warm welcome, friendly service. Food was outstanding, foie gras stood out. Reasonably priced, got half-bottles of champagne and Chateauneuf du Pape for $88. Fellow next to me, French-speaking Jason Statham lookalike, also eating solo. Turned out he was from Ottawa, hockey talk and all, killed the romantic vibe."
"Whataburger's my spot for chicken strips. They hook you up with some toast too. That's the way to do it."

"Good grub, clean joint. We had the alloush and June's special - mushroom melt. Both were tasty, no doubt. But a couple things kept it from being a five-star affair. Bread was soft, not crunchy like we expected. And the greens on the sandwich? Limp, not fresh. Maybe that's just me, though. Still, worth checking out. Just know what you're getting into."

"Been twice in recent years. Enjoyed Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly. Great performances, but pricey. Can only afford cheap seats. Narrow up there. Might splurge next time. Check for pre-show lecture. Worth the time, and you might score better parking."

"Starbucks here's a good spot. Service is snappy, even when it's busy. Wi-fi's a crap shoot, but that's not their fault. Problem is, like most places downtown, you gotta watch out for the homeless. They take up tables, beg for change. Can't blame Starbucks for that. City's gotta handle it."
"Strip-side joint. People-watch, drink hard, DJ booth coming. Summer hotspot."

"This joint? Love it. Been coming here since '96. Vegan-friendly, you know? Had the papaya salad and fresh spring rolls last night. Minty, but still good. Dinner number three, that's what I had. Came with a fried roll, coconut soup, and pad thai. Spicy, even though I asked for mild. Never had that before. Service was quick and friendly. I'll be back for one of their lunch deals."

Ikea for Prez.

Imagine a gov like Ikea—efficient, affordable, useful. Faux wood, real wood, options galore. Help's decent, 7/10 times. Got everything you need—string, bags, dollies, measuring tape, pencils, notepads.

Personally, I dig Hemnes (real wood!). Bought it for my master bedroom, living room. Excellent results. Did Malm too (haven't we all?). Small investment, years of use.

Downside's the directions. No words, just pictures. Need patience, a clear head. Gentleman friend assembles; I hand him the pieces and step back.
"Lived close by, passed it often. Wife called, wanted lunch brought over. Gyros hit the spot, no disappointment. Meat stacked high, sauce just right, fresh pita. Great midday meal."

"Anniversary weekend, suggest DW Bistro to the husband. Had been there two weeks prior with the girls, amazing. Husband impressed by the smell alone, rare for a former restaurateur. Split a house salad, mixed greens, fruit, cheese, nuts - a must-have. Short rib sandwich and salmon, both perfectly cooked, great flavors. Our waiter, top-notch, personable. Looking forward to trying their brunch."

"The performances were top-notch, like something straight out of America's Got Talent. Good mix of acts, solid characters, and some fresh material. 

I paid $23 for a mojito in a skinny glass. It was a damn good drink, but as a local, I couldn't help thinking about all the grub I could've gotten for that price. =p

All in all, the entertainment blew away my expectations. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it delivered."

"Eddie D's got a new regular, 'Sir Robert.' Used to be 'Bobby,' but now he's buffed up and calling himself 'Sir.' Tough exterior, but still the same soft, sweet stuffing on the inside. He's taking gravy baths now, trying to impress the ladies. And it's working - they can't resist the six-inch Robert. But for the bigger gals, he's got a twelve-inch transformation. Don't miss out, lonely lunchers. Hit up Eddie D's and find Sir Robert waiting for you."

"Paradise Bakery, great spot. Friendly staff, but lines can get long when it's busy. Love their apple cinnamon and blueberry muffins, always consistent. Nice rewards program too, easy to earn freebies if you're a regular. Only downside, sometimes pushy home business types hog the booths on weekdays. Whole families with screaming kids on weekends. Other locations don't have this issue, maybe it's the hotel next door."
"Mattress Factory? Amazing. Unique installations. Can't find elsewhere in the city."

"Avalon in Oakland, loved it. Passed one in Mt Lebo, had to stop. Funny clothes in the window, neon sign. Typical layout, pants, shirts, dresses. Nice area up front with bags and jewelry. Higher-end selection too, for the desperate housewives. Good selection, not as stylish as Buffalo Exchange though. Wide shoe selection. Affordable prices. Friendly cashier, talked about our fave stores. Pros: doesn't smell like cat pee, organized, great design, affordable. Cons: could use some inventory clearance, whiny women shop there. Overall: great place to stop when broke, still wanna spend, and avoiding Urban Outfitters. Definitely making it a regular spot."
"This joint's shut down? Damn shame. Good eatery, that one. Now I gotta find some other joint for my grub."

In sooth, a most excellent hostelry,
New, modern, and free from smoke and fumes,
A haven from the din and noise of town,
Where one might find some peace and quiet rest.

The height of luxury, the twenty-ninth floor,
A lofty perch, with views of the city's sprawl,
And in the chamber, shades that closed with ease,
A spacious bath, and toilet that did flush with speed.

But alas, the prices in the marketplace,
Did border on the steep and rather high,
Yet still, a latte in the morn did grace,
My day with joy, and banished sleepy eyes.

And thus, we made use of the valet's skill,
Who parked our carriage with dispatch and grace,
And found ourselves within the halls, ere long,
Our room, a haven, and a pleasant space.
"Food was decent. Fries were lackin' flavor, but the service made up for it - our waitress was a sourpuss when my gal asked for more mayo."

"This joint's my favorite spot in Vegas. Been to over ten hotels in this town, but this one takes the cake. Got the M Life card, so I get treated right. Rooms are big and the staff's friendly. Pool's got a sweet beach vibe, especially when it's scorching outside. Burger Bar's my go-to. Their Kobe burger's top-notch. \n\nOnly two things that bug me. One, it's turned into a family place. Not a bad thing, just not my scene. Two, TVs are old and not HD. But hey, that's just a minor gripe."

"Hark! I've visited Vanguard many a time, my dear,
For 'tis a place of wonder, where cocktails do shine so bright.
The bar, it doth gleam, and service, it doth flow,
Even on nights most busy, ne'er a wait doth grow.

My taste, it doth vary, but here, I doth confess,
The Jack Rose, 'tis my heart's desire, my sweetest mess.
Apple brandy, maple syrup, black cherry, oh how grand,
A drink most wondrous, that doth please my every hand.

Indeed, all drinks, they doth delight, but beware,
After two or three, a break, thou must prepare.
For on weekend nights, the DJ doth play his tune,
And Fremont's folk, they doth come, their dance, they doth croon.

In conclusion, Vanguard, 'tis a place most fine,
Where cocktails flow, and merriment doth entwine."

"Hark! We dined here this eve, and oh, the feast was fair! Our steaks and fish, cooked to perfection, did delight. But alas, the service, slow it was, and we did wait, a good hour or more, for our repast. And yet, to mark my grandfather's day, they gave him truffles in a box, and a gift card of twenty-five crowns.

Food rating, four and a half stars, I say. Service rating, three, alack!"

"Bamboo Club, good eatery. Outdoor seating, nice. Decor, theme, all good. Got there late, sat outside. Food, good. Pad Thai, appetizers, all good. Tuna, frozen. My bad. Maybe their fault, heard they can get fresh fish. Ambiance, good. Service, bad. Waiter, douche bag. Recap, good place, good food, avoid seafood, waiter needs a kick."
"Bar closes at 10pm. Western theme, wagon wheels, peanuts, fries - all bad. Hamburgers, guacamole - good. Cookies - untested, but rumored to be decent."

"ShooGoo was a solid joint, four stars easy. Good grub, American fare, big servings, attentive staff. But missing that je ne sais quoi for five stars. 

My filet with Béarnaise sauce, top-notch. Mushroom Gorgonzola app, the real highlight. Mmm. 
View wasn't bad either, but that's Sedona for ya. Sunny AZ, yow, bill."

Krispy Kreme, a gift from the gods. Passing by, that neon Hot & Now sign calls like a siren. Can't resist. Never been let down by those melty, glazed dreams. Staff, fast and efficient. Pulls a dozen in no time. Inside, fun for kids. Conveyor belt churns out doughnuts. A place of pure joy. Not just breakfast or snack, but happiness. Only gripe, accessibility. Hard to get in and out. Independence, a busy street. But worth it. Love Krispy Kreme, except for their strange spelling. Onward for Hot & Now doughnuts!

"Pittsburgh's got another dive bar that's worth checkin' out. They got this Penn Pumpkin Roll that's pure gold, but make sure you ask 'em to sprinkle some cinnamon and sugar on the rim. It's like drinkin' a slice of pumpkin pie. And don't forget to try their Sprecher, it's a hard root beer that tastes just like the real deal. They got an upstairs too, if you need some extra elbow room or a sweet view."

"First time at this spot, and it was a swell evening. Seats all around the stage, so the acting's for everyone. Singing was top-notch, wigs a bit cheesy, but who cares? Crowd was mostly old folks, so they'd whisper loud enough to hear themselves. Still, they were having a blast, so no big deal. Tip: get there early, parkings fills up fast. Lots of joints nearby for dinner and a show."

"Kelly's, good joint for meetin' friends, havin' a drink, maybe some grub too. I dig it here. Plenty spots to chill, make new pals or catch up with old ones. \nPricey? Yeah, a bit. Service slow? Yeah, but it's Old Town, what you gonna do? \nAnd if you're feelin' hungry, their short ribs are top-notch. Five stars, easy."

"Methinks 'twas fate that led me to this place,
For oft I passed it by, with nary a thought,
But then, my dearest friend, anon, didst suggest
We stop and dine within its walls, ere we sought
Our next adventure. And, by Jove, how glad
Was I that we didst tarry! For, as we stepped
Inside, the noise of South Boulevard didst fade,
And we were transported to a different shade.
The decor, most elegant and fine, didst greet
Our eyes, and we didst feel most welcome, straight.
The prices, mayhap a bit steep, yet worth
The cost, for portions grand and plentiful didst girth.
The staff, most courteous and kind, didst strive
To make our evening pleasant, and our lives
Didst seem most joyful. Nay, the owner himself
Didst offer us free drinks, and who couldst resist?
A rating of four stars, methinks, doth fit
This wondrous place, where we didst savor each bit."

Hark, what news is this? A place so fair,
With ladies' free admission, and drinks to share.
No line, no fuss, just enter with ease,
And find a spot to sit, in peaceful repose.

The staff, so kind and courteous, too,
Even the go-go dancers, with moves anew.
Drinks strong and potent, a sight to see,
A place to relax, and let one's worries be.

Small, but cozy, the lounge may be,
Yet room enough, for all to be.
Behind the REVOLUTION letters, a bar,
For those who wish, to linger and tarry.

The DJ, alas, did make some mistakes,
Or perhaps, the tunes, not to my taste.
But still, a spot, to come and enjoy,
With friends, and laughter, to make some noise.

My friends and I, in finery, did dress,
But others, in casual attire, did address.
A mix of ages, the crowd did seem,
But all, in merriment, did gather and gleam.

"Food's good, portions just right, service top-notch. But they got a 20-dollar minimum for credit cards. That's a problem for me, since I usually fly solo and don't carry cash. Means I won't be back, 'cause I can get the same grub, service, and portion control two blocks down the road, and use my debit card whenever I please."

"Samosas? Two-and-a-half stars. Potatoes and cilantro? Meh. Naan? Average. Three stars. Kashmiri Dum Aloo? Five stars. Well-spiced, creamy, perfect potatoes. Vegetable Jalfrezi? Four stars. Too much oil. Rice? Perfect. Service? Great. Bollywood videos? Enjoyed 'em. Be back soon."

"This joint's alright, for out here in the sticks. In town, it's just another hole in the wall. But hey, at least someone's giving the locals a decent spot to grab a bite. My pop's taken a liking to the place too, so it's become our go-to when he's feeling hungry. 

The pies are pretty good, and I've had some solid pasta dishes. 

Just remember, it can get pretty packed, so it's best to book ahead."

"Hark! Good sirs, ye must don garb with sleeves,
E'en though the sun doth beat down fiercely in this place,
A city of vice and excess, where fortunes are made and lost.
But fear not, for the cost, a princely sum indeed,
Is worth it, for the victuals and the decor do make amends.
A veritable cornucopia of dishes to choose from,
To sate thy hunger and delight thy taste buds,
And among them, their sweet treats, a true delight,
Their corn on the cob, a culinary joy, beyond compare."

"Spinach artichoke dip, damn good. Used to be bigger, but who cares? Strong drinks, that's what matters. Our waiter, Matt, top-notch. Helped us choose, had a blast before hitting the town. My friend digs the menu, Weight Watchers friendly. I'm sold, two for $20."

"Hark, my dear JD, what place doth thou suggest
For lunch, so casual, after our workout's end?
This spot, 'twas perfect, chips and salsa blest,
My hunger fierce, or else my gym-wrought zest.

JD, a cheese crisp, didst order, and I,
In jest, didst tease him, saying he didst diet.
But lo, the behemoth crisp, so greasy, vast,
Didst make mine eyes widen, and my words, didst last.
A thin tortilla, crispy, topped with melting gold,
Cut in squares, like pizza, easy to hold.

I, the Mexican Flag enchiladas, didst choose,
But they, compared to the cheese, didst pale, like frost.
A great meal, we had, and though it didst reverse
The good I'd done, at gym, my spirit, didst not stir.
Life, it is, and thus, I am content, my friend."

"Rito's got the best red chile and beans in the world, maybe even universe. Don't let the haters tell you otherwise. Sure, the area might seem rough, but that's just part of its charm. You'll find all sorts of folks here - city workers, CPAs, medical staff, teachers, and the occasional sketchy character. But don't let that scare you off. This family-owned joint serves up some damn good grub. Their menu might be limited, but it's all about quality, not quantity. And don't worry about the prices - you're getting fresh, soulful food, not some heartless crap like at Taco Bell. If you're feeling lucky, grab three tacos while you're there. The guacamole tacos? Amazing. I'd rob old people for 'em. Just saying. Now, if only they'd step up their game and offer fountain drinks... that'd be something else."

"Gold's Gym Elite, now this is a gym worth talking about. Walking in, I felt like I was checking into a high-end hotel, The W, maybe. Modern, stylish, and most importantly, clean. I'm beyond stoked to be a member here. Friendly staff, top-notch equipment, personal TVs on the cardio machines, and a place to plug in your iPod. No pool, but the views make up for it. Watched the planes take off and land at Sky Harbor while getting my sweat on. Not too crowded, either. A breath of fresh air compared to that other gym I used to go to. Filthy bathrooms and way too many people. Glad I made the switch."

"My heart doth yearn for buffets, but alas, my belly doth protest. Tasteless victuals, mass-produced and left to languish beneath the heat, do little to stir my appetite. But fear not, dear friends, for Studio B is a rare exception. Quality doth reign supreme, making it a journey worth the while.

At a mere $25, Monday through Thursday's dinner fare is a bargain, and the additional $10 for weekend seafood is a small price to pay for such a feast. Compare it to the cost of a single entree and ale at establishments like Cheesecake Factory, and the value becomes clear. But what truly sets this spread apart is the boundless beer and wine, a veritable cornucopia of delights.

Their sushi and carving stations are numerous, catering to all tastes, and the vegetarian and health-conscious options abound. The dessert table, a veritable paradise for those with a sweet tooth, boasts gelato and milkshakes among its treasures. The buffet itself is modern, inviting, and spotless, with nary an obstruction to mar the view of the Las Vegas strip.

Throngs of patrons may gather on busy days, so prepare thyself. And should thou be a member of the M Players Club, thou mayst partake of this bounty without cost, a gift from the gods, as 'twere."

Hark, what news is this? A gym I've found,
Where staff are friendly, and greetings abound.
At various hours, I've visited the place,
And found machines aplenty, with nary a trace.

For working the same muscles, diverse machines,
A plethora of choices, it truly gleams.
The juice bar, a treat, with staff so fine,
Brent, my guide, didst explain all, divine.

Parking, no issue, a breeze, it doth seem,
Well-kept, the gym, in cleanliness, a dream.
I do recommend, this fitness hold,
To all, who seek, a healthy, bold.

"Three of us ate at this joint last night and I'll definitely be back. Service was top-notch, Emily was a real sweetheart, and the owner, Daryl, even stopped by our table to make sure everything was A-okay. Good guy. \nNow, if I had to nitpick, I'd say the apps could've been bigger. They were pretty cheap, so we should've gotten a few more. But other than that, the grub was great. I went for the curried tofu and cleaned my plate. Martha got the Jerk Chicken (real spicy) and Binnie had the Chicken and Dumplings, which was different but damn good. \nAll three of us agreed we'd come back."

In fair Las Vegas, where gambling doth reign,
A classic hotel doth stand, the Rio its name.
A place of rest, with comforts plenty,
Despite its age, modernity doth abound.

The buffets, oh how they doth delight,
A feast for eyes, a treat for appetite.
But alas, the line at check-in doth grow,
As weekenders flock, the crowds they do show.

Yet, staff doth bear it with grace and poise,
Their patience, a virtue, doth surprise.
For those who seek a respite from the fray,
The Rio, a haven, doth beckon thee away.

Though distant from the Strip, a trifle far,
Cabs, aplenty, doth wait, a ride to scar.
Yet still, a gem, this hotel doth remain,
A place to rest, after a night of gain.

So here's to thee, dear Rio, may thy fame,
Endure, and may thy guests find joy in thy name.

"Pizza most incredible, ambiance quite great, service most terrific. 

A spot in Old Town, near Poisoned Pen Bookstore, didst we enjoy. An Emiliana salad, recommended by the owner, didst we share, and then an Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza, both excellently prepared. 

A Sangiovese, I didst order, for luncheon, desiring something light. Three wines, they didst bring, and we didst choose, a Tuscan Cabernet blend, most excellent. 

This place, doth make the list, of "spots to return to", in Scottsdale, for sure! Great service, great victuals, and most pleasant ambiance."

"Green chili burro and beef taco, that's all I got. Took it to go, so it wasn't as good as eatin' there, but the green chili was still a must. Not too hot, not too bland. Good tortillas. Taco was decent, but next time, I'll eat in. It's a pretty good neighborhood spot."
"Prince, Friday night. Saw him from the floor and the suite. Great show."

"LaQuinta in Scottsdale, that's where we usually stay. But this time, we needed to be at the courthouse bright and early, so I booked a room at the LaQuinta on Thomas. Big mistake. Pulled up, felt like I was taking my mom on a drug run to a dingy motel. But it was LaQuinta, I reminded myself. We bailed, fast.

Hopped on the 17, couple exits up, saw the Residence Inn, and my mom damn near turned the wheel herself, shouting, "GET OFF HERE!" Just kidding. We were hungry and wanted a comfy room, safe haven. And AAA knocked off 40 bucks, sweet deal.

Place had white picket fences around the AC outside, cozy touch. Studio room, kitchen, they even do grocery runs for you. Breakfast, the works: sausage, waffles, scrambles, fruit. No continental crap. 

Comfy, cozy, great sleep before a stressful day. Thanks, Residence Inn. Oh, and our court case? Victory! Yeehaw!"
"Caf\u00e9 across from McGill, great spot. Coffee's top-notch, Jason and crew are friendly. Pastries, fresh from a small bakery, taste like mom's. Stop by whenever I can."

"Re Salon & Med Spa, great place. Staff's top-notch, give 'em a visit. Been goin' there six months, had my fair share of services - cut, color, mani/pedi. Bethany, the color and cut magician, she's the best."

"Smooth ride, great views, and a taste of champagne. Just as promised. But six passengers in one chopper? Felt like a sardine in a can. Couldn't even stretch my legs. Average size, too. Would've been five stars otherwise."

"Bellagio buffet, solid 4 stars. Reasonable price for good variety, including crabs and prime rib. Always plenty of crabs, no need to stand in line. Snow crabs are better than King crabs, weirdly. Prime rib, very tasty, fast line. Typical casino buffet ambiance, not too fancy. Attentive service, no need to ask for refills or take away dirty dishes."

"Methinks 'twould be three stars, an it not were
For yonder green chili stew, most wondrous fair,
And divers frybreads, a feast for mine eyes,
That rock my world with their sugary surprise.

The frybread tacos, though not quite divine,
Are still a treat, and Chorizo, with hot sauce, doth shine.
A worthy place, when craving something new,
Or, verily, if thy sweet tooth doth pursue."
"BBQ's not bad. Samplers, big ones, liked 'em all. Meat, falls off the bone, nice. Pork, real good. Atmosphere, like gramma's house. Food, plenty. Go again?"
"Planet Dailies and Trader Vic's, then P F Chang's. Happy. Good grub, decent service, fair prices. Minor gripes, but P F Chang's wins."
"Buzzberry, not the best coffee spot, but it's good enough. Support local, that's what I say. Friendly staff, quick too. Large drink, secret menu, that's the way to go."

"I've holed up in a few joints in Vegas these past couple months, and the Downtown Grand ain't half bad. Retro vibes with them ocean colors, modern furniture that's a pleasant surprise given the price. Flat screen, full-size closet, dresser draws - got everything you need, 'cept a fridge. 

But them hidden fees, man, they get ya. Free internet, my eye - that's just part of the $12 daily hotel fee they didn't bother mentionin'. And don't even get me started on the $50 a day hold for damages. Then there's the self-parking across the street, and let me tell ya, that garage gives me the heebie-jeebies. 

All things considered, not too shabby for downtown Vegas. Restaurants in the lobby? On par with the rest of the Grand experience."
"This joint's not half bad. Decent grub, cold brews, and a friendly crew. Had a swell time."

"Food's decent here. Like a cheesecake factory, everything tastes the same. Friends say let's hit Grand Lux, it's cheap. But we never leave without dropping at least twenty bucks a head, just for grub. Yeah, it's cheap for Vegas, but when you're eating at three am every night, it adds up. Drunk food, you know? If you've only got thirty minutes, call ahead and order. Service ain't quick."
"Dinner was damn good. Waiter, Christopher, was top-notch. Made us feel like royalty. Will be back."

"I must confess, fair friends, I ne'er do dine
At this establishment, for I know 'tis but a mere whim.
Hot dogs hold no charm for me, I swear,
And funnel cakes, though sweet, do not tempt me sore.

But lemonade, oh lemonade, how thou dost quench my thirst!
In three flavors, regular, lime, and cherry, thou art divine.
Frozen, alas, doth not suffice, for full flavor doth it steal.
From other restaurants, I do procure my meals,
But lemonade, dear friend, from thee, I ever do reveal.

Lime and cherry, my heart doth sing with joy,
For they, my taste buds, do make employ.
Sweet, indeed, it may be, yet worth each penny, I say,
For with thy refreshing draught, all else doth fade away.

Near Hot Dog on a Stick, a seat, I pray thee, take not,
For when the workers lemons do smash, a frightful sound it maketh.
'Tis a noise most strange, and did, at first, my senses shake,
Yet still, my love for lemonade, doth forever keep."
"Best grub in Vegas, bar none. Menu's always changin', drinks are top-shelf. Hidden gem, but worth the search. Had the short rib gorgonzola polenta - damn near perfect."

"Tried their tapas on happy hour, wasn't impressed. Came back for Paella, it was a pleasant surprise. Food was better, ordered Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo, and Brochettas De Pollo. Camarones Al Ajillo, a must-try. BF almost licked the plate."

"Hark, what news is this? A culinary quest,  
To sample dishes of renowned chef, Gordon Ramsay.  
In Las Vegas, we didst find ourselves,  
For a weekend of indulgence, and gastronomic delights.  

I, a foodie, didst order the lamb, oh so tender,  
It melted in my mouth, a true delight.  
Mashed potatoes, a side dish, didst accompany,  
A perfect complement, to the main course, so bright.  

But alas, my husband and friend, didst not share,  
The same enthusiasm, as they didst taste and compare.  
Shepherd's pie, a dish of dreams, didst fail,  
A watery mess, didst leave my husband pale.  
Embarrassment didst keep him silent, but I,  
Didst speak up, and request a new try.  

The waiter, kind and helpful, didst oblige,  
And a new dish, didst soon arrive, with haste.  
A dessert, on the house, didst follow, a sweet surprise,  
A pleasant end, to a meal, of mixed surprise.  

Oh, how I wish, to dine at such a place,  
More often, and savor, the culinary grace."

"Hark! A wondrous place to dine, my friends,
Where breakfast meets lunch, and all's well that ends.
The victuals, oh so fine and fair,
Didst delight mine eyes and taste most rare.

For those who seek a lighter fare,
Fear not, for choices there be many there.
So, to this place, do thou make haste,
And partake of their culinary grace."

"Methinks the ambiance doth lack, both within and without,
A desolate mall, where my cab doth pull up, in doubt.
Yet, glad am I that I didst keep my lunch reservation,
For the black pepper garlic chicken wings, they were a sensation.

Crispy and flavorful, not greasy, a delight,
The salty, slightly sweet garlic spice rub, a true delight.
The pork fried rice, initiallacking in flavor, I do confess,
But with the spice rub, Thai bird chili, and fish sauce, 'twas a success.

Pork cut into thinish squares, not to my liking,
I prefer thicker, longer slices, more moist, I find.
Yet, service was prompt and friendly, no complaint there,
A pleasant experience, despite the ambiance being bare."

"Mulligan's Border, a tavern of renown,
In Las Vegas, doth hold its own,
With bar and video poker, 'tis true,
But food and service, they doth shine anew.

Their bar food, elevated to a fine art,
Doth please mine taste, and doth win mine heart,
A simple burger, cooked to perfection,
Juicy and tasty, with a toasted bun,
Their standard, high, doth never falter,
And thus, my love for Mulligan's doth gather.

My wife and I, we doth frequent this place,
Our "Cheers", where all our names they doth embrace,
A menu, small, but diverse, they doth provide,
Tweak it thou wilt, they doth not deny,
Their service, top-notch, doth never flag,
They doth strive to make thy experience a jag.

So give it a try, thou shall not regret,
Mulligan's Border, a gem, thou shalt not forget."

This place, my friends, doth be most funky and neat,
Convenient too, for those who doth attend
The Arizona State University, 'tis a treat.
I do recommend it, for beer and victuals both,
A cheap place, with art on the walls, that doth impress.
And lo, they have a fine selection of fliers,
The best, perchance, this side of the Mississippi's waters.

But wait, there's more! A craft fair did take place,
By local crafters, with wares of great grace.
'Tis said, this shall be a regular event,
On the second Saturday of each month, ye shall see it.

"Hark! What trail doth lie within this park?
A winding path, six miles and a half long,
For bikers of all skills, a challenge to embark.
With roots that twist and turn, a tricky throng.

But fear not, brave rider, for the path doth ease,
In parts, for those who seek a gentle breeze.
Yet, for the skilled, a test of strength and speed,
A challenge to be met, with courage unseated.

So, gear thy bike, and pedal forth with cheer,
For here, in this park, a trail doth await, my dear."

"Been to Biaggio's twice this week. Monday and Thursday, both times to go. Fiancé ordered pizza and wings Monday. Wings are to die for. Addicted. Crunchy outside, moist inside, dipped in ranch and hot sauce. Irresistible. Pizza was good, but nothing special. Pepperoni on one half, mushrooms and sausage on the other. Last night tried a stromboli. Bigger than expected. Chicken with artichokes and red pepper. Loved the artichokes. Stick with the $6.99 stromboli's. Specialty stromboli was $12.99. Both meals were around $30. Pricey for pie and wings. Back for the wings though."
"Devil's Diner's got new blood. Ownership and cook, both changed. Food's better now, tasty and priced right. Atmosphere's more welcoming too. Smile's on our faces."
"Serendipity, Vegas. Frozen hot chocolate, nachos. Always. Long wait, but worth it. To-go window, side."

"Amidst the bustling streets, this eatery doth stand,
Within its walls, a haven of rest doth expand.
The patio, a place of beauty, doth entice,
And food, a feast for senses, doth arise.

At lunch, the fare doth please, and dinner too,
The service, with a smile, doth shine anew.
But alas, their cocktails, a disappointment doth bring,
For in my heart, a fan I did not sing.

Yet still, I say, give this place a try,
For dessert, a sweet delight doth lie.
And save the cocktails for another day,
For in this place, all else doth sway."

"Grooming Salon. Katie, the cat handler. Hard to find cat groomers in this town. Vets offer the service, but after today's visit to Petsmart, I'll stick with Katie. She's got a way with cats, even the demon ones. My cat, Josie, is a handful. Adorable with me, but afraid of all pet workers. No idea why. Katie works Tuesday through Friday, starting at 7 am. Perfect. No one else needs to witness the drama my cat puts on. Called ahead to see if Katie could shave Josie's haunches. Didn't want bits clinging to her backside. Gross. Katie put an E-collar on Josie and scruffed her while she worked. Fine by me. The cat was screaming like a murder victim, otherwise, she'd be embarrassing. Job done in less than ten minutes. $6 well spent. Vet suggested sedating Josie and declawing her. Inhumane. Katie's the first professional to work with Josie...professionally. My cat's a total freak, but I can't shave her ass myself. Thank God for Katie at Petsmart. Seriously."
"Been here a few times, never disappointed. Food's good, service is too. Solid choice for a quick bite."
"Pleasant surprise, poutine. Variety, yes. House Special, best. Service, good. Room, plenty."
"Prices fair, plenty grub. Satay Chicken, dry as dust. Pineapple Fried Rice, good stuff. Thai Tea, sweet as sin. Phat Thai, solid. Green Curry Paste Fried Rice, spicy as hell."

"Place was great. Styrofoam, construction noise, no big deal. Unit was huge, comfy, perfect for our six-day stay. No daily maid service, but that's cool. We had a washer/dryer, but it was a little temperamental. Towels were plentiful, though. Pool was decent, hot tub and bar made up for it. Location was top-notch, rooms were clean, kitchen was a bonus. Would stay again."

"Check that one off the ol' bucket list. Visited the Mustard Museum and it was a real treat. Basement's small, but how big can a mustard museum be? Was hopin' for some ancient Egyptian or Roman mustard artifacts, but they had plenty of mustard from around the world instead. Upstairs was the sample area, where I dropped a cool $25. Staff was top-notch too. If you ain't a fan of mustard, best avoid the place."

"At Hard Rock Hotel, where loudness doth reign,  
The atmosphere, surprisingly, was calm and serene.  
Modern decor, with lighting just right, did shine,  
A pleasant change from the usual din and strife.  
  
Food, oh glorious food! Our server, kind and wise,  
Did recommend we try their specialties, and so we did.  
Yellow tail sashimi, with jalapeno's spice,  
And black cod miso, a flavorful delight.  
Chef's sashimi, alas, did not quite meet our hopes,  
But dessert, oh aye! Vanilla tapioca, a sweet surprise.  
Sake, though pricey, did complement the meal,  
A worthy investment, we did truly feel.  
Service, slow, but in no way did it mar  
Our enjoyment of the evening, nor our chat.  
  
In conclusion, we would return anon,  
To savor more of their delectable fare,  
Beef Wagyu beef, a dish most choice and fine,  
And other signatures, a gastronomic treat in store.  
Note, dear reader, this is not a place  
For those who seek a meal of little cost.  
Expect to pay, at least, a hundred fifty  
But for the experience, 'tis well worth the fee."

"Thursday nights, I hit up this joint for trivia. Always a good time. Menu's got some surprises - salads, wraps, decent pizza. Great spot to catch a game, too. TVs everywhere. But it gets crowded, especially since it's one of the only sports bars around. \n\nOne Sunday night, some drunk dude punched out a window. That was wild."

"Next to Metro Pizza, this place has been around for years. No Fresh & Easy nearby, so I've found a new spot for fresh produce. Super convenient to my workplace, almost never busy. Parking and checkout are a breeze. Got kiwi, peaches, celery, apples, and bananas for $12.05 yesterday. Been coming here more often since F & E closed. Sometimes it's a gamble at the 99 cents store. \n\nClean, fully stocked, and never disappoints. Saw two workers last night, one cashier, one stocking shelves."

"AJ's sushi bar, been goin' there since '06. Sushi chefs, top-notch, four stars easy. But then, turnover, reduced hours, quality and value took a dive. Had to find a new spot for my sushi fix. Update '13, they brought back the old chefs, now it's back to bein' one of my favorites."

"Good joint. Craps tables top-notch. Circle bar decent, cougars abound. Off the strip, 15 minutes, worth the trip. Rooms modern, pool sweet. Ex-roommate tended bar here. Laid-back spot when you need a break from the Strip. Big Bingo Room, bowling alley too. Theatre good, avoid weekends, teens swarm. Across from a shopping center, handy. Same ownership as Green Valley casino, similar vibe."

"Yum! Cran-slam club, good but turkey a bit dry. Cousins had capastrami and Bobbie, so I tried 'em. Bobbie, oh man, so good! Stuffing makes it, not dry like my sandwich. Capastrami, good too. Heard about a Capriotti's in Beverly Hills. Gotta try the Bobbie there!"

"Ramen Sora, good stuff. Not Monta-level, but still solid. Fresh ingredients, distinct flavors. Spicy miso, not too spicy. Could eat it again, definitely. If I lived in Vegas, this place would be my go-to."

This joint's got character, man. It's all Beatles-themed and the grub's got some funny names, but don't let that fool you. The fried cheese curds, they're top-notch. And the jalapeno popper burger? Damn good too. Don't sleep on the turkey swiss and slaw either.

Now, if you wanna make some memories, hit this place up on a Tuesday night. They got this trivia thing going on and Kim, the gal who runs it, she's a real kick. The waitstaff, they're A-okay too. Friendly as can be. And they got some decent brews to choose from.

"Airport pizza joints usually rip you off, but not this spot in B concourse. Decent pie, not the best, but a damn sight better than the rest. Crews come here too, that tells you something. Good eatin', fair price."

"Hark! What dish is this, described thusly on yonder website?
A sandwich of brisket, peppers, chilis, onions, and jalapeños,
Sauteed with Red Diamond sauce, on a jalapeño roll, no less.
And lo, 'twas quite good, full of spice and flavor, indeed.
I shall return for more, ere long, I do confess.

But wait, what's this? Onion strings, fried to perfection?
No breading too thick, nor onion too strong,
No grease to speak of, just a delicate crust,
And the onions, oh how sweet, not too bold, nor too rust.
At $1.95, a steal, I say, and worth every penny.
My only gripe, the portion size, a bit too scanty.

But fear not, dear friends, for on the first Wednesday of each month,
A $12.95 AYCE lunch buffet, a feast fit for a king, no doubt.
Alas, they open but for lunch, and weekdays only, alack,
From 10:30am to 3:00pm, Monday through Friday, that be the rule.

If they would but expand their hours, and increase the portion size,
Five stars, I would give, without a moment's hesitation, 'tis true.
So go forth, and try their wares, and see if thou dost agree,
For this humble reviewer, doth give his hearty approbation, verily."

"This joint's our go-to for Asian grub. My fam hits it up every weekend when my old lady's feelin' like whippin' up some stir-fry or pho. They got all sorts of goodies - Chinese, Filipino, you name it. And it's all in one spot, so we don't gotta make multiple trips. Used to go to 99 Ranch, but now that we moved out west, this place is way more convenient. 

I love checkin' out their selection - always somethin' new to try. From hair care to junk food, they got it all. Even got some fancy tea to sip on. And when I was makin' pho from scratch, I found all the ingredients I needed in one spot. They got all sorts of herbs, spices, sauces, and powders. The place is spotless too. If you run into any language problems, just find someone who speaks English. Most of 'em do. 

Their baked goods and deli items are top-notch. I grab pastries for lunch, and their dim sum's always a treat. Better than Orchid's Garden or Chang's, and way cheaper. You should skip Panda Express and hit this place up instead. It's legit and affordable - five bucks for two items, and the portions are huge. Oh, and they'll fry your fish for free!"

"Burgers, damn good. Had the BBQ before, but the I Love Bacon burger, that's the real deal. Brisket and bacon, yum. Tater tots, necessary. Beer specials, hell yeah. Sam Adams, 32 oz, ten bucks, keep the cup. That's I Love Burgers, baby."
"Drive-thru's handy, sure. But this joint's got character. Makes me wanna ditch the wheels, stretch my legs. Friendly folk, too. Always nail my order."

"Steak n' scrimps for $7.77? Helluva deal, boys. Can't beat that. Decent slab o' meat, skewered shrimp, mashed spuds, and a salad. Go for the Caesar, though. Tasty greens. Just get in, order, eat, and shut up. Don't spoil the special with fancy service or ambiance. This is a 24/7 grub joint. Finished off a night of craps here after hit-tin' the hard eight twice. Yeah, you heard me right. Crappers, know the odds. 'Til next time, steak ya later."

"Gave it 4.5 stars. Good eatin' joints, slots, bars, pool, kids' play area, friendly servers. Deluxe room, plenty space, but deducted half star for dirtiness. Table seats had food stains, no Wi-Fi, and in-room internet didn't work. Everything else, great. Stay again, for sure."

"Good eatery...sushi, not so much. I'm a sushi fiend, tried 'em all in Vegas. This spot's decent, but not my top pick. Garlic Chicken and Hamburger Steak, that's what I'm talkin' about! Their Hawaiian breakfast too, sausage, eggs, rice - yum! Not for sushi lovers, but still, a taste of 808 in 702."

"Grand Lux, when will you hit the Bay? Feels like Cheesecake Factory, but with better grub. Variety's the spice of life, and we ordered up a storm: stacked quesadilla, seared ahi, Asian noodle bowl, tomato bisque. Skip the noodles, they're a sad imitation. Ahi and quesadilla were solid, and the tomato soup was a hearty bowl. Portions are huge, so sharing's a good idea. Prices are fair, service is prompt and friendly. You'll leave full and content, all for under $20."

"Went to this joint with some out-of-towners, looking to cash in on a match play deal I saw online. It's your typical neighborhood poker bar, but with a tropical twist - gotta love that little waterfall. Tiki decor's cool too. Any place that'll match my play's a winner in my book. Didn't try the grub, but the bartender offered me a Blue Moon with OJ. That's a winner too. This place is a Steelers bar, so they got promos and prizes going on during all the games."
"Went to this joint with some pals. Liked it. Wife and I had a veggie sandwich, Caprese. Daughter had an Italian. Friend had the Montagu. Cheap for the Strip, but still hungry after."
"Mexico, we go there often.  Back from Baja's tip, just returned.  Tacos, they taste like Baja's.  Good eats, real good.  Clean place, staff friendly.  Two nights in a row, we went."

"Verily, the wash and interior cleaning didst please me well! My aged carriage didst shine with renewed luster, and I didst feel most satisfied. The men who worked upon it didst complete their task with haste, and I didst behold with joy the cleanliness of the windows and the tidiness of the floor. \nHowever, I must confess that the maiden who first approached me to take my request didst speak with such hasty words and a mien of annoyance. She didst seem vexed at having to repeat her queries, and her eyes didst roll in impatience. \nBut the men and maiden who didst attend to the vehicles didst perform their duties with cheer and courtesy."

"Great spot for a big crew. Rented a two-bedroom villa here a couple weeks back for a buddy's birthday. Place is tucked behind the MGM, near Hooters. Room was huge, kitchen fully stocked. Two full bathrooms, extra pillows and blankets. Sleeps six, but could fit ten easy. Price was right, and it was dead quiet. Continental breakfast was top-notch. Lots of options, something for everyone. Solid choice if you don't mind being off the strip."

"Vegan pizza in Vegas? Hell yeah! 

Wynn's got a secret vegan menu, but you gotta ask for it. It's a damn good list too. I'm eyein' the tofu parmesan sub, but my buddy wants a pie to share. 

We grab a meal deal - side, salad, 12" pizza for 24.95, drinks for 3.75 (thankfully refillable). Not cheap, but a good deal for the Wynn. Pizza's decent too, uses Follow Your Heart instead of Daiya. I like it, good texture and taste. Our veggie pizza's topped with olives, onions, and roasted red peppers. Interesting combo, but not my favorite. Crust could be a bit softer too. Salad's alright, nothing special. Fries are crispy as hell, real good. 

Planning my next trip, definitely coming back here."

"A wondrous place to visit on a Monday eve,
With fewer than twenty cars in the parking space,
I didst feel a bit uneasy at first sight,
For the mall nearby doth have a questionable name.
But fear not, dear friends, for this theatre doth shine,
Clean and tidy, with staff most kind and fine."

"Mystery meat, that's what they call it. Fills you up for a couple bucks, but I ain't sure I wanna know what's in it. And them blackjack players, always doubling down when the dealer's got a ten and they got one too. Makes me wanna choke 'em."

"This joint's a real gem. Best breakfast in town, bar none. Don't let the line out the door scare you off - it's worth the wait. I went on a Sunday morning and had a hell of a time getting a table, but the server was friendly as could be. Get the chorizo hash, it's a game-changer. And don't forget to try the sage fried chicken and waffles - it's a real treat. If you're feeling thirsty, go for the Tractor Driver Combo. It's a winner."

"Methinks 'tis entrance hid, a secret place,
That doth entice me to this wondrous space.
Within, the fire doth warm, the lights doth dim,
And ancient bar doth call, like siren's whim.
Ay, 'tis a bit too grand, a wine bar vast,
Not cosy, like those in fair LA or NYC at last.
But list of vintage deep, and staff most kind,
Did aid in choice, their counsel did entwine.
A mix of folk, in pairs or groups of maid,
Did gather here, in mirth, their cares laid.
A refuge, 'gainst the din of Old Town's throng,
This place, a haven, shall be mine, ere long."
"Pittsburgh, always a stop. Few sandwiches, sure. Good, like they say. Service, slow though."

"Airports for drunken revelry? Try these:

1. Narita/Tokyo - Glassy, polite, and a never-ending monorail ride.
2. Chicago O'Hare - Neon tunnel, perfect for a Dark Side of the Moon soundtrack.
3. McCarran - Las Vegas, where 12 hours of debauchery are inevitable. Slot machines and lizards make great companions.

Quarter deposited, cherry picked. Lemon? Damn. Time to board."

"Two-piece chicken special for 99 cents at Popeyes? Hell yeah, that's a good deal. Don't get me wrong, I ain't no fan of fast food, but every now and then, it hits the spot. And let me tell you, Popeyes delivers. Consistent chicken, decent service. Can't complain about that. Throw in some biscuits, and you've got yourself a damn good meal."

"Good grub, noble cause. Feel good eatin' here. 

Love King's Kitchen's concept. Non-profit, give profits to feed folks. Tasty food, too. 

Had a group interview in Uptown, lookin' for a close lunch spot. Cold, rainy day, we're on foot. Someone suggests Jimmy John's, but I ain't walkin' far. Lucky for us, King's Kitchen's nearby. Check out the menu, everyone's happy. Order the chicken salad croissant, comes with a side. Get a mixed greens salad with balsamic. Sandwich is great, side salad's good, too. Fresh ingredients. Fair prices, $9-13 for lunch. Service is attentive, polite folks. Wanna come back for dinner."

"Brunch on the patio with good company. Eggs, great. Pastries, divine. Bacon, satisfactory. Jelly with mini donuts, amazing. But, they shouldn't call 'em beignets. Donuts, that's what they were. Misnamed, my expectations were off. Fluffier pastry, that's what I expected. Bellinis, awesome. Coffee, too small."
"Tacos, good and simple. Small, cheap, order a few. Horchata, good, homemade. Beans, plain. Not the best, but I'd return."

"This joint's the real deal for a downtown chill vibe, no argument. You got your artisanal brews, your classic Schlitz, and a roast beef sandwich that's straight fire. If you're feeling fancy, they got AZ wines too. But listen up, fellas, if you wanna keep your voice and impress the ladies, sit outside. And don't forget about the mixed nuts and olives, they're plenty generous with 'em. Word."

"Fries here are top-notch. Perfect size, shape, crispiness. All Mandalay Bay restaurants seem to serve 'em. Hard to recall what else I had, they stole the show. Cute spot for a quick bite, but not your typical Vegas fancy joint. Get the fries."
"Fans needed for lunch spot. Hot as hell in Tempe. Music's great though. Service was meh during the rush. But damn, those burgers!"

"Reserve a table. Consistently good grub. Sesame chicken, mongolian beef, and fried rice are my go-tos. Don't forget to try the bananas for dessert. Watch out for the bar tab, it adds up quick. $9 margaritas, but worth it."

"Went here for my third time. Great spot, especially when you're in the area and need a bite to eat. Today, I got both specials - swordfish and lamb. Both were awesome. Always order the specials at a tapa place. They won't disappoint. FYI, if you want the happy hour deal, you gotta sit at the bar. A bit silly, but that's how it goes. Menu's smaller, but hey, it's a way to save a few bucks."

"Hark, what news is this? Our Manager doth go  
Out of his way to make us feel at home,  
And with his warmth, doth make our bike trip flow  
To yonder restaurant, where we shall roam.  
A friendly staff doth greet us with a grin,  
And with their cheer, doth make our visit spin.  
This little eatery, full of promise doth seem,  
And with its growth, shall be a place of dreams."

"Good eatery run by solid Vietnamese family. Fresh grub, quick service. Been around since 2011. Traditional Viet dishes and some East Asian faves. Prices fair, portions generous. My Tom Xao Ca Ri, $12.50, loaded with fresh veggies, big shrimp. House specials include Banh Tom Ho Tay, $13, and Ca Kho To, $10. Curries pack heat. Canh Chua, $8, homemade broth, daily. Chef's got principles. Hates MSG, watery stock. Says cooks drown flavor in oil. Petite Tonkinoise's only issue? Decor's lackluster. Zen kitsch mini banquet hall vibe."

"Went to Puck's, last minute, for dinner with the fam. Bright semi-open space, nice small bar area. Only had to wait 10 minutes on a Friday night around 9PM. Staff was attentive. 

Food was good. Had the grilled ribeye steak, probably the priciest entree at $40. Cooked perfect, medium rare, with a tasty reduction sauce. Nice stem of mushrooms and blackened green chiles. A good opening meal in Vegas. Nothing too fancy, but good eat's. 

Tried the tiramisu dessert. Really good. Had chocolate beads in the creamy layer, added a nice crunch. Even though it's mainly pasta/pizza & seafood, safely recommend the ribeye here. Enjoy the eats."

"Chicken and waffles, authentic as hell. LoLo's, that's where I found 'em. Waffles, outta sight, man. Chicken, damn near perfect. Me and the boys, we just ate, didn't say a word. Clean joint, friendly service. You gotta try it. I'll be back, for sure."

Last eve, our kin didst venture forth to dine
At North Lake Mall, where we didst find a place
To sate our hunger, and didst take our time
To savor each dish, and every morsel's grace.

The service there, it was quite swift and neat
Our orders taken at the counter, with speed
The fare, it was brought forth with great dispatch
And we didst feast, with joy and merriment.

My wife, she had the pulled pork plate
Whilst I, the half-chicken, didst partake
Our children, they didst have pork sandwich and fingers
Grilled, not fried, a healthier choice, it lingers.

All of us, we didst enjoy our repast
The portions, generous, and the taste, so vast
The BBQ sauces, three kinds, didst please our palate
Sweet tea, a perfect complement, didst satiate.

Self-service drinks, a convenience, indeed
Cleanliness, a virtue, the staff didst heed
Friendly and helpful, they didst attend
Our needs, with smiles, and diligence, they didst lend.

Four stars, I give, for excellence, it doth deserve
Above average, in all aspects, it doth preserve
We shall return, when next we are near
For more of that deliciousness, we hold dear.
"Tacos for me, cheeseburger for him, corn dogs for the kiddos. My tacos, damn good."

"Hark, what news is this? The fries and hash browns, once a delight,
Now changed, and not for the better, alas!
I sought an answer, but none could be found,
Leaving me to ponder, with a heavy heart, the cause of this decline.

But fear not, dear friends, for all is not lost,
For still, the atmosphere remains, and the service, too,
Improves with each passing day, as the staff doth strive,
To make each patron feel welcome, and their bellies full.

Aye, 'tis a great place, with indoor and outdoor seats,
A haven for those who seek good food and drinks,
And though the fries may have faltered, the San Tan Hefe,
Still flows, a refreshing elixir, for all to enjoy."

"Big portions, good grub. Not authentic, but who cares? Udon noodles are thick, broth is tasty. Add chili oil for a kick. Clean joint, worth the few extra bucks over fast food. Get extra bowls or a to-go container, you'll need 'em."

"Fourth visit to the shop, Bob's cutting my hair. Standard price is $15, but he wants more because my hair's thick. Says it's extra work, wants $25. Never had a barber complain before. Would've walked out, but couldn't leave mid-haircut. Will explore other options. UPDATE: Complained to Ernie, the owner. He apologized, offered free haircut next time. Came back, asked for him, and result was good. Repeat visits over two years, would recommend avoiding Bob."

"Stayed here after a delayed flight. They gave our room away but upgraded us to a better one with a sick view of the strip. Pools were dope, especially the wave pool. Daylight was lit but expensive. Good eats around the casino, but the bars inside were pricey. Would stay again."

"Sweet treats, oh how they delight! Cakes, ice cream, truffles, a feast for the taste buds, no doubt. But alas, too much of a good thing, can be a bad thing, as the saying goes. For after a few bites, my craving is sated, and I am done. Red Velvet cake, a true delight, and the washroom, a marvel of cleanliness and mirrors galore, a true wonder to behold!"

"Methinks 'tis a fine eatery indeed,
Where food doth please and service doth proceed,
With haste and diligence, they do attend,
To needs of mine and all my kin, in sooth.

The salsa, spicy hot, doth fire my taste,
And chicken fajitas, oh, how they doth astound,
A feast fit for a king, or so it seems,
With complimentary soup, their bounty doth abound.

My family, all, doth cherish this place,
Where laughter doth flow and joy doth embrace,
In truth, 'tis a gem, beyond compare,
This restaurant, where love doth flourish fair."

"Wings here are top-notch, no question. Big, juicy, crispy. Don't overdo it with the batter, just right. Sauces are solid, not too sweet or spicy. Service is prompt, friendly. Paper towels and wet naps on the table, nice touch. Boneless wings? Hell yeah, huge. This place knows how to do wings right."

"Quaker Steak, six atomic wings. Spicy, but not impossible. Sign a waiver, for show. Habañeros, no issue. Pro-tip: ask for gloves. No sauce, no pain. More wings: Louisiana Lickers, Arizona Ranch, Golden Garlic. Meaty, flavorful. Overpriced? Maybe. But worth it."

"This joint's alright. Used to come here all the time, but haven't been in a bit. Stopped by last couple weeks, had a late lunch. People who run the place, real nice. That ensalada drink, refreshing as hell in this heat. Usually get the veg papusa, fried plantain. Hubby had the chicken soup, loved it. Then he got the chicken special, loved that too. Glad we came back."

"Our final usage of the LALALA ramen pass, 'twas a wondrous sight,
In Las Vegas, where we didst savor, a most excellent ramen delight.
The pork within the soup, oh how grand,
Smoky and sultry, with a hint of wood-fired brand.
The waitress, kind and fair, didst attend to our needs,
Ensuring we didst enjoy, our culinary deeds.

At Ramen Misoya Tomi, they strive to be unique,
With traditional care, and unconventional technique.
The decor, not to my taste, with posters so bright,
But the ambiance, lacking, in its present light.
Yet, for groups, 'tis a place, to dine and make merry,
For it's not too crowded, and the ramen, so very."

"Fare thee well, good sir! Hark, what news I bring!
The victuals here, a mite too salty they be,
Yet fear not, for the service doth make up the difference,
In truth, 'tis excellent, thou shalt see.

If thou desirest a dish more fine and rare,
Than the common buffet, Stratta's the place to fare,
A worthy choice, indeed, doth lie within its walls,
And mark my words, the tata beef doth stand tall.

So heed my counsel, friend, and give it a go,
For thou shalt find that Stratta doth truly show
A culinary prowess, beyond compare,
And leave thee satisfied, without a single care."

"Songbird, it's my jam. Work's just a stone's throw away, so I swing by often. Their pastries? Heavenly. Get the brioche cinnamon roll, you won't regret it. Coffee's top-notch too. Not sure what they're doing differently, but it shows. Seating's limited and prices are steep, but it's worth it for the quality."
"Had the lamb kubideh. Good price, seven ninety-nine. Rice, bread, both good. Make bread there. Tastes great. Ended with baklava. Give it a shot."

"SanTan, good beer, good grub. Not many veggie options, but what do you expect? Fish tacos, meh. Veggie burger, standard. Pretzel, now we're talking. Their apps and beer, that's the ticket. Heard their burgers are solid, can't confirm. Local joint, worth a visit."

"Found this joint a few months back, treatin' myself to a mani/pedi. Great deal, thirty bucks. Pedicure comes with a hot stone massage, warm lotion, and a killer leg rub. Been here a few times, never needed an appointment. They always take me in, get me settled in a massage chair, and start workin' their magic. 

One time, my boyfriend asked for paraffin on his hands. Girl brings out two plastic bags with warm wax, tells him to slip 'em on like gloves. Looked a bit dodgy, but damn, his skin came out smooth as silk. 

Headin' back this Friday, preppin' for sandal weather."

"Villa Deli, a joint I've known and loved for years. Went for lunch today, and they've got some changes. New ownership, and now they're slingin' pizza too. Sandwiches still top-notch, but the service ain't quite the same. Used to be, the old owner'd come out, chat with the regulars, make ya feel welcome. Now, it's just take your order, thanks, and that's it. Shame, really. But hey, the grub's still good. Keep it up, and maybe try engaghin' with the customers a bit more. That's the ticket."
"Food was top-notch, service even better. Waiter was a real pro, knew his stuff. My wife's birthday, July 4th, they brought out this incredible dessert, sparkler candle and all. Highly recommend."

"We stumbled upon this joint by chance and dug it. Lookin' for a spot to dance, some dude outside Caesar's handed us passes for free entry before midnight. We snatched 'em up and hit the casino. Another fella near Pure gave us the same deal, said to hop in the shorter guest list line. We were groovin' inside five minutes after steppin' into the hotel. \n\nPure's a sweet rooftop club with a view of the strip. I boogied for hours, eyes fixed on the Eiffel Tower. Can't gripe about that, can ya? The DJ spun some killer tracks; wish I could recall his name 'cause I enjoyed most of his jams. Drinks cost a pretty penny, but that's Vegas for ya."
"Good joint. Pizza, little oil slick, but flavorful. Salad, solid. Three squares, no problem. They brought grub to our digs too. Worth it when you're beat and need a quick bite."

"Springs Cafe, third time's the charm. Location and view, four stars easy. Food? Solid three and a half. Good eatin', nothin' fancy. Burgers, wraps, pizzas, specials. View's the real star. Definitely worth a visit, especially on a nice day. Sit outside, soak it up."

"Shadyside's got a new gem. Love the vast beer selection, sizable menu, and endless mimosas and Bloodies for brunch. Had the chicken 'n' waffles today - perfect blend of Southern diner and gourmet gravy, topped with bacon maple syrup. Live just 'round the corner, eager to return."

"Hark, what eatery is this? In Henderson, 'tis found,
A place to dine, with sushi, cooked dishes abound.
My colleague, she suggested we meet here,
And with her, I did partake of their fare.

Their lunch specials, six pieces of sushi or sashimi,
A roll of choice, and soup and salad, all for a fee.
Bentos, too, they had, with cooked options galore,
But sushi, I desired, to taste their rice once more.

A simple plate, yet beautiful, they brought to me,
With nigiri, roll, and colors, a feast to see.
Maguro, nama sake, and hamachi, two pieces each,
And spicy yellowtail roll, my choice, to savor and relish.

Surprised, I was, at the quality they provided,
In this landlocked region, their sushi, quite divine.
Green iced tea, they served, in a large glass, indeed,
Our server, kind and swift, our needs, did heed.

In and out, we were, within thirty-five minutes' space,
The ambiance, pleasant, with a cherry blossom's grace.
This sushi sleeper, in Henderson, a gem, no doubt,
A good lunch spot, on this side of town, without a rout."

"Fair sirs, gather 'round and heed my words,
For I have found a place most wondrous and grand,
Where vegan fare doth please the taste buds,
And non-veg friends do crave it, hand in hand.

The dishes, oh so delectable and bright,
Did fill our bellies with delight,
And though the prices were most fair and just,
Our hunger didst still demand more, we didst must.

But mark this well, dear friends,
For on a Friday eve, the crowd doth swell,
And service, slow it doth become,
Leaving us to wait, our patience doth fray.

So heed my counsel, and avoid that night,
Lest ye be left with naught but bitter plight."

"Hark, good sir or madam, hast thou sought  
A slice of New York pizza, and in Vegas found?  
Indeed, 'tis true, this place doth hold the key  
To satisfy thy craving, let it be.  
Some may protest, saying 'tis too far away  
From the Strip or Summerlin, but nay,  
'Tis worth the journey, trust me, ere I pray  
Thou shalt not find a better way.  
And should thou wish to indulge in sweet delight  
Next door, a creamy treat doth await thee,  
In the form of ice cream, rich and velvety white.  
So, go forth, and partake of this delight."
"Clean joint. Comfy seats, friendly staff. This Subway's how it should be done. I'll be back."

"This joint's got that real dive bar vibe goin' on. Cheap drinks, cool bartenders, and all sorts of folks. You got your regulars, your workin' stiffs, your wannabe anonymous types, and them stoners. And let me tell ya, the ladies get treated like royalty 'round these parts. Just don't mind the occasional creepy cousin tryin' to plant one on ya. You can chill with a cold one or get plastered, either way you'll fit right in. Worth checkin' out, especially after gettin' booted from Santisi Brothers. Just don't forget about the single ladies' room, but hey, at least the line's usually short and it ain't always reekin' of piss and sex."

"What a wondrous place! The patio, a verdant haven, doth invite
A gathering of friends, for a feast most fair and bright.
We entered within, to partake of their noontide fare,
And with chips and guac, our hunger did prepare.
I chose the dish of the day, a mahi spinach delight,
Whose portion was generous, nay, a full fish in sight.
Alas, I could not finish it, though 'twas a tasty treat.
Their happy hour, with deals most fair and sweet,
Doth beckon me back, to revel in their delight."

"Hark! My dear friends, let us discuss the matter of customer service at BBQ joints, shall we? Forsooth, I do believe that such establishments, small and cozy as they may be, deserve their own set of guidelines when it comes to serving their patrons. In my experience, these humble abodes often operate at their own pace, forgetting or changing orders midstream, and treating their guests as if they were visiting their home, rather than a place of business. Memphis, for example, hath this very feel. Upon arriving promptly at opening time, we encountered certain...shall we say, "speedbumps"? They were still counting change, setting up chairs, and preparing the day's fare. But fear not, dear reader! For the food, once it arrived, was truly delectable. My beef ribs, with their lovely pink ring, did scream of smoky goodness. And the coleslaw, unusual as it was, did please my palate mightily. Aye, 'twas mustard-based, with a sweet and sour flavor that complemented the dressing nicely. Alas, my husband did not share my enthusiasm for his pulled pork, finding the BBQ sauce too sweet and peppery. Ah well, perhaps he should have chosen the ribs instead. In any case, gentle reader, should thou find thyself in Buckeye, do stop by and sample their wares for thyself."

"Good things come in small packages, like this Vegas casino built in 1906. Classy, simple, and clean, it's got old-style slots and dealers dressed as flappers at night. We joined Club 1906, played joker poker, and scored free room offers. Check it out for a downtown staycation or a drink and some craps. It's a fun spot."

"Away with thee, my friends, to Golden Corral we go,
Where a feast fit for kings doth await, don't you know?
My love, she doth chide me for my growing girth,
But how can I resist, when there's so much worth?

The grub, it doth please, though not of highest quality,
And the service, alas, doth leave much to be desired, you see.
But who cares for that, when there's such plenty to eat?
I had steak, chicken, rice, ice cream, and more, oh so sweet!

Golden Corral, thou art a wondrous place, indeed,
Where a man can gorge, and his hunger doth secede.
So here's to thee, dear friend, may our bellies always be full,
And our taste buds, happy, at thy bountiful pull!"

"This joint's got game. Their selection's top-notch, especially the red velvet. None of that flavor-switching nonsense like at MoJo or Yogurtology. Their new features, bananalicious and hawaiin, are straight fire. Only gripe's they don't got juice poppers. What's up with that? Everyone loves 'em."

"Went for brunch, ordered from grilled cheese menu. Wake and bake, cheddar, egg, maple bacon, maple mayo - amazing. Boyfriend had blarney stoner, open-faced, mashed potatoes, beer cheese, stout gravy, fries, hash - potatoes on bread, not grilled, but yummy. Grilled cheeses come with tomato soup, fries. Fries thick, almost breaded, soft in middle, few different flavors, old bay - can't go wrong. Tomato soup interesting, thick, not bad, served purpose of dipping. Service great, quick, efficient, no complaints. Beer list amazing, will be back."

"Hark! A pizza joint most wondrous, 'tis called The Diamond Pizza, nigh unto Atria's, on the bridge of Roberto Clemente, by PNC Park doth lie. Good pizza, verily, doth serve they, and cheese most fair, a feast for thine eyes, and belly too, I dare. Enter the park thou mayst, through their portal, friendly folk doth greet thee, and with nary a wait, doth scan thy ticket, and gift thee a program, and promotional items, for the game at hand. Within, by the slice, thou mayst order, and beer, if thou desirest, and watch the game on twain TVs, ere thou doth take thy seat. And lo! Restrooms, nearby, doth await, as thou enterdst the corridor of left field. A humble abode, this pizza shop, yet bustling, with folk who toil, to make good food, for a meager sum. Verily, they doth succeed."

"Hark, what mischief doth my eyes perceive?
A Ross store, full of treasures to retrieve.
I entered, seeking gifts for others fair,
But lo, my heart didst betray me, and I didst bear
Away with me, a prize most wondrous and rare,
Forsooth, 'twas naught but trifles, baubles, and lace.
My mind, it doth confound, how I couldst be so blind,
To seek for others, yet find naught but mine own kind.
Alas, the lure of Ross, it doth ensnare,
And now, my purse doth weep, and my heart doth despair."

"Hark! What's this? A place of old-fashioned charm,
Where friendly folk do gather, and doth disarm.
Their steak and lobster, a feast for kings,
Doth come with veggies, and a baked potato, of size most ample.
A veritable treat, fit for a noble,
In this establishment, of atmosphere so jolly."

"Holly's review hits the mark. Second time doing this gig, first time was a bike ride, total mess. Not running, just walking the 5K. Always got my beard, no issues there. Park in the north lot, quick exit on Sunset. Don't like the growing number of dogs, at least they kept their business at home. Good entertainment, Jabbawockeez, dancers from Fantasy, flying Santas, makes it a fun event. Walking over the freeway on Sunset, not something you do every day. Main fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a worthy cause in Southern Nevada. I'll be back next year, suit and all."

"NYC transplant, great spot.  Pricey, trendy, menu's a bit tricky with a big group.  Our waiter was top-notch, made sure we were well taken care of.  Joint was jumpin', lots of energy, beautiful people.  If you're with a group, ask for help with the menu.  Couples, you're good to go.  Plenty to try, could eat here 100 times and never get bored."

"Tucked away, hidden from sight,
I forgot how I came to this place,
In the night, with friends, without light,
They drove me hither, in haste.

The inside, small, dark, and funky,
With copper counters, shining bright,
Adds to the charm, quaint and punky,
A place to dine, with delight.

Pork enchiladas, I did order,
And shared the garlic, sauteed,
Oh, how delicious, a true border,
Left me craving, more to savor.

But alas, the garlic, it did seep,
Into my pores, oh, how it clung,
Days passed, and still it did linger,
A scent, that would not be sung.

Yet, worth it, the meal, it was,
A place, you should visit, with haste,
For the flavors, they do entice,
And leave you, in want, of more delight."

"Methinks I didst venture forth to this establishment some months past, and verily, 'twas a wise decision. Forsooth, their victuals didst please mine taste, in sooth, nigh unto perfection. Their spicy meat taco, in particular, didst delight mine senses with its savory flavor. And, upon my return a fortnight later, I didst partake of their burrito, which didst prove to be a most excellent choice, surpassing, in my humble opinion, the offerings of that other establishment, Chipolte. \nNow, in fairness, I must confess that mine only quibble with this fine eatery doth concern the nature of their meats. Forsooth, the majority of them didst remain unknown unto mine ears, and, perchance, a more detailed elucidation of their composition might be in order. Furthermore, a broader selection of sodas, or even the addition of tea, might serve to enhance the overall experience. \nYet, notwithstanding these minor shortcomings, this place doth remain an excellent and most affordable venue for the procurement of delectable tacos, burritos, and street corn, with hours most accommodating."
"Carne adovada, I love it. But sometimes, too much fat. Hate that. Best chipotle ranch though."

"Methinks this town doth boast the best Chai Latte,
A drink most sweet and comforting, no doubt.
With chocolate twist and quiche lorraine, we did feast,
Both dishes light and delicate, a true delight.
A ciabatta boule we brought home, its moistness rare,
Yet, verily, 'twas good, beyond compare."
"Good grub, great service. One of our go-to spots for a bite. Sesame tofu, top-notch. Best I've had."
"Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl? More like a sad, soggy mess. Frozen meal, heated up. Not worth a star. Stickin' with the good stuff - 5-star wraps and salads. Leavin' the 2.5-star bowls for the birds."

"Methinks 'twas a night of merriment and delight,
With acts most wondrous and performances so bright.
The main player, a fool of great wit and charm,
Didst make us laugh with his antics and disarm.

Alack, fair Angel, with a role so small,
But still, 'twas joy to see her take a fall.
In truth, the absinthe, a drink most rare,
Was but a gimmick, yet still, we didst declare,
'Twas good to see it, though not quite the same,
As those across the seas, where it doth reign."

"Went back a second time, and they've changed how they make the Wellington. Now it only comes one way - can't order it medium well or any other way. Funny, after my initial review. Still very good, though."

"Jennifer C's review hits the mark. I had a similar experience. Being from Pittsburgh, taking a 'tour' felt strange at first, but it was a fresh way to see the city. \n\nThe only gripe I got is that it was more Segway, less tour. Riding the Segway was a blast (especially when they let us loose) but the tour itself was lacking. The guide shared some tidbits here and there, but I expected more."
"Eat big, or don't eat at all. Gigantic portions, guaranteed food coma. Fries? Top-notch."

"Hark, what ill fate befalls the hosts of late,
In restaurants, void of charm and grace.
But let us not be swayed by first impressions,
For oft, they do belie a hidden treasure.

Carol, a gem, doth make amends for the flaw,
With service so fine, it doth our spirits lift.
We ordered caprese, a dish most fair,
Tomatoes spread forth, like a garden in bloom.
Fresh onion and basil, a new twist doth bring,
A balsamic reduction, that doth make it sing.

I could devour this dish, as a main course,
But alas, my stomach doth protest, in vain.
So, pasta Franco, I didst choose instead,
Olives, artichokes, and sun-dried tomatoes, a medley.
A tad too salty, yet not unexpected,
Still, I would order it again, without hesitation.

Carol, attentive and kind, doth attend to our needs,
Ask for her, and your dining experience shall exceed.
We shall return, more frequently, from now on,
For this restaurant, doth possess a secret charm."

"Hark! What's this? A place to dine and sip,
Where coffee flows and soups do simmer?
Aye, 'tis true, the service here doth dip,
But still, I say, 'twill be a pleasant summer.

For in this hall, they serve with glee
Fresh soups and sandwiches of high degree,
And smoothies too, that doth delight,
In flavors sweet and colors bright.

So come, my friends, and taste for thee,
The brew that doth awaken thee,
And if thou dost return, as thou shouldst,
Thou shalt find fare that doth please thee well, no doubt."
"Tasty grub, quick service. Thai tacos and mac 'n cheese, a real treat. Burgers done right too. Not gourmet, but good eats all the same."

"Place was hoppin', Monday night or not. Malbec flowed like water, olives marinated to perfection. Sausage and mushroom pizza, just the right size. Decor? Top-notch. Not exactly easy to find, but worth the search. Local spot, hidden in a strip mall behind the tire shop. Check it out, Arden."

"We've only tried the lunch buffet here. That's what this review's based on. \n\n We've been coming here pretty regularly. They keep the buffet stocked, so there's usually plenty of everything. My favorites are the eight treasures and the chicken curry. Bottom line: solid grub for a fair price without any wait."

"Dickey's saved my Thanksgiving. My brother and I decided to do Thanksgiving with friends last minute. No turkeys at Hash House a Go Go. WTF? Same at Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves. Double WTF. Needed Thanksgiving to-go, stat. Dickey's had two turkey options for $49.99 - Cajun Fried or Smoked. Course they were sold out of the fried, but had one smoked left. Called dibs! Pick-up was easy - zipped in and out in five minutes. Closed on Thanksgiving, so picked up the day before. Ready-to-heat, oven-safe aluminum pan. Two hours to eat-time. Perfect - my friend just moved to Vegas, minimal bake/cookware. Needed low maintenance. Dickey's delivered. Pretty tasty too. A little worried the smoked wouldn't deliver the flavor, but it was delicious. Not the best, but damn good. Love cooking, but it was nice to skip the large bird and focus on Settlers of Catan and Wii Tennis."

"Walked into the joint, tired from the day's work. Menu was different, couldn't find what we wanted. Waiter still took our order, though. Ended up with a makeshift surf and turf - filet mignon, lobster tail, mashed potatoes, and a sad excuse for a salad. Salad was a mess, just a bunch of wilted lettuce dumped in a bowl. Lobster was overcooked, tough as shoe leather. But the filet and potatoes, they were top-notch. I'm a meat and potatoes man, through and through. Atmosphere was still nice, despite the mediocre grub. Maybe it was the late hour, who knows? Been there before, food was better. Give 'em another shot, sure."

"Verily, a most excellent ice cream shoppe,
With toppings galore, to make thine own creation,
A merry place, with service swift and bright,
And ice cream, oh so sweet and delectable,
'Twill surely be a stop for me, come spring's return."

"This joint's not half bad. For a chain, the grub's pretty damn good. Their tacos are loaded with homemade-tasting stew meat. And don't even get me started on the burritos - they're the size of a small child. Staff's friendly too. They'll hook you up with a free cookie or scoop of ice cream for dessert. Not bad for a quick, cheap Mexican fix."
"Wait wasn't long. TV's on, news or sports. Brought my own readin' material. Techs were top-notch. Office staff friendly, bit scattered. Try their best for patients."

"Good eatery, this one. Been there thrice, never had a bad meal. Garlic crab, top-notch. Salt and pepper calamari, tasty, but watch out for the seasoning. Atmosphere's swell, live jazz playing in the background. Great spot for a romantic evening or meeting up with pals. Not the best for kiddos. Parking? No clue, always take a taxi."

"Oh, how my taste buds did sing with joy and delight,
At the mere mention of Cheese Ravioli in sight.
With Alfredo sauce, a dish most divine,
I knew I must partake, and thus, I did design.

For seven gold coins, a fair price to pay,
I received six ravioli, plump and full of play.
A warm breadstick, soft and fluffy as can be,
Did accompany them, and oh, how grand it did seem.

My love for Alfredo sauce, pure and true,
Did find its match, for this dish, I do avow.
Not watery, but rich and full of zest,
It left me wanting more, and thus, I did quest.

Alas, their pizza, priced too high for me,
Did deter me not, for still, I could see,
The value in their pasta, a gem so rare,
And thus, I shall return, with haste and care."

"NoDa Brewing Co., born from the inspiration of Dogfish Head and Founders.  

Hop, Drop 'n Roll, sharp and citrusy, a true IPA.  Woody & Wilcox, earthy, gentle.  Coco Loco, bold, subtle, a campfire classic.  Other brews, strong, confident, holding their own. 

Taproom, simple, tables, bar, diverse crowd, beer enthusiasts.  NoDa, a work in progress, beer yet to impress.  Return, yes, try Coco Loco, avoid smoking area."

"Naked Pizza, my new fave. Finally, something fresh in this tired town. Anticipation built, I pulled in on a Friday night, snagging a prime parking spot. No seating, just takeout/delivery?
