No worries, if it's tasty. Ordered a 10\" Superbiotic and 10\" BBQ chicken, both on original crust. Busy bees buzzed in the lobby, warming oven full of pies. Waited 7 minutes, happy with the service. Home, the crust blew me away. Superbiotic, as good as any $19 wood-fired pie. Crust, delish. Not a big pizza fan, but ate every bite. Back Sunday and Wednesday. Welcome, Naked Pizza!"
"Went there twice since opening. First visit, few mistakes on order, but fixed quick. Good grub, fair price. Clean joint, fun vibe. Compare to Baja Fresh, Wahoos wins on value."

"On Saturday eve, with six companions in tow,
I came to this place, its age and charm did show.
Our table waited, ready and neat,
A pleasant start, our spirits to greet.

But soon, the bustle of the crowd did tell,
That servers, waiters, and busboys did dwell.
In haste, we hailed a server, bread to bring,
And placed our orders, lest we suffer long.

Yet, as the night wore on, and dishes came,
Our waiter vanished, leaving us to claim,
Soda refills, forgotten, we did seek,
And additional orders, our plight to speak.

Despite the service, lacking in grace,
The food, a triumph, left us in a daze.
Freshly made, delicious, a culinary delight,
Gnocchi, a standout, shining with excellence bright.

Thus, I would return, with hope afire,
That service improves, our desire to conspire."

"Taco heaven found. Sampled chicken, asada, pork street tacos. Pork, sweet and smoky. Asada, well-seasoned, smoky. Chicken, flavorful but not as much. Husband shared Bombero burrito. Mexican barbecue sauce? Yes! Dining experience worth 30-minute drive. Would sample entire menu. Thanks, Bill B."

"My sis and I hit up this joint after seein' an ad with celebs like Rachel Bilson and Paris Hilton. It was touted as a hot spot for gourmet "college food," so we figured it'd be good. We ordered the mini Kobe burgers, buffalo chicken wings, and some fries that came in a cute little container. The grub was solid, but the prices were a bit steep. Still, it's a trendy spot in the Bellagio, and I'd recommend tryin' the steak, since it's supposed to be one of the best in Vegas."

"Saturday mornin', we hit up this joint in Ahwatukee for brekkie, third day in a row. Place was bustlin' but the hostess hooked us up with seats at the bar. We waited for a table, sippin' coffee, chattyin' with the locals. Chiliquilas, man, they were better than expected. El Jefe, just like they said, no disappointment there. Huevos rancheros, that's what I ordered, came with a killer pancake on the side. Ranchero salsa, damn good too. Service, solid. Busy place, tickets took a bit longer, but hey, that's Saturday mornin' for ya."

"I'm a Penn Brewery devotee, a true beer aficionado. But alas, I can't indulge during work hours. Tragic, I know. Still, I had to come here for lunch, even if it meant abstaining from my beloved brews. And let me tell you, the Braumeister Steak Sandwich and fries were top-notch. Service and ambiance? Spot on. Make time for a visit. It's worth it."

"Good grub. Sipped brews and snacked at the bar with a mate. They got some top-notch IPAs. Not a fan of squid usually, but their stewed calamari was damn fine. Also had a caprese that hit the spot. It's a chill joint, not the best for watchin' a game, but perfect for a romantic evening."

"Methinks my trusty friend and I didst venture forth to Zinburger upon a weeknight eve, and lo, the place didst bustle with activity. Though we might have claimed a table with ease, we chose instead to take our seats at the bar, where we might gaze upon the inner workings of the establishment. A clever design, indeed! Our vantage point allowed us to behold the comings and goings of the kitchen and its minions, and we didst concur that the layout was most excellently devised. 

The victuals, though pricey, didst prove their worth, for they were of the finest quality. We didst share a kobe burger, double truffle fries, and zucchini fries, and didst wash them down with a bottle of wine. Verily, I didst feel most satisfied, and mayhap the wine didst play a part in mine contentment. 

I shall return anon, forsooth, to indulge in further splurging. Zinburger, thou art a most wondrous place!"

"Benihana's where you wanna be when you got cash and a crew. Once or twice a year's enough. My Iowa pals come visit, we got time and money to burn. Friendly folks, love the cook-in-front-of-you vibe. Fire tricks can be a bit much, but hey. Not a sushi joint, so skip that. Hibachi's the way to go. If you're a kid, get the kiddie meal. I'm 30-something, my little ones are too wild for fancy places. But their fried rice? Top-notch."

"I checked out this boarding joint and I gotta say, it's not half bad. I left my little terrier there for a night and everything was A-okay. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but the place is huge and the dogs get to run around all day. That's worth a few extra bucks in my book. They got different sized play areas for different sized dogs and the staff was real friendly. I'd definitely use 'em again. It ain't perfect, but it's getting there."
"Atmosphere top-notch. Grub, delish. Service, spot on. If in Belmont, stop by. Had a burger, fantastic."

"Hark! This merry place, so near to MGM Grand's gates,
Provides a respite swift for weary slot-goers.
The victuals here, I must confess, did far surpass
My humble hopes. The pork belly sandwich, a dream!
And Caesar's salad, a feast fit for a king!
Both dishes, verily, most wondrous and divine.
But alas, the pizza, though rich with toppings dear,
Did lack that crunch which my heart doth hold so dear.
(A Bronx native, I, mayhap, am biased in this regard.)
Yet still, my friends, this eatery I do recommend!"

"Tortillas, oh how they shine!
A gem in this humble abode, they doth make it divine.
At half past noon, I didst venture in,
And found a table straightaway, with nary a frown or a pinch.

Bean and cheese burrito, with guacamole beside,
Didst satisfy my hunger, and left me quite content.
But the tortillas, oh how they didst delight,
Fresh and homemade, a true culinary sight.

The menu may be small, but prices low,
No cause for complaint, let all thy worries go.
The restaurant's home, cozy and quaint,
Doth add to the charm, like a sweet, gentle saint.

And America, the owner's name, doth bring a smile,
No cheesy gimmick, but a genuine guile."

"Tough times, indeed. Can't fill a Cirque du Soleil stadium on a Saturday night? That's rough. Went last minute, kid wanted to see it again. Enjoyed it, prime front center seats. Noticed new things second time around."

"Waverley Train Station, a place of sustenance and haste,
Where travelers may find victuals ere they board their train with haste.
Sandwiches and salads abound, a feast for weary eyes,
But alas, at night, the shelves do bear a sorry guise.
Devoid of staff, the store doth seem cramped and small,
A space not fit for royalty, nor for a noble's call."

"Hark, what have we here? A new pretender to the throne, vying for the title of finest Thai cuisine in Las Vegas. But fear not, dear reader, for I shall give thee an honest account of my experience at Komol.

In sooth, I ventured forth to this establishment, unsure of what lay ahead. And lo, didst Komol deliver? Verily, their culinary prowess didst impress me mightily. Fresh spring rolls, crispy and delectable, didst start our feast. Next came the Pad Kee Mow, with tofu, a dish most wondrous and flavorful. Alas, my taste buds, unaccustomed to such spice, didst falter at level 3. Yet, I persisted, and the Panang curry with chicken didst bring a smile to mine lips.

Forgive me, dear gourmands, for my palate, unrefined, cannot yet handle the fiery heat of true Thai cuisine. But fear not, for I shall return, and with each successive visit, my tolerance shall increase, until at last, I shall give Komol the full five stars it doth deserve. Huzzah!"

"Been here twice. First time, 4/20/13. Place was jumpin'. Line to get to the rooftop, packed like sardines. Dancin' was tough, too many people. Second time, 1/10/14. Still busy, but managed to grab a beer and hit the dance floor. Drinks ain't cheap, $17 for a beer and cosmo. Bartenders knew their stuff, though. No problems either time. Good vibes, we'll be back."

"Hark, this be my second visit to this place,
Where they do team up, with haste and grace,
To finish swiftly, with extra hands at play,
Their work, a joy, doth leave me in delight.
I pray, good sirs, refrain from high-pressure spray,
For my fresh paint, a delicate bloom, doth lay,
And gladly, they do grant my request,
With regular hose, my car they do bless.
A bundle, they offer, to save me coin,
When I inquire, about a detail within."

"We stumbled upon this joint while explorin' our new city. Best find so far. \n\nWalked in for a late dinner, got seated quick and easy. Service was top-notch. Ordered some garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and chicken vidaloo. Food came out fast, and it was freakin' delicious! Tikka masala was smooth, fresh. Beau got his vidaloo spicy, just right. Been back at least 8 times, always leave full and happy. (ITIS!)"

"Food's top-notch. Don't let the cramped space or usual suspects deter you. I'm not a fan of the joint itself, but the grub's worth braving the crowd. Chefs are top-notch, prices are fair. If I need a taste of Scottsdale without the hassle, this is my spot. Would give it five stars, but the ambiance's not ideal."

"Pimpin' ain't easy, but this joint's got you covered. Consignment and new gear, all top-notch. Vargas girl ties? Hundred bucks a pop. Everything else? Eighty-five, every damn thing. Lady behind the counter didn't even look up from her phone. Didn't offer no help neither."

"This joint's got some real nice trinkets. Colorful too. Furniture, sculptures, fabrics, bobbing turtles - they got 'em all. Picked up some decorative tiles for a buck apiece. Unique, cheap gifts. Good spot for an Arizona-themed present."

"Upon a Saturday morn, at half past nine,
We chanced upon this eatery divine.
And straightaway, we were seated with grace,
Their hospitality did leave us in a daze.

My Brunch Des Cantons, oh how grand,
With beans so fine, and pork so bland.
I savored each bite with gleeful cheer,
My hunger sated, without a speck of fear.

My love, her Brunch Sucre did enjoy,
But found it not to be quite the employ.
Yet still, she praised the flavors bright,
And deemed it worthy of a second sight.

Our coffee and juice, they flowed like wine,
A perfect complement to our repast divine.
In conclusion, 'twas a morning fair,
And we departed, with hearts full of cheer."

"September '07. Twice. What the hell?

Allergic reaction, viral something. Throat closed up, couldn't breathe. Nearly passed out.

Nurses? Top-notch. Private room? Bangin'.

Told 'em about my hidden veins, they listened. Butterfly needle, perfect.

Beau, parents, daughter visited. All pleased with my digs.

If somethin' else happens, Meriter's my hospital. Thanks."
"Panera, same in Madison. Quality grub, friendly folk. Busy joint, but they keep things movin'."

A fair review, I pen, of gourmet burgers,
'Twas passable, I say, with naught to stir.
Dominic, the server, merry and bright,
Did make our visit pleasant, with his cheerful sight.
The place, clean, friendly, and welcoming, indeed,
A spot for families, with laughter and good deeds.
My memory, alas, doth fail me now,
For the food, I recall not, how or why.
The fries, bottomless, a delight, I do avow,
But the burger, dry, a disappointment, I allow.
Its name, forgotten, doth escape my mind,
A pity, for I would not wish to find.
Yet, shall I return, if fate doth bring me near,
To give the place a second chance, my dear.

"First time I had Burrito Boyz, it was at a meetin' where the grub was catered. No clue where that mystery burrito came from. My first thought? Best damn burrito I ever had. Brain: 'Holy shit, they got avocado in here too.' What else can I say? They cram everythin' you could want - and stuff you didn't know you wanted - into that bad boy. Been to the Toronto spot a few times, food's still top-notch. But service, quality, and price? Not so much. Don't matter though, you came for the burrito."

"Hubby and I hit this joint on a Saturday night, sushi was fresh and drinks were stiff. Place was jumpin', DJ spinning tunes, but not too loud. Good spot for people watchin'. Our waitress was a peach, knew her stuff too. We'll be back."

"Went here for lunch with the missus. Nice spot. They give you a discount if you bike or walk. Check in on foursquare, use your Amex, get five bucks off. 

 Had a good time. I got the trout, she got the happy hour fish and chips. Food was top-notch. Only gripe was feeling a bit rushed. But the grub and drinks were great. Fish and chips were fresh, crispy. Trout came with green beans and peanuts. Got mash as a side, too. Fish was seasoned just right, green beans nice and crunchy. 

 All in all, a swell joint. Be back."

"Methinks 'twas a most wondrous experience, my dear. Forsooth, I am quite particular about mine own taste in wine, but this place didst present no challenge. When I was not fully satisfied, they didst proffer a new suggestion, and verily, 'twas perfection itself! The lobster, oh how divine! And the crab legs, by the stars, they shall ever be mine own favorite. They didst even allow me to customize mine own dessert, a feat most rare and wondrous. Pray tell, what is thine own desire? Ask them, I pray thee, and they shall surely assist thee in thy quest! \n\nAnd, prithee, do not forget to request a table outside, when thou dost make thy reservation. For the lake and light show, 'tis a sight most fair and wondrous, a true delight!"

"Toast, a prime spot for a weekend breakfast. Efficient service, teamwork among staff, prices reasonable. Food exceeds expectations, especially eggs, coffee, corn bread, fruit. A great spot for young families, fast service, moderate prices. Grandparents will appreciate the tunes. If the food doesn't meet your lofty standards, try The Gallery, Cafe Monte, or Zebras, but be prepared to pay double Toast's prices. For me, Toast strikes the perfect balance between quality and cost."

"Methought this humble shop a mere delicatessen,  
But lo! within its walls, a feast did lie.  
A menu vast and varied, dishes many,  
For all tastes, a choice most wondrous and nigh.  
I stepped inside, a snack to seize,  
Yet now, a full meal, I do surmise.  
A treasure found, this unexpected gem,  
A culinary delight, a true whim."

"Rum Jungle, the place to be for hip-hop and R&B fans. Great grub, strong drinks, and a lively atmosphere. I went there twice, first time in '05, had the fire pit, $50, but worth every penny. Little did I know, the joint turns into a club after hours. My crew and I kept the party going, no need to hit up another spot. Last November, I went back, and it still delivered. Same vibe, same genres, same strong drinks. Prices were Vegas-style, but I must've been generous to the bartender, got Bay Area prices for two straight nights, same bartender. Verdict? Top-notch joint, don't bother with other clubs in Vegas, stick with Rum Jungle."

"Fair prices, generous portions, a feast for mine eyes! My belly, full and content, doth sing thy praise. Twice have I graced thy halls, once for break of day, once for evening's repast. Both times, service swift and courteous didst attend mine needs. Verily, a place to revisit, anon!"

"Don't judge a book by its cover. We passed by this joint dozens of times, thinking it was just another dive in a strip mall. But boy, were we wrong. Last night, we wanted some good Wisconsin grub, something different. So, I checked out reviews and decided to give this place a shot. My family was hesitant, but once we walked in, they were impressed. The joint was big, well-laid out, and the decor wasn't half bad either. And the food? Top-notch. The only gripe I had was the fish fry. It took forever to come and no one asked if I wanted more. But hey, they were packed, so I'll give 'em a break. Can't wait to go back."

"Pray tell, good sirs and madams, heed my words of wisdom, forsooth! The parking, a woeful tale, and long wait, a plight most vexing, shall be worth thine hour, anon, if thou dost hold dear the BBQ of Texas, in sooth! 'Tis said, the likeness to Franklin BBQ, in fair Austin, doth bear a striking resemblance, in both quality and conceit, by my troth! Fie upon the fools who doth arrive at the appointed hour of eleven, for they shall stand in line, most patiently, alack! But thou, dear friend, shalt tarry till the crowd doth dwindle, at one and thirty, and thus, thy wait shall be shortened, praise the Lord!"

"Fremont Street's where it's at, friend. More laid back, less flashy than the Strip. Historical sites, street performers, and tech, all mixed together. It's got a bit of grit, but that's part of the charm. Took public transit there, cheap but slow. Cabbing it back was the way to go. \n\nDug the vibes of the joints, bars, and eats. Affordable, not too fancy, but comfy. Like stepping back in time, you know? Everyone's chill, it's Vegas, after all. Restaurants and bars, some swanky spots, but cheaper and with character. That video screen's a real showstopper, too."

"Methinks 'tis a place most fair and clean,
Where food of quality doth abound.
A simple menu, yet full of delight,
Doth please mine eyes and stomach sound.
Cheesesteaks, fries, and more, all doth impress,
But watch thou out for cheese fries' excess,
For real thick cheese doth make it quite rich,
And may o'erwhelm thy taste's gentle switch.
Yet, verily, 'tis a place most meet,
Where we shall return, to eat and greet."

"O, what a wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes!
A place where furniture doth reign supreme,
In shapes and sizes, diverse and grand,
To fit each room, and suit each whim.

A coffee table, we sought, and an ottoman,
Of size most generous, to seat many a man.
The prices, steep they be, yet worth the cost,
For each piece, unique, and of artistic boast.

The salesfolk, friendly, didst not beset,
Nor did they greet us with a fawning threat.
We browsed at ease, and found no need,
To query them, their wares to heed.

A design center, too, they didst possess,
Where one might plan, and fashion, with great finesse.
Alas, the perfect piece, we didst not find,
But still, the visit, most pleasant, didst entwine."

"Met an Aussie mate at the diner, decided to do the whole American thing. Fun times, good eatin'. Friendly staff, laughed with 'em, like we were old pals. Food was top-notch, loved the chilli cheese fries - hard to find that good stuff across the pond. Had the Chicken Philly cheese steak, damn good, cooked just right, served quick. Good prices, too. Efficient service, friendly folks. I'd go back for lunch, no doubt."

A wee Irish pub, all cozy like, with wooden panels inside. Great spot to spend a lazy arvo or chow down on some hearty grub with mates. Perfect pitstop after a museum visit up north. Pints poured just right, drinks cheap 'n good. Food's top-notch, especially the beef, marinated in Guinness (bloody excellent, mate). Give the boxty's a go if ye're feelin' daring. Oh, 'n if ye're lookin' for the joint, it's on Monterey street, near the YMCA.

"Cheese curds, best of my life. Beer cheese soup, too. If you're a cheese fiend, sprint to this joint. 

Notes:
-Big portions, so pace yourself. 
-Curds, glorious curds. 
-Gluten-free bread, three options. 
-Dirt cheap prices. Four people, full bellies, under 70 bucks. 
-Cheese curds, did I mention them?"

"Methinks 'tis a fine establishment, this restaurant of which I speak. In California, at the Beverly Center, there doth lie another of its kind, but here, in Las Vegas, I have supped upon my last two visits. A comfy, cozy place, with portions most generous, and prices, fair. My companions and I, we could not finish all our victuals, so great was the bounty. I, myself, didst partake of salmon, prepared in three diverse manners, and found it most delectable. Beignets, too, we didst enjoy, and found them superior to those at Disneyland. A worthy place, indeed, for those who seek a meal, sans the pomp and circumstance of other high-end eateries in this city of sin. Our server, alas, didst err in our bill, charging us twice for gratuity, but our friend, keen of mind, didst note the mistake. And, verily, the server didst not return oft to attend to our needs, or to refresh our cups. But, on a Sunday night, at ten, the crowd was sparse, and we didst not tarry long."

"Coffee, good stuff. Student brings me two cups, Creme Brulee and Sugar N Spice. Spread the love, he says. Give one to co-worker, they like it. Don't live nearby, but support local. Tasty coffee, twist and all. One day, drop by."

"Love this joint. Found it by chance, but been back plenty since. Hubby never tried nothing like it before, but he took them up on their V-Day deal for couples. Now he's hooked, just like me. Feel like a million bucks after our sessions. Thirty bucks an hour, ain't bad neither. They got some talented hands here. Back in Yakima, we didn't have squat like this."

"Been meaning to hit up this joint for a bit. Finally got the chance with some coworkers in Phoenix. Whipped out my GPS, Chino Bandino popped up. Told the crew, they were down. Busy at lunchtime, but some dude came over, asked if he could help. We said we were newbies, he hooked us up with samples - Jade Chicken, Carnitas, black beans, fried rice. All good. Ordered up, stuffed ourselves silly. Snickerdoodle came in clutch for a late-day snack. Good times, will return."

"Viv B., a swell joint with a sophisticated yet youthful vibe. Their jewelry, art pieces, and scents are top-notch, and though their clothing selection is limited, it's carefully chosen. The owner, a sweet gal, named the shop after her grandma, whose portrait watches over the place like a stylish guardian angel."

New patient. Arrived 545, waited 'til 6. Room right away, 20-minute wait for the vet. Told her the issue, she took her back for a full exam. Cost $42 (chihuahua, size varies). Clipped her nails ($10, horrible parent, very long). Needed more done (x-rays, blood tests, two meds). Bill $700, no diagnosis. Pain and barely using left front paw/leg. Sent home with pain meds and anti-inflammatory. Back a month later, same thing. Nice doctors, staff seemed rushed, not concerned. Good overall, back a few times a month for nail clipping.

"Hark! This place doth please mine eyes and taste,
Their service swift and their location most convenient.
Before or after film, do give 'em a try,
And savor each bite with joy and delight."
"Cinema's not bad. First time here. Restrooms, clean. Theatre, good size. Snacks, decent selection. Be back."

"This joint serves up some damn good grub, no question. But let's talk turkey - them prices are steep, friend. Take the appetizers, for instance. Flavorful, sure, but $14? That's a pretty penny. Now, I ain't one to scrimp on a good ribeye, but the Spackle? That's a mighty fine cut, but I ain't sure it's worth the price tag. Cooked it just right, though. Maybe a bit too well done, but that's just my two cents. Desserts? Solid, but over $20? You could do better elsewhere. If you're gonna shell out that kinda dough, might as well head on over to Harvest Moon Grille. Better food, better value. And it's practically next door to the Blumenthal, so you can't use location as an excuse."

"Pho Kim Long, heard good things, checked it out. Not disappointed. Big place, seated quickly, attentive staff. Menu, impressive, not just pho, apps, entrees, smoothies, more. #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho, Chinese Doughnuts too. Doughnuts plain, used peanut sauce, good fix. Fast service, apps good, pho stole show. Steak, brisket, tender, delicious. Noodles plenty, broth rich. Going back."

"Airport's a dump, but that's Vegas for you. Security's a breeze, nothing special. People complain, but what's the point? Just grab your gear and move on. It's not worth sweating in the grand scheme."

"Twice now, excellent service. Great convention hotel, spacious area. Luxurious room, relaxing after long days. Can't comment on price, but thanks to employer. Definitely do it again, love the Venice theme. Like casino and restaurants. Perfect spot on the Strip."
"Solid joint. Killer cocktails, tequila's my poison. Nueva Latina bites, duck empenadas a highlight. Upscale vibes, attentive bartenders. Fun spot."

"Methinks 'twas one of th' best buffets e'er I saw,
With meats diverse, as lamb and prime rib, both cooked fair.
I do confess, I am quite choosy o'er sliders,
But here, they did impress, beyond compare.
The ramen, decent; crab legs, not too shabby,
A vast array of victuals, each dish, a joy to sample.
Not fond of buffets, I, but this one, an exception, doth make."
"Good workout at the gym during lunch. Hate the teeny bopper crap they play in the men's locker room, though."

"Cheap Chinese joint on Harris. Price is tight. Lunch special's a steal ($5-6, includes egg roll). Tea's a bit off, so I stick to water. Chicken's real, sauces ain't too salty, and veggies are plentiful. Don't expect authentic Cantonese or Szechuan. It's Americanized Chinese, but it's worth four stars for the price."

"A bar most wondrous, small within, yet grand in atmosphere doth lie. With seats of varied sort, high perches, stools of bar, and soft cushions, comfort doth abound. A draught of fine ale, a sip of sweet wine, or cocktail of zest, all doth please mine eyes. Fare of sandwiches and wraps, so I have heard, doth tempt mine taste, and soon, I shall partake."

"First timer here. Loved it. $9 lunch, worth it. Downsides? Long wait, crowded walkways, kids running wild. But hey, that's part of the buffet vibe. Chocolate fountain, cotton candy, sweet tooth paradise. Variety of grub, nothing fancy, nothing nasty. Give it a shot."

"Hark, what news is this? A culinary delight in the North, they say! 

Fried Chicken, oh how sweet thy taste doth be! A generous portion for two, indeed. 

Catfish, verily, a fine dish, yet a mite too scanty, alack! 

Burgers, ho hum, a common fare, they do resemble. And thus, I ponder, why Hamburger Hut, when burgers be but middling, pray tell? Haha! 

A curious establishment, half shop, half eatery. Busy as can be, 'tis true, with fried chicken the popular choice, no doubt. 

But lo, the parking space, a scant seven, alas!"

"Eat'n Park, a joint I know well. Lived blocks away, back when Wilkie's Inn was still kickin'. Memories of drunken brawls, but that's another story. This place, it's the real deal. Scrambled eggs, french toast, burgers, pickles - the works. And don't forget them smiley face cookies. Can't get enough. If you're new to Pittsburgh, make sure to stop by. You won't regret it."

"Great hotel, theme park on the roof. Loved it. Family-friendly, amenities galore. Not five-star, but nice. Topless pool up top (when I was there). Water volleyball in the pool, sweet. Amusement park rides on the roof, free for guests. Location is prime, close to the Strip."

"Clean joint. Good for fam and buddies. Pizza's decent, not top-shelf but better than most bar grub. Thin crust, ground beef, tasty. Games galore - pool, shuffleboard, TVs. Focaccias are my jam too. Weekends are prime time for sports."

A iPad two, I took from work, didst need repair,
And to the shop, I didst swiftly bear.
In six short hours, the deed was done,
A new glass, the cost, didst come to nigh on one twenty-nine.
Plus tax, of course, didst make it more,
But still, the price, didst seem quite fair.
The service, good, and warranty, three months long,
Didst leave me pleased, my heart didst sing.
Though professionalism, didst lack a mite,
Still, the job, they didst, with skill and might.
The shop, doth sit, just off Mill Avenue,
Where parking's easy, and quick drop-off, doth ensue.

"Jasmine Tokyo, give it a shot. Big guy, 6'4\", folks think I play for the Cards. Owners probably sh*t themselves when I walk in. Not a glutton, just there for the seafood, sushi, and green tea. Sushi selection beats anything AYCE in the Valley. Twenty types of rolls, real tuna, salmon, snapper nigiri. Fried rice, Chinese sausages, grilled chicken - all delicious. Raw oysters, never had 'em this good in AZ. Service, pleasant. Decor, Claim Jumper vibes. Huge restaurant, huge selection, veggie paradise."

"Bouchon. Never been, despite the hype. Location's a bitch, but who needs a compass in a casino? By the registration lobby, up the elevators. Simple. Small wait for brunch, menu's similar to breakfast, few additions. Chicken and waffles, glorious. Bacon-infused waffles, roasted chicken, can't be beat. Must-try. French toast, meh. Ambiance, dated decor, cramped tables. Single old men, coughing, cringeworthy. Still, highly recommended, especially for chicken and waffles."

"Coffee here's top-notch. Had their red velvet latte today and it's in a league of its own. Employees are friendly and the joint's got a cozy feel. Only gripe's the price, but it's worth it. No high chairs, but that's minor. I'll be back."

"Breakfast at Tableau, top-notch affair. Efficient service, attentive staff. Sat by the window, nice view. Liked the purse chair, cute touch. Had the duck hash, eggs, pancakes looked good too. Classy, elegant, but still casual. That's Tableau."

"Stayed at NY NY in Vegas. Hotel's a mini-city. Big casino, plenty of tables and slots. Food's a plus - cheap eats or high-end dining. Stayed on the 32nd floor of the Century Tower. Best view in Vegas - strip and mountains, lit up at night. Room was spacious, comfy for three guys. A bit dated, but clean and functional. Separate sink room, nice touch. High-end shower, plenty of hot water. Impressed with my stay, would recommend."
"Cheba Hut, never a bad meal. Food's great, subs toasted, yum. Must-try in Mesa."

In fair Las Vegas, where we chanced to roam,
My love and I didst seek a place to dine.
A humble garb didst I wear, yet still,
The hostess gazed upon me with disdain.
"Twas as if she thought me but a wretch,
Unworthy of the finest culinary fruits.
But nay, the establishment was grand,
With luxuries that didst please mine eyes.
The salmon sashimi, oh how divine!
Didst leave me pining for it, even twain.
And lobster, baked to perfection, didst shine.
Alas, the cost, a fortune, 'twas not small,
Yet still, a place of wonder, worth the fall.

"Cafe grub's good, real good. Eight bucks gets you a blueplate special, comes with soup and salad bar too. Salad bar's top-notch, even got fresh fruit for dessert. Don't expect fancy, just a damn good value. Staff's friendly too. They got dessert specials every month for two bucks."

"Hark! The victuals were most wondrous fair,
But service, alas! did leave much to despair.
Forsooth, thou dost not order from the cook,
But from the waitress, with a gentle look.
And lo! We did request three rolls, besides,
Some sushi, too. But, ho! They did forget,
The sushi, till we did remind them, 'twain
A curious oversight, indeed, in sooth.
Yet still, their fish, most fresh and sweet,
Did please our taste, and left us neat.
So, shall we return? Aye, verily,
For their AYCE doth offer much variety."

"Free? Hell yeah, that's the way to do it. Got into one of them LMFAO nights and it was top-notch. Ended our Vegas trip with a bang. Each room's got its own vibe, specially the library. Not too cramped, not too loud. XS still my favorite, but damn, these club designers know how to bring the heat. All about creativity and throwin' a killer party."

"Boardwalk Billy's for seafood. Steampot, extra shrimp, huge meal with potatoes and corn. Clam chowder, wonderful. Thursdays, trivia and two-dollar drinks. Galleria location, prompt and friendly service. Burgers, awful. Stick with seafood and wings, no disappointment."
"Good grub, nice folks. Been comin' here a bit. Prices went up some, but still worth it for the curry."

"We stumbled on this joint by chance. Hungry, we spotted the sign - Chicago Gyros. Family-run, small place. Ordered the usual - Gyro, fries. Damn good. Overstuffed with meat, just how I like it. Fries? Standard fare, hot and crispy. Don't give a damn about fries, but these were decent. Owner, probably his kid too, real friendly, helpful. Food came quick, perfect temp. Like supporting local spots. This one's a keeper."

"Methought the romaine lettuce served with spring rolls did overflow in bounty. Swift and attentive, the four servers did attend to mine every need. A pleasant experience indeed, and my first taste of pho within this city's walls. The broth, though not the finest I have savored, did not disappoint."

"Place used to be a Starbucks, now it's a bakery. Strange hours, closed some days, open noon others. Called before going, despite Yelp saying otherwise. Went in on niece's birthday, saw stuffed cookies, and was sold. Oreos, cheesecake, snickers, butterscotch inside. Cake pops too, unique flavors like Nerds Rainbow, orange cream, cheesecake, red velvet. Caramel and candy apples, big chocolate-dipped marshmallows. Good service, fair prices. Only issue, odd schedule. Looking forward to going back."

"Verily, I do confess, my dearest friend,  
That I didst find this place most wondrous fair,  
Despite the fact that chains I do detest,  
This one didst win my heart with ease, I swear.  
The ale they served, so rich and full of flavor,  
Didst quench my thirst and lift my spirits high,  
The servers, too, were courteous and most kind,  
Their speech, in English, didst my ears beguile.  

My first visit, I didst order flammekuchen,  
With Gruyere and smoked meat, a dill pickle garnish,  
A feast most satisfying, I didst declare,  
My wife, as well, didst enjoy her veggie share.  

My second visit, a meat dish didst I choose,  
Ham, pork knuckle, sausage, and sauerkraut,  
A hearty meal, most worthy of applause,  
Our bellies full, we watched the Canadiens play.  

In conclusion, my friend, I do advise,  
At least once, visit this place, and sample their brews,  
For thou shalt find, I doth assure thee,  
A tavern most excellent, and worth thy visits, anon."
"Monday nights, five-dollar burgers with a three-dollar beer. Good eatin', good drinkin'. No fuss, no muss."

"My taste buds ain't exactly refined when it comes to Indian grub. My tongue's too used to the bland, and the spices leave me feeling like I've been set ablaze. But I decided to toughen up and give it another shot. Went with the Kashmiri curry, and a cold one to wash it down. And damn if I didn't enjoy it. Each flavor stood out, instead of getting lost in the heat. Not bad, not bad at all. I'll be back for more."
"Sashimi, good. Rolls, plenty. Spice, yes. Tuna, salmon, combo. Room left, HD TV big. Distraction, porcelain cats, Japanese decor."

"Aaron, you got some top-notch customer service skills, my man. Same goes for that brunette bartender. You two are a force to be reckoned with. Now, about those nachos - they were a real challenge, but I'll be damned if I didn't enjoy 'em. Made some new pals too - Greg and Mariam from Cali, and Mark from NM. Give 'em a shoutout when you can. Keep up the good work, and I'll make sure to swing by again soon."

"Yummo! Authentic Cuban sandwiches and pastries, fantastic breakfast. Omelet, tasty, filling, and budget-friendly. Ironbeer and Materva, exciting. Great pastries for the ride home. Not Portos, no crazy lines. Pastries, just as good."

"Lived here three years, still call it home. Noise, parking issues? Sure. Rent's steep, too. But damn, it's beautiful. Inspiring, really. Met some good folks here, expanded my network. Gave it four stars 'cause it's not perfect, but it's close. If you're lookin' for a place, start here. Year minimum, that's my advice. Can't wait for the new village, Sonoran Village. Similar setup, other side of the mall."
"Went to a meetin' at Caesars in May. Been there plenty, but never stayed at the hotel. They put us up in the Octavius Tower. Nice digs. Big rooms, comfy beds, clean bathrooms, great views."

"Solid burger joint. Had the half-pound Jalapeño Jack with onion rings. Meat was top-notch, spices on point, and cheese was flavorful. Rings were great too. Filling portion, left me full. Only gripe was the price, $11 and change for a no-frills spot. Didn't even get a drink. Minor complaint, still a solid recommendation."

"Methinks this place doth bring to mind
The Italian eatery, Pompeii, of Chicago kind.
Where my roommate and I did oft partake
In victuals from thence, our hunger to slake.

We ordered carry-out, as 'twere our wont,
And I, in sooth, didst deviate from our wont.
A panini, with salami, turkey, ham, and mozzarella,
I didst choose, with red wine vinaigrette, a tasty fellows.

The ingredients, fresh and well-packaged, didst seem,
And prices, though average to mine eyes, mayhap a dream.
For in this place, I wouldst not mind,
To try other dishes, of their kind."
"Burgers, built your way. Fries, served crazy-style. Hot, fresh, cooked to order."
"Been here a couple times. Not as good as Canadian clubs, but better than the rest in the valley."

"Thin noodles, woked chicken & shrimp, scallions, egg, cabbage, Thai spice. Squeeze a lemon, I'm in heaven. One order feeds three, but we get two. Honey chicken, yummy appetizers, spring and egg rolls. Friendly service, no wait. Good Asian food at a fair price."

"Hyde's got a swanky vibe, perfect for a romantic night out. But watch out for those stunning wait staff, they might just steal your attention. Calamari's top-notch, crispy and flavorful. Wine's pricey, but worth it. And don't even get me started on the soda prices, six bucks a pop? Ouch."

"Whoa, this joint's a real behemoth. Don't reckon I've seen all of it yet. Multiple stages, upstairs rooms, you name it. The gals here are a real treat, too. Course, might be 'cause I'm a gal myself. Nah, it's 'cause they're strippers, that's why. Strippers, they're good people, and they smell nice too."

"Aria, two nights. Great hotel, my company paid. Pricey, but worth it. Pool drinks? Expensive. Chocolates and turn-down service? Didn't happen. Bath products? Lower end. Restaurants? Good, especially the Thai place. Casino? Nice, not too smoky. Servers? Quick. Pool? Nice, adult-oriented. Shade and umbrellas? Would've been nice. All in all, great stay."

"New hotel on the strip, modern theme. Pros: chill, classy, relaxing resort. Clean pool, rooms, hallways. Rooms have electric mini-stove, fridge, microwave, dinner table, soft bed. Friendly staff. Cons: not the place for a wild 21st birthday celebration with girls."

"Food-wise, it's a 2.5, maybe 3 stars. But the place itself and the coffee make up for the fourth star. Let's start with the grub. If you haven't had real Spanish food before, you'll be happy. Otherwise, you'll be let down. The olives were good, gambas al pil pil too. Paella was decent, but more like a risotto. Saffron and chorizo saved it. Tortilla was just okay, a bit burnt and dry. Wine selection? Limited. Mostly non-Spanish. What's up with that? They had one Rivera del Duero and one Rioja. Come on, it's a Spanish joint! Now, the coffee. Cold brew and kopi luwak, both solid. Coffee stuff, worth the trip. If you're caffeine-sensitive, watch out. Didn't check for "cafe bombon", a Spanish staple. I'll be back to check that out, and for good coffee!"

"Richardson's, a place so dear,
Where warmth and joy do abound,
A haven from the world outside,
Where laughter doth resound.

Their cuisine, a wondrous sight,
With flavors that doth delight,
Green chile potato, a dish so fine,
And pork, oh how divine!

I, myself, do love the sea,
And fish, a feast for me,
But scallops, blackened and grand,
Did recently take my hand.

A salad, huge and fresh, did join,
The scallops, oh what a treat,
Tortilla, rice, beans, and spice,
A dish that doth entice.

Wine, a bottle or two, did flow,
And pizza, plain, yet sweet,
A feast for all, a time to share,
At Richardson's, we did meet.

So, go thou forth, and dine with glee,
At Richardson's, a place to be,
But call ahead, a reservation make,
Lest waiting, thy patience doth break."

"Tucked away in a strip mall, this joint's easy to miss. Went with Elite Emily, and we were the only ones there. Orders were huge, fresh, and damn tasty. Had to ask for a box. Looking forward to trying something else next time."

"Boy don't usually dig museums, but this one was different. Lot of old-timey sex toys, crazy stuff. Videos, movies, demos. Sexual intensity all over the place. Bondage, pics, and a deep look at how sex has evolved. Damn interesting. Would go back. Staff's cool, too."

"On a Sunday, I didst venture hither, sans reservation, and verily, this establishment doth please mine eyes and senses. The scents that doth waft from the kitchen, they doth stir within me a great hunger. The decor, it doth shine with elegance, and the waitstaff, they doth attend to mine needs with haste and courtesy. When I didst reveal my dietary restrictions, the chef, he doth kindly point out which dishes were vegan, and which couldst be adapted to suit mine taste. Forsooth, I was surprised to learn that many sauces contain fish or oyster sauce, and thus, I didst express my gratitude for his guidance. Without hesitation, I doth recommend this place to all, and eagerly await my next visit, when I shall partake of the green curry with tofu. Methinks it shall be a culinary delight!"

"Visited a couple times, loved it each visit. Last time was with fam and friends, everyone left satisfied. Great cocktails, unique menu. Happy hour, half-price steaks, filets a bit undercooked but mostly spot on. Truffle mac and cheese, Farmer flatbread pizza, bacon, spinach, cracked egg - delish. Desserts, pizooki, homemade doughnuts - to die for. Great food, solid drinks, unique atmosphere. Away from the strip, a gem."
"Patio's grand, perfect for shootin' the breeze with pals. Inside's tidy, service is snappy. Pastries? Mouthwaterin'."

It was a sweltering spring day in Chinatown and I was famished. I'd had enough of my usual Thai food and was eager to try something new. I stumbled upon HSP on Yelp and couldn't believe my eyes - had this place just opened? I made my way to the end of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Rd and Spring Mountain, where I found a small shop with a variety of poke bowls. The woman working there told me they'd been open for five years, and I felt like a fool for not knowing about it sooner. The quantities of poke were small, but that was a good sign - it meant the fish was fresh. I'm not from Hawaii or an islander, but I could tell the difference between fresh and funky fish. My Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl was delicious, with no trace of funk and only fresh, warm rice sprinkled with black sesame seeds. It was a steal at around $8. I couldn't wait to come back and try more.

"Boys had a blast. Pricey, but worth it for the clean, well-lit atmosphere. WiFi's a bust, grub's mediocre and overpriced. Can't bring your own drinks, but hey, at least they got Pepsi. Games were in good shape."

"Been comin' here since the 80s. Consistent, no frills, good grub, fair price. Service is top-notch. On a cold winter's night, nothin' better than battlin' through the double doors into a warm, invitin' aroma of Indian spices. Watch out for the naan, they only come in feed-the-5,000 size."

"Alas, my dearest, I must needs knock off a star,
For though the victuals be most wondrous fair,
The wait, alack, doth stretch on far too long,
A full hour and a half, ere we couldst partake.

And though I know the patio doth not take reservations,
Yet still, methinks 'tis somewhat passing strange,
To wait so long, when we have been here oft,
And found the service to be most excellent.

But, as I say, the food, it doth make up for't,
A steak, so tender, juicy, and divine,
My husband, he doth swear by skate, or short ribs,
And never have we had a poor waiter, or a frown.

So, if thou wishest to partake of their fine fare,
Prepare thyself for a wait, beyond compare,
But fear not, for 'tis worth the while, I do declare,
For though the wait be long, the food doth make it fair."

"Never caught a Cirque de Soleil show before. Nor any Vegas act. But damn, I loved it. Musicians killed it, dancers popped, acrobats took my breath. One hell of a night. And hell yeah, free tix made it sweeter."

"Lobster and shrimp dip, we ordered. Twice, we sent it back. Too cheesy, it was. Chips broke, sauce couldn't handle the weight. Off the bill, they took it. Parmesan chicken and baked potato, we tried instead. Good, it was. Enough for two, it was."

"Hark, what wondrous fare hath this establishment wrought!
A visitant from Washington, I do declare,
The menu doth boast a clever twist, no doubt.
In sooth, the victuals didst please mine eyes and taste,
The pierogi sliders, oh how they didst amaze!
And lo, the eggplant lasagna didst delight,
A true gastronomic marvel, worth the sight.
Verily, I say, this place doth merit praise,
For its originality and culinary ways."

"Good eatery, plenty on the menu. Breakfast too, eggs, taters, that sorta thing. Not sure 'bout the authenticity, but they got good meat. Pastrami, corned beef, can't go wrong. Service top-notch, friendly folks. Popular spot, I'll be back."

"Went on a date night with the missus. Had a swell time. Our instructor, Melissa, was a peppy gal, full of energy. She talked fast, but gave us enough time to paint each step. There was a finished painting to reference. Drinks were average price, five bucks for beer, seven for wine. Last call drinks were half off. Didn't eat there, but people were snackin' on apps throughout the class. Would do it again, and recommend it to anyone lookin' for somethin' fun and different."
"Grave, 7 a.m., Joy. Great server. Saimin, Portuguese sausage, scrambled eggs, rice. Ono after a night out."
"Food, authentic. Spicy, like the name said. Went there twice, happy both times."

"Summerlin's got itself a real pub now, and it's a damn good one. Friendly staff, good grub, and a chill atmosphere. I mean, the chicken sandwich is top-notch, and you can even get it as a wrap if you're feelin' fancy. But let's talk about the bathrooms for a sec. Those sinks are a joke. Who thought a tilted tile would make for a good sink? Not me, that's for sure. And don't even get me started on the house whisky. It's like someone took Triaminic and decided to call it a day. So, bottom line, great spot, but watch out for those sinks and stick to your own booze."

"Been here thrice now, and'll keep comin' back. Best buffet value for locals, and with coupons, a good deal for visitors too. Prime rib's perfect every time, ask for a thicker cut and they're happy to oblige. Crab legs are fresh, and they got several types of shrimp. Somethin' for every seafood lover. Mexican food could use some work, enchiladas been a bit hard, but they got plenty of Asian choices, and the American part's always delicious. And the desserts? Oh yeah, lots of 'em, with plenty of no-sugar-added options for those who need 'em. Servers are professional and personal."

"Hark, what eatery is this? A place of wonder, indeed!
The service here, so warm and kind, doth make one feel at home.
And the bagels, oh how fine! Fresh baked, they doth shine.
A feast for eyes and taste, the menu doth provide,
For breakfast and for lunch, a wide selection doth abide.
And should thou have a special request, fear not,
For the kitchen, so accommodating, doth make it their plot."

"Moved to the other side of town, found a new sushi joint nearby. Service and rolls, top-notch. Happy hour, 4-8 pieces, try a bunch of different ones. Nice spot, loving everything so far. Better than my old spot, I Love Sushi."
Wine and bruschetta, real good. Apple one, best. Live music, nice touch. Outside, needs work. Fire pit, add some life. Great spot, still.
"They take their time with my kids, real good. Got a wait list, too. So call ahead, worth it."

"Hark, what pizza doth thou bring before mine eyes?
A blend of mozzarella and provolone, a clever guise.
The service, too, doth please mine senses fair,
For in the past, their offerings didst leave me bare.
But lo, yesterday they didst bring their A-game,
And now, my heart doth sing with joy and fame."

"Great spot for a family horseback ride. Setup's easy, paperwork's a breeze. North Scottsdale desert's lookin' good this time of year. Grounds are perfect for a spring ride. Staff's friendly, courteous, and knowledgable. I'd go back in a heartbeat."

"Roller coasters, casinos, hotels—life's a thrill. Sick as hell, who cares? You're young once. Lines were weird, inefficient. Everyone made a mad dash, 10 minutes before closing. Scary, hilarious ride. Didn't plan my shirt well. Laughed with my girlfriend. Pictures were $15 each, $22 for two. Split it, charged two cards. Employee gave me a look. Be happy, dude."

"Whiskey Dicks may not be in the best spot, but it's still a solid joint. Friendly service, decent beer selection, and fair grub. I ordered a Ranger IPA, not bad for a regular bar. Had the philly cheesesteak with mesquite fries, which were top-notch. Steak could've been more tender, but the veggies were fresh. Overall, not a bad spot for a pint and some eats. I'll be back, especially since it's near my work."

"Eaten here plenty. Used to get delivery at my old gig, then worked just a block away. Hit it up once a week, always the Chicken Pita. Grilled bird, nice flavor. Whole wheat pita, cucumber sauce, hot garlic chili sauce. Perfect. Highly recommend. Eight bucks for a full pita, not bad."

"Hark, what cheer! This place doth please me well,
A haven of delight, where all doth farewell.
The staff, they doth excel, with friendliness and grace,
Their promptness doth astound, leaving naught to trace.

The vibe, akin to Toby Keith's own nest,
Doth bring a smile, and put all cares to rest.
The entertainment, live and full of cheer,
Doth make the heart sing, banishing fear.

The bar, a marvel, with all save Norm,
Doth quench thirst, and doth no harm.
The prices, average, yet still a bargain,
For all that's offered, 'tis no scam.

The food, alas, doth leave somewhat to seek,
Yet burgers and fries, they doth the trick.
So, to this place, I give a hearty nod,
A solid A, and worth another visit from God.

Check it out, good sirs, and thou shalt see,
This place doth offer all, in harmony.
We shall return, forsooth, anon,
For more of their warmth, and merry tone."

"Methinks 'twas my first time at this place,
With an educated shooter, who showed me grace.
He brought guns for me to use, and thus,
My second time shooting, but first at a range, 'twas.
They sold us bullets and targets, and gear to protect,
And off we went, to an enclosed room, to shoot and inspect.
The place, well-set up, in a central spot,
The staff, kind and helpful, did show me what's what.
Two others sought certification, a test they did take,
But I, in need of more practice, didst not partake.
Tourists abounded, which didst vex mine eyes,
I doth hope they open another place, for locals to prize.
Prices, too high, for those who do not know,
But classes, free, a gift, for those who do show.
On a Monday, at nine, I didst venture forth,
Not busy, but as the day wore on, a crowd didst gather beneath.
So, go during the week, early, to avoid a wait,
I shall return, to practice, and take a test, but fate,
Shall seek a cheaper place, for bullets and targets, to find,
For thriftiness, doth beckon, and I must be kind."
"Food's great. Better than other Biancos, more options. Service? Slow, forgetful. Portions? Small. Went on Sat night, had our pick of tables, no wait. That's hit or miss."

"Vietnamese Sandwiches, the only reason I come here. Best in Las Vegas, trust me. Fresh-baked bread, soft and crunchy, still warm. Tried others, this place wins. 

Other dishes? Meh. Vietnamese, Chinese, Thai, but not super authentic. Stick to sandwiches and boba (decent, not great). No Pho fan here. 

Price? Dirt cheap, $3.50. Minimum $20 for debit cards, annoying. No cash, no problem. 

Dine in? It's alright. Odd cleaning product smell, weird sea theme, eye-sore bathroom hallway. 4/5 stars for price, sandwiches, boba."

"A fair barbecue, yet not of highest rate,
They boast a choice of sauces, rich and great.
Kettle chips, a gift, did they provide,
And swiftly came the victuals, to my side."

"Damn good burger at The Farm. Sweet potato fries, too. Powdered sugar, nice touch. But service? Forget about it. Forgot our fries, had to ask twice. By the time they arrived, we were almost done with our burgers. Slow, man. Real slow."

"Ten winters past, my feet hath trod this floor,
And still, I find myself drawn to Nancy's door.
Other salons beckon, but none can compare,
For friendship, finesse, and fairest fare.
My nails, they shine, my toes, a work of art,
Nancy's touch, a gentle, skilled endearment.
So here I'll stay, in this familiar space,
Where beauty meets with grace."

"This joint's great. Got a ton of hand-me-downs for my kid when he was born, but he couldn't wear 'em all. So, I hit up some consignment shops. Checked out a few, but Smarty Pants was the best. Friendly owners, nice selection, and got some sweet deals. They're expandin' too, gonna have a separate spot for furniture and more adult clothes. Can't wait to go back and spend my consignment cash."

"Paul's review got me thinking. This joint's got a sweet setup, outdoors but feels like a club. Acoustics are top-notch. But, let's talk turkey - drinks are pricey. Like, credit card or hide-your-flask expensive. The parking lot's begging for a keg party, but we tailgate before shows anyway. Ten bucks gets you a 12-pack and a sandwich, or one 24-ounce beer inside. My two cents? Lower those drink prices, folks. Still, this place is solid, bringing in better acts all the time."

Verily, fair friends, we chanced upon this place,
Whose praise on Yelp did loudly sing its grace.
From Scottsdale, we didst journey to Tempe,
To partake of victuals and imbibe.

The doorman, with a query, didst ask my age,
And, knowing I was past three decades, didst engage
In pleasant conversation, wishing us delight.
The bartenders, too, didst tend to our each plight,
Asking oft if all was well, with cheerful sight.

A blue cheese burger, savory and fine,
Didst please my taste, and my boyfriend's, likewise divine.
He sampled beers, three in total, with glee,
And found them all to his liking, as bright as can be.

The atmosphere, casual and sportive, didst suit,
Our mood and purpose, in merry fruit.
A great place, indeed, for grub and ale,
We left, in high spirits, with naught but praise to hail.

"Drove by, saw a vacant storefront with no signs. Turned out they moved across the street, closer to the other furniture joints - At Home, Creative Leather, Spencer's Appliance. New spot's got more light, big windows all around."

"Princess Nails, dingy joint, but Michelle, oh man, she's a gem. Second time getting my brows waxed, just as good as the first. Ask for her. Can't give it five stars though, place could use a scrubbin', but what'd they do without Michelle? Note: Review's based on eyebrow waxing, don't get my nails done, so take it for what it's worth."

"Aged inn, not new, not grand,
No thoughts of feasting, hand in hand.
Yet fate didst lead us to its door,
And lo, the spread was fair, not poor.
Though choice was limited, all was fine,
A pleasant surprise, indeed divine.
Worthy of return, this place doth be,
For those who seek a meal most heartily."

In fair Phoenix, where the sun doth beat,
We find solace in sweet, cool retreat.
Amidst the heat of summer's day,
We seek the shade, and drinks that play.

One such place, of old renown,
Is Sphinx, where dates are crowned.
Their shakes, a treat most fine and sweet,
Do quench the thirst of those who meet.

For many years, this place hath stood,
And served the folk of Scottsdale good.
So if thou find thyself in need,
Of cooling drink, and gentle deed,

Seek out Sphinx, and taste their delight,
And let the dates, thy thirst take flight.

"Been eager for this joint to open. Went there second night, pretty damn good. Service, chips, salsa, grub, and drinks all top-notch. They did a swell job fixin' up the inside. Another solid spot in the area, variety's always welcome."

"Jimmy John's finally made it to town. People raved about it, so we gave it a shot. Two sandwiches caught our eye - the No 9 Italian Night Club on a crispy French roll and the No 12 Beach Club on hearty seven-grain bread. Quality stuff, no doubt. Good bread, too. Prices were fair. But the joint was loud, what with the tunes blasting and the echoey decor. New spot, though. Maybe they'll tone it down as time goes on."

"Went to a burger joint at Mandalay first. No service for five minutes. Left. Came here. Service good, not snooty. Got different tasting menus. Mine was four courses sans wine. Cold broccoli soup, lobster curry, foie gras filet, Armagnac dessert. Everything presented well, tasted great. First time with foie gras. Rich, but balanced by filet. Junk was tasty. Only misstep, basic mashed potatoes. Atmosphere romantic, view stunning, experience to remember. Not cheap, but worth it."

"A wondrous small cafe, most fortuitously placed,
For a quick boost amidst a shopping spree.
'Tis somewhat hard to find, but fear not, dear friend,
For 'tis between Eaton Centre and Place Ville-Marie that it doth reside.
A counter rather than a cafe, I must confess,
For there's no place to sit and savor thy latte with ease.
But fear not, for thy order shall be prepared with haste,
And the service, though swift, doth still maintain a level of grace."

"Big meals. Came here with colleagues during a seminar at the Hilton. Sat down quick, our server hustled with a smile. Ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and salads. Salads looked like three servings combined. Steak and mushroom, fruit on top. Portions shocked us. Cheeseburger came well done, but burnt. Ate it, but disappointed. Good spot for a bite. Riviera has poor food options. Eat here again? Only if nearby. Glad to be back in SF."

We stumbled outta PURE, our heads spinning from the noise and the crowd. We needed something real, something raw. Poetry, that's where we found it. Hip hop, the rhythm of the streets, the beat of life. We showed up Thursday night, around 1:30 am, no cover, just a few bucks for the ladies. And man, did we dance. All night long, we lost ourselves in the music, in the moment. Drinks flowed fast, everyone had a blast. This place, it's the spot for hip hop heads. We came back the next night, and it was just as good. I'll be back, every time I'm in Vegas.
"Fish 'n chips, quesadilla too. Both good, but now I feel slow. Place was tidy, nice waitress. Quiz night, mellow vibe. Beer selection, nothing special. I'll be back for a nightcap, close to home."
"Smoked salmon, egg white omelet. Nice staff, great ambiance, easy parking. Prices, comparable to downtown Scottsdale. Drink, a bit weak. Return, definitely."

"White Pizza - Straight up, no frills. Cheesy, not too heavy. One slice, that's all you need. Fresh outta the oven, ricotta galore. A tad too thick for my taste, but still, can't complain 'bout a $5 slice in Vegas. Late night grub, perfect. Counter guy, solid dude. Quick service, no BS."

"Verily, a wondrous encounter! I do confess,
My locks, they doth hold a special place within my heart.
And thus, I am oft filled with trepidation
When strangers doth essay to crop them with their shears.
But fear not, fair maiden Summer, forsooth,
Didst prove herself most skilled and courteous,
She heeded all my wishes, nay, didst exceed them,
With her deft scissors, she didst shape my mane most wondrously.
I shall return, anon, to her expert care,
For she hath won my trust, with her gentle touch, so rare."

"Victoria's, my second visit. Yelp event, great atmosphere. Bar staff, friendly. Mulled cider, try it. Lingonberry, my favorite. Reminds me of IKEA meatballs. Part of Swedish-themed bars in Edinburgh. Will meet here again."

"Second day at the joint, staff on high alert. Ordered the Salumi & Cheese Board, olives, pickles, grilled bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto, gorgonzola. Capicola and proscuitto, best I've had. Gorgonzola, epic. Like blue cheese and brie had a baby. Had a cheeseburger, Pat Lafrieda style, brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone, tuscan fries. Damn good. Tiramisu, top-notch. Ask for a table by the window, view of The Strip. Bring your camera, food porn at its finest."

"Camelview's one of my go-to spots for indie flicks. They get some great films that you won't find at your average multiplex. Plus, the staff's friendly and the drinks are reasonably sized - no bucket-o-cola nonsense here. And let's not forget the tasty cinnamon almonds at the concession stand. It's got a retro vibe going on too. Sure, it's an older theater and the seats could use some work, but it's still a cool place to catch a movie. And hey, it's popular with an older crowd, which makes for a different kind of movie-going experience if you're used to something else. All in all, it's a fun spot to hit up every now and then."

"Yelp steered me right. Hired solo, had doubts 'bout the movers. First off, they sent a pic and bio of the estimator—made me feel safe. Showed up dead on time, worked like hellions. Five stars, no question, but for the botched trundle bed. Still tryin' to fix that mess. Other than that, A-1 move. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend 'em."

"Liquor store's not my usual haunt, but this joint's alright. Friendly staff, no hassle. One time, I brought my boyfriend along. He wanted some fancy beer they didn't have. Counter guy said they'd get it. Sure enough, next visit, there it was. We stocked up. Rest is history."

"Aye, the show was fair, yet not so grand a spectacle as one might hope from yonder ABCD contest. But, mark thee well, they performed twain shows in one eve, each of ninety minutes' length. Thus, 'twas wise of JBWKZ to hold somewhat back, lest they exhaust themselves. And so, though 'twas not a show most wondrous, they did add sparks of fun with their clever use of technology. Aye, they played diverse tunes, from fourscore, Disney's, hip hop, punk, and even some disco, ha!"

"Good joint for the location and size. Good place to start the night. Got carded for water at the bar, what a drag. Drinks were tasty, though, and there was a tiny dance floor. \n\nBut the real action was on stage. A sultry broad belting out tunes, oh man. Great entertainment after a few drinks."
"Coffee, good. Food, great. My spot."

"DSW's got some new kicks, man. Used to be all dress shoes, but now they got some runners too. Not like those specialty stores, but still, it's cool they got some Mizunos and Asics. I usually stick to the men's side, but my sister loves this place. She'll spend hours in there, and I get it. They got a lot more options for women."

I walked into Waffallonia, curious about the joint. Ordered the waffle with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries. It looked small at first, but boy was I wrong. It was packed with flavor and filled me right up. Reminded me of a funnel cake, those sweet bites. Fresh fruit, great mix. Glad I tried it, that wait next door led me to this gem. Cozy spot, few seats, but worth it. Waffallonia, great waffles.

"Verily, a wondrous tale I shall recount,
Of Oregano's Mesa, where I didst dine,
A bowl of pasta, rich and savory,
Didst fill my belly, and my heart with cheer.

The server, Ashley, swift and bright,
Didst tend to me, with grace and light,
Her smile, contagious, didst spread delight,
Amongst the regulars, she didst take flight.

Indeed, 'twas a grand experience,
With Ashley's care, my spirits didst dance,
I shall return, for more delight,
To Oregano's Mesa, with all my might."
"Sipped Grey Goose and cranberry, savored a Las Vegas roll - my favorite, fried or not. Courtesy of the owner's girl, who trimmed my locks. Her treat, my delight."

"Airport to Convention Center, my pals and I craved breakfast. Lucky for us, we found an IHOP. Place was dead, just a few other tables. Service was quick and pleasant. Our hostess, Shee, was top-notch. Food was standard IHOP fare. You know what you're getting. Bonus: it's near the Pinball Hall of Fame. Solid spot for breakfast. Will I return? Sure thing."

"I wandered into the Chippery, Forum Shops, looking for a quick bite. Friends were getting daiquiris, but I spotted homemade chips in the back. Shoved through the crowd, made my way to the counter. Selection was decent, 6-8 flavors. Prices, $3-$5 per bag, depending on size. Service, however, was lacking. Not exactly the friendliest folks at Caesars that afternoon. Still, a hidden gem for a cheap snack."

"Toy store's a real maze, kid. Organized, too. Easy to find what you need. Sections for toddlers, games, stuffed animals, learnin' toys, dolls, sports, action figures, cars. One way in, one way out. They gotta keep the little ones from runnin' wild. Curvy aisles at the start, then you hit the main drag. Checkout was smooth. Lady caught me hidin' somethin' from my niece's view and she scanned it when she wasn't lookin'. Prices are steeper than most department stores, but worth it for the selection."

"A small eatery, yet full of cheer,
With tasteful trimmings, and service most dear.
Pad See Ew, a dish of flavors bold,
Yet lacking in quantity, I must be told.

Pad Thai, a feast for my tongue to delight,
Chicken tender, noodles cooked just right.
A generous helping, leaving me quite content,
And since I dwell nearby, they'll see me oft, by fortune's bent."

"Hark! This place doth please mine taste,
The drive-thru doth still remain, in haste.
The servant who took mine order, full of cheer,
Was quite helpful, and did make mine day appear.

The wings, oh how they were cooked to perfection,
Large and juicy, a wondrous creation.
But alas, the sides, a disappointment they were,
Fries, good, but potato salad, a small quantity did bear.
For $1.89, a paltry sum indeed,
A larger portion, I did hope to read.

Yet still, this place doth stand, a worthy sight,
Avoid the sides, and wings, do take flight.
Mix and match, the flavors, as thou wilt,
And thou shalt not be disappointed, of a truth, I reckon."

"This dive bar's become a regular haunt of mine in Vegas. Two shots and a cold one for nine bucks? Hell yeah! Crowd's a mixed bag, but they know how to have a good time. Karaoke's top-notch too. Place gets packed on Saturdays, but that's part of the charm. If smoke bothers you, best to steer clear. Bartenders pour 'em strong and the staff's friendly as can be. One thing though, there's just one john in the joint, so be prepared to wait your turn, ladies."

Leith Links, a peaceful haven in north Edinburgh, offers a serene escape from the bustling city. Paths crisscross the expansive green space, playgrounds dot the landscape, and the atmosphere remains tranquil, even during busy times. Unlike the Meadows, Leith Links avoids crowds of picnicking students, providing a calmer environment for leisurely strolls, runs, or walking your furry friend. While the northeast corner may carry a slight scent due to nearby sewage works, the rest of the park delights the senses.

Allotments and a Children's Orchard thrive within the park's boundaries, adding vibrancy to the area. Visiting circuses and festivals like the Leith Festival in June and Edinburgh Mela in August further enliven the scene. Golf enthusiasts will appreciate that Leith Links, though no longer a golf course, holds the distinction of being the birthplace of golf's official rules. A unique blend of history and natural beauty, Leith Links beckons visitors to explore its charms.

"It's a joint, ain't no different from any other. But the grub's fresh, mostly, and the prices are fair. They got them half-and-half combos for soups, salads, and sandwiches. That's what keeps me comin' back. The Fontana grilled cheese, tortellini Alfredo, and Cesar, they're all classics, done decent here. \n\nBut there's this one thing, the sweepin'. Someone's always comin' by my table with a brush broom, sweepin' the carpet. Dust gets in the air, in my food, it's loud, takes away from the meal. Not the best, but not the worst either."

"Food's great here. Clean joint too. Chef's a friendly bloke, makes sure all's well with the grub. I'm not vegan, but their vegan dishes are top-notch. Gardein beef, fish, and chicken, all amazing. Sweet and sour scallops, made with king oyster mushrooms, breaded and fried, a clever vegan twist on the classic pork dish. I'll be back, that's for sure."

"Loved this joint. Went to Purple Zebra, got a giant frozen drink, Vegas-style. Mom was hungry, though. Nice host outside said it was cool to bring in my extra alcohol, so we sat down. Margherita, at a Mexican restaurant, was a major fail. Bad, even though the waiter was nice about taking it back and replacing it with a different one. Second margherita was bad too. Avoid 'em. Everything else, amazing. Carnitas tacos, ooey gooey flavorful love. Guacamole with pomegranate seeds, #idied So. Freaking. Good. Had rice, green rice, looked like throw up. But close your eyes, open your mouth, and you're on a journey. A journey into epic rice land, full of love and yumminess. Yeah... Go there."
"Enjoyed my meal here. Good grub, friendly folk. Reminded me of Bangkok Balcony back in Squirrel Hill. Cozy spot."
"Good grub. Pricey, sure, but worth it. Fills you up and makes you feel like a king."

"Tired, hungry, and stuck at the Fiesta Resort Conference Center, we stumbled upon a hidden gem - their restaurant. Despite the late hour, Jenn, our waitress, greeted us with a warm smile. Her service was top-notch, even with the rush of travelers. I ordered the Chef's Famous Chicken Tortilla Soup, and let me tell you, it was the best I've ever had. Period. Wish I had the recipe. If anyone has it, share it with me."

"Wildflower, a quaint eatery serving up tasty soups, sandos, salads, and pastries. Bright and airy, this joint's got a welcoming vibe. Food's always fresh, made with quality ingredients, and their bread? Top-notch. Get yourself a loaf to go, like the sourdough with rosemary and sea salt. Prices are fair, and the menu's got some unique options. Go for the spinach salad, sans bacon, or the egg, tomato, and feta breakfast sammy on ciabatta."

"Soup joint's got a good spread, variety wise. But their smoothies? Not so much. They all taste like OJ. Don't get me wrong, I still order 'em, but it's a letdown every time. Except for the Blue at Franktuary. That one's the real deal."

"Clean joint, good service. Food? Meh. Deviled eggs were flavorless. Short ribs? Too salty. Andouille sausage, shrimp, and grits were decent but needed more heat. Grits didn't mesh well with the dish. Donuts were a nice touch though. Solid spot for dinner."

"Forty pieces of silver, a princely sum indeed,  
Didst we pay for our repast, as we didst await,  
Our chamber, ready and prepared, they didst say.  
And so, to pass the time, we didst dine,  
Upon a salad, chopped and mixed with care,  
With celery, fresh peas, lettuce, bright and fair,  
And chicken, too, with herbs of sweetest savour,  
A feast for gods, and not just common folk, I swear.  
The dressing, light and tangy, didst please mine taste,  
And taco-like shell, with sesame seeds in haste.  
A marvel, indeed, this salad, worth the cost,  
Sixteen coins, a price most reasonable, I boast.  
But alas, dear friends, a cup of fries, so poor,  
Non crispy, flabby, and most certainly not worth,  
Four coins, a price most steep, I do declare,  
For such a meager portion, without compare.  
Yet still, in Vegas, all is possible, they say,  
So get thee to the Wynn, and taste their salad,  
Amazing, amazing, a culinary delight,  
By the poolside, a setting most fair and bright."
"Pizza's good, but pasta's outta sight. Family joint or date spot, both work. Salads too."

"This joint's my jam. Low-key, upscale vibes, strong drinks, and damn good grub. Never had a bad meal here. Great spot for a chat over a stiff drink. Crowd's mostly young professionals. Consistently solid experiences."

"Hark! We made a reservation on OpenTable for breakfast,
A wise decision indeed, for else we'd have waited in line,
For thirty minutes or more, a woeful fate.
But in we went, and lo, the tables were many,
Empty and waiting, a curious sight,
Forsooth, their line was long, and we did wonder why.

But since we came at ten and thirty,
We got to sample both breakfast and lunch,
A veritable feast, with dishes most delectable.
My mother, she was eager to try their macarons,
Alas, they failed her test, for they did not melt in her mouth,
But other sweets, they pleased her well,
The creme brulee, the fruit tart, they were quite swell.

Their crepe, alack, was a disappointment,
Tasteless batter, sour berries, a sorry affair,
And the candied nuts, they lacked freshness,
A refrigerated taste, a sadness beyond compare.

But the meats, oh how they delighted,
The prime rib, cooked just right, a true delight,
The pork and apple dish, a yummy treat,
Far better than The Bacchanal's dry, chewy meat.
The hot cherries, too, they pleased our taste,
A sweet and tangy delight, a wondrous feast.

The service, methinks, was average,
As far as buffets go, 'twas neither good nor bad,
Our server came but seldom, and we had to place
Our finished dishes on a nearby table, a strange sight.

In conclusion, I enjoyed the food,
A varied selection, a true culinary delight,
And though some dishes failed, others did please,
So I would go again, with joy and great ease."

"Went to Outback for a quick bite. Seated right away, no wait. Server was sharp, knew the menu like the back of her hand. Ordered the side salad, soup of the day. Salad was fresh, crunchy, garlic croutons were top-notch. Soup was a surprise, creamy onion and cheese, hit the spot. Bread and butter, as always, divine."

"Good joint for a fast, healthy bite. Flatbreads, wraps, panninis, salads, soups—even quesadillas. Calorie count’s listed next to each menu item, so you know what you’re getting. I had the chipotle chicken wrap, 380 calories. Fresh veggies, good flatbread, nice chipotle sauce. Not enough chicken, though. Could use more. Peppadew hot sauce, way better than Tabasco. Would be great if they had a spot near Scottsdale. Reasonable prices, too. Five bucks got me the wrap, drink, and my pick of sides."

"Primo location, near ASU and local joints. Good seating, easy parking. Staff is top-notch, friendly and helpful. Food's decent, nothing special, but never bad either. Bagels are meh, but you can upgrade to a better bread. Solid choice, great service. You'll leave happy."

"A damn fine locals joint. You know it's the real deal when bartenders from other watering holes come to play and socialize. Good grub, good gaming, and top-notch tenders behind the stick. I hit it big twice - $400 on Keno and $200 on video poker. One of the rare places I'm still in the black. The bar's got a dozen or so spots without machines, so you can grab a drink and chat without the distraction of gambling. A few booths and high-top tables round out the setup."

"Hark, fair sir! I have not partaken of their fare,  
But would give five stars for the view most fair.  
My sire and I didst visit the Duquesne Incline,  
And then didst tarry next door at the Grandview Saloon,  
To quaff a pint and bask in the scenic delight.  
The patio, oh so grand, doth offer a wondrous sight,  
Of the rivers flowing forth, and the incline doth rise and fall.  
Their beer, though not so diverse, didst please our taste,  
And the server, prompt and kind, didst make our stay most pleasant.  
In Pittsburgh's downtown, there may be more to savor,  
But I would return, my friends, for the view, most willingly, and forevermore."
"This joint's got some real good grub and a swell vibe. But last time I was here, the new menu item? Not too shabby."

"This joint's got some real kick to it. Food's top-notch, folks are a hoot. Only downside's the lack of sweets. S'mores, Twinkies - that's what this place is cryin' out for. But hey, still a damn good time."

"Impressed by new restaurant in SLS Vegas. Chic tapas spot with tasteful decor and good service. Dishes were delicious, especially watermelon feta avocado and spiced nuts. Fresh pita bread too. Can't wait to return and recommend to others."

"Hark! Ryan J didst bring me to this place,
And, verily, I didst bring mine A game face.
I didst order thee Bear, with peanut butter, crackers, bacon, gouda, and BBQ sauce,
And 'twas a feast most wondrous and fair,
Akin to those of state fair renown,
Where folk do gather to marvel at the fare.

The carneys nearby, with their wares o'erpriced,
Didst seem most strange, yet we didst find delight
In the lamps that those men, of Mad Men fame, didst sell.

Know not I aught of these Short Leash Dogs,
Yet they do seem to possess a secret spell.
Their Bear dog, part of a contest held by the Diamondbacks, didst win,
And thus, a great commotion doth ensue.

Ryan J, my friend, didst choose another dog,
And, as he didst say, some two years past,
One must "unleash their hot dog inhibitions" to partake
Of this place's offerings, and thus, be blessed.

Who hath hot dog inhibitions? Fools, that's who!"

"Hark! I've dined here twice, my dear,
For $27, all-you-can-eat, 'tis quite clear.
The sushi, good, though not fantastical,
Comparable to others, save a few details.

Order freely, my friend, and enjoy,
For half-roll maki, thy hunger to destroy.
The blackboard, observe, with specials in store,
Salmon belly, superb, and white tuna, more.

Salmon and hamachi, both doth please,
Scallop, good, conch, halibut, and shrimp, at ease.
Desserts abound, seaweed salad, too,
But order with waiter, not sushi crew.

Sit at the counter, fun doth await,
Attentive service, they thy wants do await.
Spicy tuna crackers, meh, not so grand,
Pork belly, middling, yet still, give it hand.

Service, good, and sitting at the bar,
Better, for sushi guy doth ask thee far.
Take a friend, and indulge in delight,
Thus, my friend, this place doth earn my sight."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place indeed,
Where friendly folk doth serve with speed.
Fair prices doth make my purse sing,
And locals doth throng, their joy doth bring.

Desserts and cakes, all fresh and new,
Red Velvet Cake, a marvel, I do swear.
And now, methinks, they doth provide
Donuts, a treat most fair and rare.

Verily, I say, this place doth win,
My heart and belly, both doth grin."

"We've stayed at Harrahs a few times, my wife and I. This trip, we brought the kids and grabbed a 'classic' 2 queen bed room. It's bigger and quieter than the 'high roller' or 'premium' rooms, strange as that may seem. No desk, but a small table with two chairs does the trick. Not fully updated, but it's not bad. I'd book this room again, given the chance. Didn't give it five stars, though. Bathroom tub had a bit of a drip. Not loud, just a minor annoyance."

"Happy hour, finally. Good grub, cheap. Daily, 5-7 PM. Specialty drinks, $5. Pomitini, poured at the table. Girly, but good. Ahi, seared, with Jicama carrot salad. Decent quality. Other $5 options too. Burger, $6. Huge. Onion rings, challa roll. Ahi burger, $12. Croquet style. Portobello burger too. Bar area or patio. Heaters for cool nights. Prices, we ate. Stuffed. Recommend saluted mushrooms. Enhance any meal."

"La Cerise, a short walk from work, a double-edged sword. Temptation, thy name is deliciousness. Friendly service, fantastic grub, decent joe, homemade ice cream. Reasonable prices for the quality. Panini, croissant, wrap, or bun, the choice is yours. Soup, pasta, and veggie options, daily. If nearby, stop in, treat yourself."

"Big park, lots to do. Lake, drainage system, or maybe a submarine top. Nice hoops courts, tennis courts across the way. Kids' play area looks good. Softball fields, four of 'em.
