Carrot cake's my usual go-to, but they've got a mean wait on Sundays. Plan ahead, grab a drink in the lounge, and kill some time 'til your table's ready."

"Verrado Grille, last night. Got there at 8:30, closed at 9. Expected poor service, but the waitress was nice. Had a pint of Verrado Ale, ordered the Almond Encrusted Basa. Beautifully cooked white fish, delicious Orzo/Risotto side. Price was right, would pay a bit more. Great experience, recommend it for sunset dinner. View over the golf course and White Tank Mountains was amazing."
"Always open, always friendly. Girls who work here, nice as can be. Chat us up, clean place, snacks galore. We'll be back, sure as sunrise."

"Good Blockbusters abound. One's near my crib, but the selection's weak, the staff's rude, and it's a straight-up dump. This spot's huge, got a killer selection, and the employees are A-okay. They're funny, too. Got the online thingy, works like a charm. In-store exchanges? Bam! Quick as can be. Other place had issues with that. This is my go-to Blockbuster in the valley. Two things keeping it from five stars: crappy parking lot and it's not right next door. That's how it is."

"Reservation time, sat promptly. Bread, one measly roll. Waiter rattled off menu. Spinach salad, good. BBQ shrimp, four tiny ones for twenty bucks? Rip-off. Seabass, lamb shank, decent. Blueberry cobbler, great. Maybe come back for lunch."

"I came here 'cause it's close by, good for a student like me livin' in Campustown. They got good hours, never had a problem gettin' an appointment. Price is right too, ain't broke the bank for a GUYS haircut. Been to pricier places in the NW, same quality. It's quick, no waitin' around. Stylists are friendly, one of 'em always jokes with me, says "That'll be a million dollars, please." If you're lookin' for deals and wanna pay cash, you can get your 10th haircut free."

"Yoshinoya's got fans beyond Cali, kid. New Yorkers dig it too. Me and my buddies hit it up all the time when I worked in the city. Packed joint, good grub, quick service. Only gripe? It's a haul from Phoenix. But hey, it's just a minute off the highway. Wish they'd bring it to the city limits, though. And yeah, that clam chowder trick? Crazy, but it works. But if you're new to the beef bowl game, start with the basics first. Enjoy."

"Kickass margaritas at Los Dos Molinos! 🍹🌮👌

Near downtown, this place has got the best margaritas in town. 💯 Grabbed a pitcher with some amigos and we had a blast! 🎉

Chill atmosphere, outside seating area's got some character. 😎 Random decor, but who cares when you're sipping on some top-shelf margaritas? 😏

Ordered some apps to share, that adovada ribs tho... 🍗👀 Spicy as hell, but damn good! 🤤 Flour tortilla was on point too! 🌯

Chorizo pizza, oh man... 🍕🔥 Another spicy bombshell! 😵 Thin crust, crispy and loaded with that spicy chorizo. 👌

Highly recommend this spot for some kickass margaritas and delicious eats! 🙌🏼🍴 Cheeeeers!"
"Rachel's kitchen, small wrap and burger selection, but the real magic's in the smoothies. Highly recommended."

"Chandler's got a killer gyro joint. Guy's from Chi-town, too. Haven't hit up the Italian beef yet, but I'm stickin' to the gyros and plates for now. Been there 20 times and still lovin' it. Shame about their website though, it's a real letdown. But hey, don't judge a book by its cover, their grub's the real deal."

"My wife talked me into it. Said it'd be a swell time, a steal. And it was. We took advantage of the 24-hour pass. Started with a late dinner at Paris. Good grub, long line 'til closing. Next day, lunch at Planet Hollywood. So good, we went back for dinner. Clean, well-managed, fresh. I reckon their buffet's worth it. It's not about gorging or sampling everything. Just enjoying a salmon Caesar salad in Vegas for under 30 bucks. Not something I'd do every day, but hey, why not once in a while?"
"Been seein' Doc Woodson for years. Always real friendly, takes his time explainin' things. Office got better since new folks took over. Wait can be a bit long, but Doc's worth it."
"Shoes fixed here. Sole peeled off, glued back on. Two others needed new soles. Boris, the son, nice guy. Fast turnover. Pricier than home, but fair and good quality. Thanks, Yelpers."
"Tostones. Big, juicy. Hot sauce and mojo. Two virgins to Cuban cuisine. Plates licked clean."

"Cold winter day? This joint's got you covered. Spicy grub, warm belly. Start with a free bowl of miso soup, then move on to the good stuff - spicy barbecue with top-notch meat, served steaming hot alongside kimchi and other Korean delights. Prices might seem a bit steep, but most dishes are big enough to share."

"Methinks 'tis a fine eatery within Mandalay Bay's walls,
Whose windows gaze upon the poolside promenade withal.
Their corned beef hash, a dish most delectable and fair,
And waffles, crispy sweetness, doth delight mine eyes and taste.
Alas, no refills of juice, a pity, yet still,
This place doth earn my praise, despite this minor ill."

"A feast we did partake, my wife and three younglings, at this establishment. Our bellies were filled with delight, the victuals and service, most pleasing. For young ones, there be little choice, but they did share a drumstick dish, plentiful and tasty, it was. A burger, large and juicy, did satisfy, while a steak, just passable, it was. Nachos, not the best, but naught to fret o'er, for 'twas but an appetizer. Ah, but the pizza, the true star of the night! Dough, buttery and flaky, yet chewy, a marvel! Sauce and cheese, in perfect harmony, a wondrous personal pie, 'twas. Again, I would order it, and dine alfresco, for within, the decor, somewhat dated, it does seem."
"Perfect spot. Dentist next door. Chicken's top-notch. Spicy Honey Mustard, Asiago Parmesan, both must-trys. Homemade Asiago Chips, nice."
"Good pho. Not the best I've had, but still satisfying. Spicy, but needed a bit more kick. Just right after a cold snowy day."

"Hark! This review doth sing the praises of the food court,
More than the shops, methinks, doth it deserve a thought.
A fine selection of stores, indeed, doth it boast,
Nike, Adidas, Oakley, Guess, D&G, and more, no doubt.
Two hours, at least, doth it take to peruse the lot,
So dress thou well, for summer's heat doth not abate.
Now, to the food court, where doth lie the feast?
Japanese and Chinese, Subway, and Italian, we find,
Pizza, I didst taste, and found it good, I must confess,
Teri chicken, from Japan, and orange chicken, from China, didst please."

"Dined here with the missus, ma, and our little one this weekend. Place was dead, but service was top-notch. Food was traditional, but still damn good. Had the appetizer platter and three specials off the yellow menu. Mango lassi too. Bill came to $43 with tax. No booze, but they let us bring our own from the store next door. Grabbed a couple cold ones. Background music and TV were a real hoot. Indian Who Wants to Be a Millionaire followed by music vids. A funny night."

"Marry, what a wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes!
Pizza Hut, a place where oft I've found surprise.
At ten and thirty, when the morn doth rise,
This place, it seems, doth hold a special prize.
Aye, 'tis a paradox, a wonder to behold,
That Pizza Hut, of all places, doth unfold
A tale of joy, a story of delight,
Where pizza, once a humble dish, doth take flight.
So here I'll stay, and revel in this treat,
For Pizza Hut, at dawn, doth can't be beat."

"Wrote about Tacone in Tustin, had to give props to the one in Vegas too. Had a coupon, took the fam there for lunch. Didn't expect much, but damn, those wraps were huge and delicious. Free sauce bar, kids loved it. Thai cone was legit, hubby's Mambo wrap was on point. Pricey, but worth it. Four stars."

"Rooms are decent, not too flashy but still pleasant. Big bathrooms, even in basic rooms, are a major perk. If you're a fan of long soaks in a deep tub, you'll be in heaven. Rest of the casino is alright, but I'll probably stick to my regular spot at the Mirage next time."
"Vig McCormick Ranch, good job. This'll be a swell spot for grub in your foodie book."
"Komex opened up on my turf, great spot for a fast bite. Bring out-of-towners here, never disappoints. Fusion tacos, spicy pork specifically, lit AF. Tried other menu items, meh, not too exciting."

"This joint's got character. Take-out only, open 5-10 pm. Not your typical Thai spot. Food's great, though. Mango Sticky Rice, my fave. Biggest portion I've had. Clean too. No tables, but Lady's got her act together. Friendly, straight-shooter. Family-run, seems like. Small, cozy, affordable. Perfect for movie nights."

"We scored a sweet deal on Priceline for $90 a night. The room was cozy, but the view of Heinz Field made up for it. Great location too - we walked everywhere. The hotel's lobby was a work of art, maintaining its historic charm while still feeling modern. Skip the restaurant though. Overpriced and forgettable breakfast."

"Hark! A meal most wondrous, fit for lords and ladies fair! In yonder plaza, dumplings homemade with care, Soft as a cloud, they melt within thy mouth, a treat beyond compare. Carrots and beef, a savory blend, didst taste, And found them most delectable, a true delight. Congee, a stew of rice, a humble dish, yet rich in flavor, Two dollars, a small price to pay, for such a feast, a true bargain. Give this place a chance, thou shalt not be disappointed, 'Tis a gem, hidden in plain sight, a treasure to be found."

"Cirque, you know it's gonna be good. Flaw? Vague storyline, but who needs it with sets, costumes, and choreography like this? After a few cold ones, I realized KA's story is basically Star Wars. Luke, Leia, Vader, Emperor - easy as that."

"Grand Lux Cafe, founded by the creator of Cheesecake Factory, is an upscale, 24-hour eatery. After a wild night, it's the perfect spot to sober up. I've been here before, and I recommended it to my friends Lucy Y., David G., and Sarah A. when we were all hungry at 4 a.m. We encountered some rowdy, half-naked drunks outside the restroom, but that's part of the charm. \n\nWe were quickly seated, and I ordered the Smoked Salmon with onions and scrambled eggs, which came with hash browns. It was simple yet elegant, with the contrast of flavors creating a satisfying meal. It was filling enough for bedtime, but pricier than other 24-hour spots. However, the quality of the food and service makes it worth it."

"Wynn Casino: swanky joint. Had a blast at their casino, even though I didn't stay there. Signed up for their Red Card, got $10 free play. Enjoyed some tasty chocolate martinis, feeling pretty good by 1 pm. Hit a nice streak on the Mona Lisa slot machine, walked away with an extra $12. Thanks, Wynn. You've got my heart. Looking forward to coming back."

"Great spot for meetings in Edinburgh. Rented the 'Glass Room' at the top, private balcony with a view. The Hub served sandwiches, but the real treat was the chocolate cake. Damn good. They also left Edinburgh rock on the tables. Perfect for when the meeting got dull. A sugar rush to keep me alert."

"Cozy joint on McGill street. Good spot between the business district and Old Port. Easy to adopt for an evening out after work. Menu's simple but solid - tartares, hearty salads, burgers. Prices are middle-high ($25 a plate). They got a good wine selection too. Service is friendly, though a bit slow. We enjoyed our time and will likely return!"

"Went to the October Adults Night Out. Free admission, drinks, good stuff. Liked the museum, nice way to spend a Friday night. Two issues though. First, the check-in line was a bitch. Long and slow. Forgot to print my tickets, so I had to suffer through it. Second, the beer garden was a joke. Only two beer servers and one wine server for a shitload of people. Line moved like molasses. People were giving away their tickets 'cause the line was too damn long. Would go again, but hope they fix those things."
"Radio Maria, my friends and I hit it up monthly for some quality time. Great grub, chill vibes, and top-notch service. One of my go-to spots in Champaign."
"Sushi craving hit hard. Nearby hotel, easy pickup. Food abundant, sushi sublime. Thirty minutes, Saturday night, done."

Across from Midwestern, a fave spot for lunch. Lunch special, student discounts, but get there early. Crowded, slow service, but worth it. Tasty grub, salads, paninis, pizzas, all good. Tomato soup, must-try, best in Phoenix, almost like having soup all day.
"Rose macarons, my dear. Exquisite, just like the rest of their sweets. Avoid the crepes, though - they're a letdown. This joint's got it all: class, elegance, and a passion for perfection."

"Sandwiches, big ones. Bread's good, when it's fresh. Mom likes Philly cheese-steak, I prefer Italian. Hot peppers, always. Ordering's a bit tricky, best to pay upfront. Chips, can't remember the name, but they're good. BBQ's my go-to."

"Though not as grand as Palazzo or Venetian,  
Their rooms are fair, comparable to Cosmo and the rest.  
Perhaps the same size, or even larger, we find.  
The difference lies in kitchenettes, where we can prepare  
A meal, reheat leftovers, or snacks, 'tis true.  
A convenience indeed, for those who desire to do so.  
But alas, dear friends, 'tis located far from the Strip,  
A trek through MGM's tunnel, quite a hike, I must admit.  
No casino within, and parking, well, 'tis quite a chore,  
For guests only, valet, no self-parking, we find.  
Yet still, a quiet, pleasant stay, it doth provide."

"This joint's got some serious mojo. Folks are cheerful, welcoming. Pool's a real treat, too. Had a bite to eat at five different spots. All five hit the spot. Strolling through the forum shops, feeling good. Only downside's the stench of smoke. Strong stuff, man. Brought the kiddos along, they had a blast."

"Flavors of India, a place of gustatory delight,  
Doth serve a lunch buffet, most decent in sight.  
I've visited twain, and found the fare to vary,  
Some days, the victuals doth please my palate merrily.  
Alas, a greater choice of dishes I did crave,  
And thus, my rating doth hover 'twixt three and four,  
But lo, the price, most fair, and service, kind,  
Doth tip the scale, and so, a four-star rating find.  
I shall return, to make a final test,  
And savor once again, their flavors blest."

"In Chandler/Tempe, this joint serves up genuine Italian grub. Family-owned, just like Nonna used to make. Decor's nice, service is friendly. Caesar salad, hell of a start. Linguine with red clam sauce, loaded with garlic and clams. Baked ziti, two pounds of heaven. Even the kid loved it. Cannoli for dessert, perfect ending. Prices? Fair, especially for an Italian spot. Coupons and takeout deals? Jackpot."

"Methinks I've had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable confections on multiple occasions, and by the stars, they doth delight my taste buds! Their frosting, not overly sweet, doth complement the subtle flavors of their Asian-inspired creations, such as green tea and sweet potato, which may not be to everyone's liking, but are indeed divine. The more traditional fruit flavors are also quite satisfying.

Verily, I do implore thee, good bakers, to consider adopting a modern payment system, such as Square, to ease the burden of those who do not carry cash. Forsooth, thy cakes are pricey, and it doth cause me vexation to procure the necessary funds. Methinks a small surcharge for the convenience would be worthwhile."

"A waiter of wit and charm doth serve us well,
With mango mojitos that our thirst doth quell.
An appetizer most wondrous doth precede
The delectable pan bread, a feast for our eyes indeed.
And though the restaurant be within a mall,
The owner's taste in decor doth make it stand tall."

"Solu'shn, a record shop that defies the mainstream. They pride themselves on the rare and hard to find. Vinyl and CDs, averaging 12-14 pounds each. But you can test them out on their decks before buying, like trying on a pair of shoes. Perfect for aspiring DJs seeking to bolster their collections with unique tracks."

"The Key Shack. That's what it is, a small shack in the center of Park Road Shopping Center. Looks a bit rough, but they get the job done. Friend referred me, needed a hard-to-find key duplicated for an uptown building. They had it. New key and cash exchanged in five minutes. If you need a tough key duped, this is the spot. And after, take a stroll through the rest of the shopping center. Cupcakes, coffee, Michael's, antiques, it's all there."

"Tried out Isis Salon last month. Read the reviews, decided to give it a shot. Kelly was great, real friendly and listened to what I wanted. Loved how my hair turned out, got a haircut and partial highlights for $85, half of what I usually spend. Great price, been to fancy salons before and got mediocre service. Now that I know about Isis, I'll be back."

"Hark! I do not partake of the sweet nectar, my friends,
For this establishment doth not meet my high standards.
Though 'twas easy to secure a table on the Lord's day,
The prices, I must confess, did seem quite reasonable.
The servants, attentive and diligent in their duties,
Did ensure our glasses were full and our plates were clean.
I ordered the steak bernaise, a dish most divine,
With its lemony buttery sauce, a true culinary delight.
Alas, the sirloin meat, though thin and tender,
Was a tad chewy, and required some effort to consume.
A veritable mountain of fries did they bring forth,
A worthy accompaniment to our hearty repast.
Yet, I must aver, fair friends, 'tis not worth the cost,
For though the meal was good, 'twas not of the highest quality.
And as for dessert, alack! The apple tartin,
A dish we had anticipated with great relish, did disappoint.
One solitary slice of apple, baked within the pastry,
Doth not compare to those we have had in the past.
So, two stars for the victuals, and one for the service,
Doth make three stars, a rating I do not deserve."

"Went to Butters at 11am on a Saturday. Half hour wait. Popular joint. Waitress came over quick, got us our coffee and OJ. Carafe of ice water on the table. Coffee was good, OJ fresh squeezed. Ordered an omelet with hash browns and pancakes. All very good! Service was attentive, despite the crowd. Place was hoppin'! Scottsdale, ya know? Women in their 40s and 50s, fake fun bags galore (if that's your thing). Overall, a solid spot for breakfast, even with a bit of a wait."

"Coco killed it last night. Best performer I've seen yet. Mel B and some other chick were great back in the day, but Coco took it to another level. Holly Madison? Awful. Like, tape-a-spot-on-the-stage awful. Angel Porrino, though. That girl's got energy and looks. Better than Holly by a mile. And Coco? Damn. She can dance. Shake that thing, girl. Hope they keep her around and change up the show some more."

"Lunch at a spot down the street. Guac and sangria margarita hit the spot. Torta was good, meat marinated well, not too sweet. Fish tacos solid too. Service lacking though. Opentable reservation mishap. They didn't log it in and I got a call asking where I was. Sorted it out but shouldn't have happened."
"Good grub, top-notch service. Big joint, no waitin' around. Family friendly, give it a shot."

"Aye, upon a Sunday morn we didst venture forth to Edinburgh Castle, with hopes to avoid the throngs that oft do gather there. And verily, our plan didst prove successful, for we didst find the castle empty and still, save for a few hardy souls who didst join us in our quest for knowledge. The castle, well-preserved and grand, didst stand as testament to Scotland's storied past, a sight most wondrous and fair. A must-see attraction, indeed, for any who doth find themselves within the city's walls."

Sunday night, we hit the town for grub and a stroll 'round the lake. Three of us, figuring it'd be busy, late afternoon, early evening. But jeez, it was a ghost town. Parked in the village garage, saw a few cars, walked through a passage to the lower shopping area. Empty. Like, Twilight Zone empty. Ate at Black Pepper Grill, asked the one guy if they were open, sat at a table, one of two parties. Good chow, good service, but damn creepy. No folks around, prime dinner time, weekend. Checked out Ravella, nice and cozy, great front bar, cheap drinks. Still, just us and some random dude in the lobby. Hope Lake Las Vegas bounces back. It's got a lot to offer. Otherwise, I'm gonna film an ep of "Life After People" there.

"Good mall. Lots of fun places to spend your dough. Gave it four stars 'cause it's a pain in the ass to shop there during the summer. Some of the big stores are way out in left field, so you gotta drive and park multiple times. Other than that, it's a swell joint."

"Sitting at the bar, sipping a whiskey, feeling like a king. Food was top-notch, cooked to perfection. Not every dish was my cup of tea, but you could tell they put their heart into it. Pricey? Sure, but worth it for the experience."
"Chairs out front for socializing in the sun. Friendly employees, especially in the morning. Moderate crowd due to location."

We chowed down at an off-strip hotel with some pals. The server gave us the lowdown on the menu and portion sizes. We had to try a couple of their raved-about dishes - Sage Fried Chicken Benedict and Griddled French Toast. They were gargantuan! Our server was cool and warned us about the size, even offering to-go boxes for our leftovers. We devoured half of each dish, feeling stuffed and satisfied. The breakfast menu was top-notch, according to the concierge. The only bummer was the trek from the Strip. Next time, we'll hit up the joint on West Sahara or Imperial Palace.

"Went in for a slice, felt like they made a fresh pie. Annoyed no one said anything. Left due to time. Came back, ordered an 18" pizza and wings. Forgot how many wings I ate, but they were good. Place makes decent wings, not too hot, but I'll feel it tomorrow. That's the true test of wings."
"Fresh joint. Good eats. Friendly folk. Country charm."

"Good BBQ, but not perfect. Chicken was a tad dry, and the joint could've been cleaner. Not dirty, mind you, but that damn sign on the fountain drink got under my skin. And what's with the trash cans? One's turned around and another's just sittin' there, takin' up space. Still, not a bad visit."
"Vienna Beef dog, hot and juicy. Scratch-made fries, crispy. Four bucks. Best deal in town. That's all."

"This joint's a real gem. For $30, it's a damn good deal, especially when you consider the unlimited booze. I mean, who doesn't love bubbly? And the grub? Top-notch. They got everything from fluffy pancakes to Korean short ribs. That's how my mind works, a mix of sweet and savory. 

You can get a custom omelette or just grab whatever you want from the rows of seafood, Asian, fruits, veggies, pasta, eggs benedict, and even sushi. And let's not forget the desserts. Gelato, pastry, rich chocolate mousse, tangy passion fruit, gold-flecked wafer cones, chocolate-covered strawberries. It's like a dream come true. 

And the best part? They know how to do portions right. No more loading up on mac and cheese. They got mini cups, bowls, and dishes for everything. Nice and easy. 

The wait wasn't too bad, but still, two lines? One for the cashier and one for the buffet? Silly."

"Not big on breakfast, but some days need somethin' quick. Today, that meant The Silver Spoon. No corned beef hash, dammit. Jono suggested the breakfast bagel sandwich. Everything bagel, bacon. Tasty. Pleased with the result. Had to pause from bank chat to enjoy."

"Need a fancy dress outfit? Look no further than Party Mania. They got all sorts of getups for any occasion. Superheroes, disco divas, witches, and more. They even got accessories like wigs, hats, and gloves. And don't forget the Hen Nights essentials - L-plates and garters. 

Halloween's their busy season, but they're always well-stocked. Makeup, ribbons, feathers - they got it all. Conveniently located near the university, too. 

But, fair warning, it ain't cheap."
"Shop's got character, sells quirky cards, nice paper, and fun knick-knacks. Staff's friendly, too. Parking's a hassle, but worth it once you snag a spot. You'll dig the joint."
"I axed my gym membership after six years, no fuss. Got my refund, too. It's a good spot, but I found better use for my cash - private yoga sessions. No need for the gym now."

"Married in Caesars Palace, stayed in the Augustus Tower. Asked for a room with a view of the Bellagio water show, but got put on the wrong side. Still, the room was huge, bathroom was enormous, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Pillows were great too, wish I knew what kind they were. Despite being near the elevator, it was quiet. Would definitely stay here again."

"Step onto the patio, feel the mist from the waterfall, and let it cool you down. Bliss. No need for lines here, no sir. Got my own bodyguard, takes care of everything. Best table, front of the line, you name it. Service is top-notch, attentive, and friendly. Little perks like chilled strawberries make it extra special. Dress to impress, strut your stuff, and you might just find yourself at a table surrounded by admiring gentlemen."

"Chang's got some damn fine Dim Sum. Been there thrice in two months, never disappointed. Service ain't the best, gotta ask twice for drinks, but who cares? It's all about them carts, loaded with grub, 'cart pushers' don't say much, but they deliver. Prices are swell for a fam of four. Parking lot's a bit tight though, gotta wait for someone to leave."
"This joint's the real deal. Like a subway, but with pizza. Friendly staff, too."

"Bought a Groupon deal for two months of unlimited car washes. Fifteen bucks. Includes their "red towel" service. They give you a microfiber towel to use, and when you bring the dirty one back, they give you a clean one. Air and vacuums included. Self-service bays too. Asked about adding one-off services like wax. They said sure and gave me a free wax on the spot. Been a few times, and I'm satisfied. Wish I could pause the tunnel to give my wheels some extra attention, but that's not gonna happen. Also wish they opened earlier, but 8-6 is reasonable. After my Groupon is up, I'll keep my membership going. Sixteen bucks a month. Only need to go once a week to make it worth it."

"We hit Greek Wraps in Peoria once a week. Their hummus is top-notch. Never had a bad meal. Veggie pita wrap with grilled eggplant and onions drenched in yogurt sauce? Amazing. Grilled lemon kebab with garlic sauce? Equally great. \n\nLine forms quick, but worth it. Fresh food takes time. Portions are generous. Wish they delivered."

"Good run of luck lately. Sat down for brekkie, nice welcome. Friendly server, efficient as hell. Pancakes and eggs benedict, top-notch. Muffins could use some more toasting, though. Coffee's decent, but my home brew's better. Still, a solid spot for breakfast. Oh, and my cat just hopped on me. That's all for now."

"Tigerlilly's my jam. Better for cocktails or tea, you know? Had a great meal, but the afternoon tea's where it's at. Ketel One cocktail, plenty of sweets, scones, and sammies. Staff's top-notch too. Decor's swell, atmosphere's always on point. Professional all the way."

"A dear expense for such a meal, I say,
The food, indeed, did please my taste,
But, alas, the cost did mount, I pray,
More than I wished, I must confess.

A silver lining, there was, I found,
In California rolls, a crab profound,
A tasty treat, no doubt, I must avow,
Yet, priced too high, I do allow.

So, if thou seek'st a meal of worth,
And hast the coins to spare on earth,
Then, mayhap, give this place a try,
But, heed my words, and watch thy purse nigh."

"Good Oriental grub, good American choices too. Wide selection, sushi bar top-notch. Love it when they got what I like. Don't like it when they ain't got what I usualy like. Service always good. All you can eat, wow! Good for fam, good for group."
"Went to Archie's Cafe. Service good, grub top-notch. Had the Pad Tai, six on the heat scale, coulda used more fire. Nice joint, though."

"Book shopping, I'm in and out. No time for browsing, gotta have a purpose. Borders lays 'em out front, easy to grab what I need. New non-fiction, clearance, bestsellers, they got it all. Prices might be steep, but it's worth it for the convenience. Staff's friendly, parking's plentiful, and there's a Seattle's Best inside. That's my kinda bookstore."

"A wondrous place, full of hands-on delight,
Where one can spend an afternoon in joyful sight.
My favorites, the robots, never miss a shot,
At basketball or air hockey, they're never caught.
A fun and informative way to pass the time,
Indeed, a place that doth make the spirit shine."
"Arrived finally. Food's great. Spicy? They'll bring the heat. Veggie curry, top-notch. Wine selection, impressive. Staff, friendly. Rice, extra. That's how it's done."

"Went here for a quick dinner. Newer spot. Food was good, variety of options, big portions. Staff was great, rolled food in Chinese pancakes table side, cool. Offered wine and warm sake, nice touch. Overall, solid choice for Chinese food in Apache Junction."

"If you're lookin' for some damn good Mexican, this place is worth the trip. Friendly staff, clean as a whistle, plenty of seats, and a killer view. Had the shrimp tacos and sweet plantains, both top-notch. Their ultimate margarita was a letdown though, three types of tequila or not, it didn't even give me a buzz. Pricey too. But overall, this place serves up some of the best Mexican I've had."

"Lunchtime in Vegas. We're hungry. Place is new, maybe not fully up to speed. Waitress is decent, but some staff seem lost. Salads take an age to arrive, barely enough time to enjoy 'em before the main course shows up. Twisted Mac and Chicken & Cheese hit the spot. Atmosphere is classic Hard Rock, always a good time. Hope to swing by again next time I'm in town." (497 tokens)

"Postino's still kickin' ass, especially since they cut ties with LGO. This new joint's the best yet, and I ain't just sayin' that 'cause it's closer to my pad. Love the indoor/outdoor bar, feels like a real hangout. Food's on point, menu's been updated, everything's cooked to perfection. That grilled French toast with egg and asparagus? Deadly. And the cheap wine? Even better on weekends. Sauvignon Blanc's worth tryin', too. All in all, this place rules. Service can be spotty, but I can let that slide for a 4-star review."

"Hark! A marvel of a find, good sirs,
In Scottsdale, near to Vegas, 'tis not far.
A haircut, priced at twenty pieces of silver,
In an atmosphere most pleasant, doth deliver.

And lo! A happy hour, with beer at two,
They shall serve thee, either in bar or chair, anon.
The barber, a cool and knowledgeable fellow,
Didst cut my hair with skill, and wit, and mellow.

Verily, this place shall be my choice,
For all my future haircuts, by my troth, 'tis so."

"Four of us dined at Roy's on a Saturday night. We walked in, were greeted, and sat down promptly. We were glad to be seated in one of the quieter rooms. Our server introduced herself, poured water, and took our drink orders. We ordered a Cosmo and a Martini, but the Martini came without olives and with a lime wedge instead. We sent it back and it was quickly corrected. \n\nWe started with Tuna Poke and a Signature Roll, both delicious. For entrees, we had Braised Short Ribs, Seared Sea Scallops, Blackened Island Ahi, and Tempura California White Sea Bass. All were cooked to perfection and tasted great. While the food and service were excellent, Roy's still felt like a chain restaurant. Maybe it was the decor, the number of tables, the scent, or the lighting. Despite this, it's a great place for a family dinner. Not sure if it's the best spot for a romantic evening, though."

"This place doth please mine eyes and heart,
A neighborhood tavern, yet refined and smart.
Thou mayst savor delectable dishes,
And revel in merriment, for 'tis a lively place.
In summer's heat, the crowd doth swell,
So make thy reservation, lest thou wish to dwell
In wait, for service here is of the highest rate,
And thou shalt be well-cared for, with haste and grace."

"Friday afternoon, hungry and broke. Where to eat? Not the fanciest joint, but for $7.55, you get a lot of grub. Fill your gut, but watch out, it's easy to overdo it. I know, I did. Belly's full, feeling guilty. Shouldn't complain, it was cheap. :)"

"Methinks these men of skill do rock indeed,
Their service swift and their prices fair,
I sought a fan motor, new and neat,
For my heat pump, which did much declare
Their diligence, in searching far and wide,
Didst bring me deals most opportune and bright.
One of them, with haste, did drive to fetch,
The very motor, that I might possess,
And thus, with speed, my need was met,
Their kindness too, didst not forget.
A capacitor, they offered free,
But alas, 'twas not necessity.

Alas, a week didst pass, ere I didst pay,
For they didst not say, up front, the way,
A simple miscommunication, methinks,
Yet, naught but praise, their service links.
Their hours, on Yelp, be not accurate,
For they do close, at four and thirty, precise."

"Went to Bunna with the missus last Saturday. First time. Heard they had a poetry slam goin' on and we were hungry. Place had a cozy vibe, eclectic. Owner seemed proud. Didn't try the coffee, but will next time. Husband got the Mediterranean chicken wrap, I had the turkey and swiss panini. Both good. Came with veggie chips, different, but nice. Lunch menu's a steal. Will be back."

"Lisa's Bowl of Balls, a feast most fair and fine,
Doth please my taste buds with its savory design.
At Lisa G's, I do frequent, for her meatballs so sweet,
When hunger pangs for flesh do my belly greet.
A dish most satisfying, worth a king's ransom, I do swear,
And urge all who read this, to give it a try, my dear."

"Aye, men and companies do err, my dear.
But here, the master did take blame full clear.
He fixed the fault, and all was well again.
'Tis proof he holds his clients dear, and values his gain."

"A pleasant place indeed, my love didst rave about it,
And thus, he took me there, to dine and revel in its delight.
I do confess, I have a fondness for baked potatoes,
And he did say, this place didst serve them in abundance, with great relish.

But alas, I must admit, I felt a bit deceived,
For all I had, was potatoes and corn bread, and naught else did I perceive.
And yet, we paid a sum of thirty pieces of silver,
For what seemed to me, a paltry meal, and nothing more, nor less.

But fear not, dear friends, for I shall give thee a chance,
To redeem thyself, and prove thy worth, in this dance.
For I didst espy, the BBQ, which didst seem most fair,
And the aroma that didst waft, didst stir my hunger, beyond compare.

The atmosphere within, was homey and warm,
And the folk, didst bustle about, with nary a storm.
The cornbread and honey butter, didst taste most sweet,
And I didst covet, a pan of it, to savor and to eat.

In conclusion, dear friends, the price didst seem a bit steep,
But the food, didst satisfy, and didst bring me cheer, in my sleep.
So I shall return, to partake of thy BBQ,
And pray, that it shall be, a culinary ecstasy, for me."

"Pho, thou art divine! Thy noodles, not too clingy, and broth, just right. Bo vien, a delight! Yet, alas, thy spring rolls, a disappointment. Service, good sirs, most kind. Ambiance, pleasant, save for yon fish tank, unkempt. Rating, four stars, nay, five, for service most excellent."

"3.5 stars, but let's call it four. Long lines, especially during that damn BOGO promo. Waited an hour, and just made the 4pm cutoff. They said if we didn't make it, we'd pay full price per person. Jesus. 

But once inside, the spread was impressive. Anything and everything, plus free booze. Food was good too. 

Go for lunch, it's cheaper. Twelve bucks with the player's card. Dinner's a bit steep. Think they take reservations, unless there's a promotion."

"Good eatery. Big portions. Chica, their purple corn drink, tastes like hibiscus tea, not corn. Had roast chicken on a Friday. Juicy, tender, herby, roasted right. Fish ceviche for an appetizer. Nice tang, citrusy. Also had lomo saltado. Beef's tender, full of flavor. Friendly service, a bit slow. Will return."

"Federico's, I stopped by for a bite. Two beef tacos, a drink, I ordered. Service slow, woman at counter double duty, drive-through too. But food, excellent. Tacos, tasty. Lettuce, crisp, fresh. Impressed, I was. Good value, very."
"The clothes here ain't top-notch, but if you frequent the place, you might find something worthwhile. The fella who runs the joint's a good egg, too. Get to know him and he'll help you out."

"Primanti Brothers, the real deal. If they were in San Fran, I'd be their neighbor. Their sandwiches? Sloppy, robust, full of goodness. Pittsburgh to the bone. Love the OG spot, got memories of drinkin', devourin' kielbasa like a true Yinzer. May they rule the sandwich game forever. Amen."

"Houstons, consistent as hell. Hillstone Group knows their stuff. Tell Fox Restaurant Concepts to take notes. \n\nWord to the wise, Houstons soup enthusiasts - they swapped out the Mexico City style for Mushroom Artichoke on Sundays. Bummed, but still stoked on the new option. Two thumbs up."

"Maverick Tours, this mornin'. First time on a chopper, staff gave safety training, good job. Pilot Joe, smooth ride, Grand Canyon and back. Informative flight, nice views. Landed, sipped champagne, took photos. Plenty room in chopper. Thanks, Maverick crew, lifetime mem'ry."

"Grilled octopus, Israeli couscous, duck confit ravioli - they got it all. Bison flank steak, too. Five-star service, classic French cuisine. Staff's friendly, food's perfect. Pre-fixe under $50, can't go wrong. Anniversary dinner, happy tummies, big smiles. Thanks, Le Pegase."

"Pam and Nibblers pulled through for me. Last-minute office lunch and they whipped up a damn good spread. Quick service, too. Had all I needed and then some. Grilled veggies, flank steak - hell, everything was top-notch."

"I got a hankerin' for a place that's reliable, you know? This joint fits the bill. Good grub, no matter the meal. I was flyin' outta Phoenix, needed somethin' to fill my belly before dealin' with TSA and the friendly skies. Got myself a power protein sandwich, real reasonable price, too - five bucks in an airport, ain't bad. \n\nThey whipped it up in no time, just five minutes. Whole grain bread, egg whites, white Vermont cheddar, lean ham. That ham and egg combo, damn good. Bread was top-notch, too. Made eatin' healthy taste like a sinful delight. I devoured that sandwich, felt full 'til lunchtime."

"Pura Vida serves the best grub I've ever had. I've brought my folks there, and they've never failed to impress. My old man's a meat-eater, and my ma's got picky taste buds, but they both rave about the food at Pura Vida. It's always a feast for the eyes, too - I can never snap a pic before someone takes a bite. Recently, I tried their cafe con leche. Smoothest, tastiest cup of joe I've had in 31 years. Starbucks can't compete. Chef Mayra's a gem - she takes the time to chat with her guests. First time I've ever met the cook who made my meal. Place is hidden away, but worth finding. You'll remember how to get back."

"Scuba diving used to give me the heebie-jeebies. Tried it on vacation once, didn't like it. Thought that was the end of my scuba story. Then, a buddy told me about Destination Scuba. They got top-notch instructors, patient guys who take their time teaching you the ropes. No more feeling rushed or anxious. You learn at your own pace, enjoy the experience. And let me tell you, the ocean? It's something else. Beautiful, amazing. Got my heart racing, but in a good way. Now, Destination Scuba? They deliver on their name. Plan trips to tropical spots all year round. Time to book that Bahamas trip, if you ask me."

"Clean, spacious rooms at this hotel. Never had the buffet, but the casino's comfortable, clean, and fun. Didn't win, but that's nothing new for me in Nevada. Ha! Fun regardless. Would stay here again and recommend it to friends. Fitness room's pricey, but you get access to the'spa.' Treatments are overpriced, but the steam room and showers are top-notch."

"Vegas has plenty of joints to grab a bite, but I knew I wanted somewhere local. India Palace fit the bill. Great reviews and not too touristy. I went for the Vegetable Pakora and Onion Bhaji to start. The Onion Bhaji was killer - spicy and crispy. Just how I like it. Then, I got my usual Chicken Vindaloo. Spicy as hell, just how I like it. I was sweating bullets, but it was worth it. I cleaned the plate with some garlic naan and cheese naan. Didn't need dessert, but that's not saying much. Service was top-notch. Friendly, attentive, and fast. Can't wait to get back."
"Good work. Needed mani pedi, found great spot near strip. Quality nails, friendly folk."

"Home sweet home. Miss the ol' place, best spot to live life. Gated community, secure and convenient. Close to the 101, 202, and 60. Tempe Marketplace and Mesa Riverview just a stone's throw away. Old Town Scottsdale a mere 10 minutes down the road."
"This joint's my go-to for AYCE sushi. Prices are better than most, and the fish is fresh. It's tucked away in a shopping center, but it's worth finding. Ranks high on my Vegas list."

"Allure, it's a damn good salon. Clean, friendly staff, fair prices. Fifteen miles from my place, but worth the drive for their top-notch service. Jen, she's the one to see for eyebrow waxing. Been going to her for two years now, and she's the only one I trust with my brows. Keeps 'em full and natural, but tidies 'em up real nice. And remember, bring cash for a tip. Can't write it on your credit card receipt."

"CB's been good to me so far. Shorter wait than Bell and 101. That cheesy hashbrown casserole, damn good. Recommended. Yeah, it's loud, but that's part of the fun. Sunday mornings, after or before church, that's when I like to go."

"Aria Hotel, top-notch. Stayed there in December, can't believe it took me this long to give my two cents. Here's why it stands out from the rest:

1. Elegant, modern architecture. Our room, nice and stylish. Great view, and affordable too, $220 a night.
2. Location, smack dab in the middle of the strip. Easy walk to nearby hotels, shops, and restaurants. They got a tram too, but we walked everywhere, no need for it.
3. Restaurants, especially the buffet. Wynn's got nothing on Aria's buffet. $40 for dinner, $45 for dinner, worth every penny. Endless options, top-quality grub.

Loved everything about this place. Highly recommend it to anyone passing through Vegas. Off-season prices make it a steal. Give it a shot, won't regret it."

"Furniture like no other. Hand-painted, one-of-a-kind pieces. I've bought several items for my new place and they're all unique. The owners are friendly and offer delivery if you don't have a truck. Worth checking out."

"Don't let the name fool you. This ain't no ordinary deli or grocery. It's got some of the best Italian grub in town, and that's no joke. Sure, they got sandwiches and salads, but the real magic happens on the daily specials board. Risotto with shrimp, mussels, and sea bass? Check. Homemade meatballs? You bet. Veal ravioli? Damn straight. Tuscan-style steaks? They got 'em. And don't even get me started on the wine. They got a corkage fee, but it's worth it. This place may look like a hole in the wall, but trust me, it's the real deal. And when the owner/chef and his pals are sittin' around, speakin' Italian, and watchin' soccer, you know you're in for a treat."
"Food and service, top-notch. Chicken bento box, $9, plenty of grub. Green tea crime brûlée, outta this world. Be back soon."
"Fresh grub and fine brews. Had the 29 burger, top-notch. Fries, crispy. Near the Kitchener Rangers arena. Liam, the owner, hospitable. Parked here for the game. Give it a shot."

"Stopped for lunch in Wickenburg on the way to Vegas. Food was good, real good. Had the pulled pork, brisket, baked beans, sweet potato fries, and potato salad. My wife said the sweet potato fries were the best she's had. I thought my brisket was great till I tried the pulled pork. That was even better. Baked beans were top-notch. Finished it off with a warm triple chocolate brownie and vanilla ice cream. Damn good."
"Good folks, good grub. Warm chips, salsa bar - my kind of joint. Dessert bars too, not bad either. \n\nThis place, cheap, quick, friendly. Not bad nowadays."

"Place was damn near perfect. Service, impeccable. Wine selection, top-notch. Not the usual crap they serve around here. Carpaccio, beautiful. Sliced just right, melted in my mouth. Fresh, quality meat. Mussels linguine, exquisite. Garlic sauce, just right. Pasta, perfectly cooked. Tiramisu, YUM! Decor, great. Elegant, but comfortable. Big round bar, nice. Table, well-placed. Wine cellar, beautiful. Mauricio's hospitality, genuine. Glad to see a restaurant like this, not owned by some corporation. Fine dining, but comfortable."
"Cloud 9, top-notch hookah joint. DJs spinning sick beats. Friendly staff, lively crowd. No booze, but who needs it? Xbox one's the cherry on top. Best flavors in town, bar none."

"Been vegan four months. Heard good things 'bout this joint. Progressive, upscale grub and decor. Ordered lasagna, pad thai, living burrito, veggie burger. Food was good, burger a tad dry. Swiped some of my girl's hot sauce. All good. Pricey, but worth it. Fancy, like us southerners say."

"Sunday morning, we went for brunch. Bottomless bloody Mary's and mimosas for sixteen bucks. Not bad. I had a breakfast skillet scramble. Damn good. Our server, Angie, was top-notch. Attentive and friendly. We'll be back."
"Toms, we eat there plenty. BBQ, damn good. But don't stop there. Fish, Italian beef, burgers - all top-notch. And don't miss Tom's pride, his joy. Prices fair, grub excellent, service friendly."

"Elegant grub, cooked to perfection. Snagged a prime table by the window, views of the Bellagio fountain. Servers galore, each one assigned to a specific task. Water poured, seats taken, orders taken, dishes delivered. Feeling spoiled. 

Split the spaghetti, added mushrooms and broccoli. Noodles cooked just right, tomato sauce rich and full of flavor. Simple, yet satisfying. Sides equally impressive. Flavors on point. 

Definitely coming back, looking forward to the same dishes again."

"Ice Pan, a frozen treat joint, offers a unique experience. You choose the milk, flavor, and toppings, and they whip it up in front of you. Two minutes, tops. Worth the wait, despite the casino smoke and crowd. We went on a weekday afternoon, and it took a bit, but the end result was sweet."
"Clean, attentive joint. Free internet, killer tapas bar. Unwind after a long day on the road. My top pick for personal trips, close to public transit and other great eats."

"Spices and herbs, oh boy! Quality's top-notch, no need to look elsewhere. Cumin, extracts, vanilla, almond - can't go wrong with 'em. And their cinnamon? Best in town. Keep a list, never run out. No need to rush, got my Penzey's."

"Sweet! Bought a Groupon, went straight in. Limited selection, but scored a good haul. Didn't know about special orders, but happy with what I got. Red velvet, cookies and cream, peanut butter, chocolate, vanilla. Kids loved 'em... They couldn't even finish one. Sweet icing, rich cake, full of flavor. Huge cups, great value. Groupon's a steal! Staff was attentive, friendly. Gentleman was nice, helpful. Definitely going back."

"This ballpark, man. Nestled downtown Phoenix. US Airways arena across the street. Rail runs past it. Clean, alive area, especially game days. Parking's not bad, either. Favorite lot's a block away, seven bucks. Fenced in, secure. Getting out's easy. Police block off streets, guide you through downtown no problem. 

Park itself? Awesome. Love the RF bleachers. Something about 'em. Plus, tickets include dog, drink for twenty-five bucks, fees included. Try to sit close to field, but tonight we hit Friday's Front Row balcony. Prefer sitting with crowd. Game's more fun, people way more entertaining. Vendors usually good for small talk, jokes. Roof opened tonight, enjoyed it. Fireworks post-game, too. 

Catch a game here? You should. DBacks ain't doing great this year, home games especially."

"Record City, a converted house filled with vinyl treasures, stands tall in the best crate-digging tradition. Quality and selection, that's what sets it apart. From rare gems to classic albums, the collection boasts a diverse range of genres. Rock, R&B, jazz, country, and classical, you name it, they got it. The constant flow of visitors to Vegas keeps the inventory fresh and exciting. You'll leave with an armful of records, not just a few. Don't forget, they close at 5 PM and take Sundays off. My last visit yielded a cache of sealed Motown classics and hard-to-find Quads. Worth the trip, it is."

"Veggie meat sandwiches, best I've had. Morning Star chicken shreds, sliced smoked soy-based turkey. Fresh bread, generous portions. Polite staff. Wish they had one back home. Would eat here every night. Thirteen bucks for a twenty-inch sub, can't beat it."

"Amazing, amazing, AMAZIIING. Five stars all around - drinks, food, service, decor. As a bartender myself, I was impressed by their skills. They knew how to make a proper mojito, and it was the best I've ever had. Sure, it took a bit longer than usual, but that's because they took their time to craft each drink with love and care. It showed in the end result - pure perfection. Worth the wait, any day. DW is a hidden gem, no doubt about it. Can't wait to return."

"YELP HELPS 2013, what a night. Vendors brought their A-game, orgs showed their impact on the 'Burgh. Luke Wholey's Mahi Mahi, Vito Girosole's RED RIBBON soda, both top-notch. Ciao Vito, good job. Thanks to Rachel and the YELPERS for another great evening. -Gary K."

"Chicken kabob, my go-to at Market Grille. Juicy, marinated chicken, packed tight on a skewer. Comes with veggies, rice, salad, and hummus. A damn good deal. 

The lamb gyro's a close second. 

Now they got waiters and waitresses. Don't need 'em. Old system worked fine. Order at the counter, grab a number, get your own drink. Simple. 

Friendly staff, though. Always helpful. 

Tip: Keep an eye out for 15% off coupons in the Review Journal."

"Winco, we love it. Pocket-friendly, especially on produce. Quality's been good. Milk's always under two bucks a gallon. Dig the variety of breads they got. Their HyTop stuff ain't bad either. Hate shopping at Walmart, supporting a crummy outfit. Winco treats their employees right, service is top-notch. Can't compare it to Fry's or Safeway, it's a unique joint. Perfect for two folks, don't need no bulk quantities from Costco, but their grocery store prices are competitive as hell."

"We love this joint. First visited for my kid's second birthday. Did the hayride and petting zoo tour. Loved the milk bar and feeding the animals. Went back after getting a Groupon and joined the Dairy Club. Great being close to where our grub comes from. The chefs make some killer dishes - peanut butter ice cream, garlic and herb butter, red pepper aioli, and a damn good chicken salad. We're hooked."

"Tortellini salad, shoulda gotten bigger size. Key lime dessert, perfect balance, not too tart, not too sweet. Apricot pork tenderloin, looked great. Daughter loved her cookies. Great addition to the neighborhood."

"Sambalatte, my go-to spot. Great coffee, good vibes, and free wi-fi. Perfect for working or meeting friends. Feels like SoCal, not Summerlin. People-watching paradise. Two floors, chill atmosphere. Give it a shot, take your time. No rush, no Starbucks feel."

"Arizona, finally got the best pizza. Been waitin' a while for this. Owners from Illinois, kept the quality high. Didn't wanna go back to Illinois for good pizza. Thanks, Buzzyz. Always deliverin' the real deal."
"One of the top five poker rooms in Vegas. Lots of tables, good games, and a solid room overall. My go-to spot."

"Arepas? Amazing. First timer, perfect fit. Couple miles from the strip, old plaza, nice inside. Two sauces, bottle, spread, delicious. Spicy, savory, creamy. Great with food. Cashier, George, patient, knowledgeable. Not cheap, but worth it. Quality food."

"Recovery from a wild night on the Strip? This joint delivered. Food, service - top-notch. And that Mechilada? Hair of the dog never tasted so good. Eggs Benny? Don't miss it. A great spot to fuel up before hitting the strip or pool."

"This joint's off the chain, no way you'd know it's vegan. Staff's always friendly too. Cash only, though. 

Flew in for my daughter's grad, had two food missions: Spam Musabi and vegan donuts from Ronald's. Yeah, opposing forces, but hey. 

Apple fritters, man - took 'em to grad, then on the plane, now they're frozen and stashed at my fiancée's. Can't tell they're vegan, they're that good. 

Word of advice: cash only. Lady who co-owns the place? Super nice, rare find in Vegas."

"Finished a great meal here. First time trying Turkish food. Be back soon. Kuru Fasulye, lamb and beans, was tasty. Lentil soup, smooth and well-seasoned. Turkish baklava, soft and chewy, not too sweet. Must try with Turkish coffee. Friendly staff. Highly recommend."

"Best sushi joint I've been to, no lie. Not one to embellish, but this place warrants it. Spent three nights in Vegas, hit this spot twice. Everything we ordered, pure gold. That crunchy spicy roll? Deadly."
"Food's good here. Not fast, but real good. Carnitas burrito, tasty. Tacos, quality. Street corn, takes me back to Mexico, when I was young."
"A tribute to the Beatles, it was. Music that moved us, like the waves of the sea. My wife and I, we were blown away. Best show we've ever seen, it was. Cirque du Soleil at its finest."

"Uptown Waterloo's got a new gem. Went there with a buddy, couple weeks back. It's my last year at Waterloo, figured I'd try spots I missed out on before. Place doesn't look like much, but it's got charm. Staff was friendly, eager to help with the menu. Had the eggplant parmesan, water (driving, so couldn't try a drink). One of the best I've had, top three for sure. Sandwich style, nice and flavorful, marinara on the side, perfect. Place was quiet, Tuesday night, 7 pm. Good spot for a peaceful dinner."

Rolled into town on a Saturday night, drove 16 hours to get there. Car's giving me some nonsense about oil and coolant. Used cars are cheaper than new ones, so I figure I'll give the green car a drink. Top off the coolant with some stuff I bought at the gas station. Then panic sets in. Grab the manual, search forums for specific requirements for my aging road beast. Think I put in the wrong kind of coolant. Keep reading about colors and brand benefits. Head to Zimbrick, Bryan's awesome, friendly, and patient. He checks the coolant supply I have against what the service folks have in bulk. Good to go, no danger. Talk oil and other road-preparedness details I shouldn't skip. He grabs the oil grade I need, checks levels, compliments my ride, and I prep the wallet. Ask how much I owe. Transaction ends with a smile, handshake, and sincere thanks. I'm in love.
"DB, I love it. Great coffee, top-notch service. No gripes. Saw 'em on Undercover Boss, sealed the deal. Would've worked there in high school."
"Clean joint. Good service. Food's top-notch. Make their own pasta, cheese, and sauces. Fresh ingredients, hence the name. Macaroons? To die for. Be back."

"Lucky Me Pet Care? Top-notch. Used 'em last time I left town. Dogs were happy, got notes keepin' me updated. Heather and her crew, real pros. Took 'em on walks, gave 'em attention they needed. Better than boardin', they're home, comfy. And cheaper, too."
"Chocolate shaved snow, not what I expected. But good. Friendly employees, spotless store. Even on a busy Saturday night. Fun addition to Centennial Hills."
"Convenient spot, just a stone's throw from work. Friendly staff, eager to lend a hand. Recommended."
"Indian grub, that's my jam. Buffet's where it's at, no decisions needed. Curry chicken, that's my top pick."
"Brows wild, needed taming. Yelped, found joint. Two ahead, wait under ten. Threaded brows and lip, five bucks off. Great service, will return."

"Pork on a Fork, a hidden BBQ gem in the north valley. Cornhuskers "N" on the smoker, windmills and farmers in the dining area, reminds me of why I left that godforsaken place. No points lost, though.

Only been for lunch, usually a line at the door. Brisket, BBQ pork, beans, and waffle fries - hot, fresh, and damn good. Meat's top-notch. Cornbread's decent too. Portions are generous, almost too much for my own good.

Sauces ain't nothing special, but the spicy one's alright. Dining areas got flat screens, not bad, but the furniture's picnic-quality at best."

"Bass Pro Shops, a haven for outdoor enthusiasts. Firearms, camping, knives, fishing, golfing, hiking, boating, hunting, ATV's, archery - they've got it all. Can't resist the urge to stop by whenever I'm in Vegas. Conveniently located near I-15 on Blue Diamond Road, it's my go-to spot for restocking ammo. Last time I visited, my wife and I marveled at the impressive aquariums and mermaid paintings at the Silverton Casino connection. She's a sucker for mermaids, I'm a sucker for crossbows. Fell hard for a Parker Compound Crossbow on the second floor. Might've found my new shooting partner. If you're in Vegas and share our passion for the outdoors, do yourself a favor and check out Bass Pro Shops."

"Place stands up, 5 stars no question. Survived past few years, good sign. Saturday night, 8:30, 40% full, not bad. Three restaurants, three bars, all good. Urban vibe, luxury feel. Had small supper before comedy show. Server nice, quick service. Single guy at bar, reading book, eating pasta, welcome. Carbonara still top-notch, like Queens joint. Grateful for place like this."
"Veggies, curry, wine—a buck a head. No corkage, BYOB. Family-style, friendly service. This place is a steal."
"Busy joint till midnight. Good chance of snagging a seat then."

"Basset St's got a new gem. Fantastic grub, top-notch service, local ownership, fair prices, cozy atmosphere. Can't praise it enough. Menu changes twice a season, that's why they call it Seasonal. Entrees and breakfasts, both top-notch. No Cheesecake Factory portions, but still a damn good value. Tea selection's impressive, and they got a coffee and regular bar too. Two brothers run the joint, and they give a damn 'bout their customers. Sign up for their mailing list, they only send one a month, and it's worth it for the specials."

"Best mom and pops Korean joint I've been to. Treated us like family, spoiled us rotten. Small hole in the wall, needs more visitors. Chef/wife's cooking? To die for. Husband/host? Hilarious, genuine. Quality food, run by loving couple. They're a chemical engineer and ex-nurse, so they know their stuff. Gave us three free dishes, refused our tip 'cause we're students. Slipped one past the husband, still didn't feel like enough. Felt like we were at home, sitting around the dinner table with family. Highly recommend, give more than five stars if I could."
"Place is top-notch. Shepard's pie, best in the valley. Staff, friendly and prompt. Sunday jams, great for traditional music lovers."

"Gordon Ramsay Steak, a culinary symphony. Attentive staff, knowledgeable and friendly. Food, a masterpiece. Flavors harmonizing, creating an unforgettable experience. Best meal of my life, thanks to all involved."

"Genghis Grill, love it. Get what I want, every time. Flavorful, cooked just right, staff's top-notch. They got those chopstick helpers for the kid, makes her feel like a pro. Highly recommend for the little ones, they'll eat more veggies, try new things when they can see it before it's cooked, see others giving it a shot too."

"Friday night, two girls, Grill. Patio, golf course view. New furniture, bar, TVs. Gastropub menu, bottle of wine. Truffle deviled eggs, cheese plate, duck confit tacos, ahi tuna, duck fat grilled cheese, kiltlifter fish and chips. Everything delicious, shared. Wasabi crusted ahi, favorite. Friendly staff. Great menu, best patio Scottsdale."

"Pizzeria Bianco, best pie in Phoenix. Historic district, old homes now eateries and bars. Sat lunch, got there early, scored patio table in shade. Fill up quick, heard waits can be long. Split salad, had margarita pizza with fennel sausage. Simple, quality ingredients, unique flavors. Be back."

"Top-notch joint for threading in the valley. She's rigged up some nifty gadget that keeps the thread clean and out of your mouth. Necklace does the trick, real swell. Service is A-okay, quality's top-notch. A peach of a spot, tell ya."

"Best BBQ I've had in Arizona. Tender brisket, incredible corn soufflé, and decent slaw. Friendly service, too. Lynn knew her stuff. Left feeling full, but not physically. Had to loosen my pants. Not the fanciest joint, but the grub and hospitality make it a hidden gem."

"Good joint for shoppin', bakery's got great pastries, cheaper than Starbucks too. Outside patio's a nice spot for readin' the paper in the mornin'. Staff's real friendly, they care 'bout their customers, not like some other places in town. Sushi bar's good for a quick bite, so's the salad bar, and the deli's got some tasty options too. Can't really complain 'bout anythin' here, 'cept maybe the prices if you're doin' all your grocery shoppin' here."
"Haircut of a lifetime, today. Cute joint, friendly folk. Hair's looking sharp, message was a sweet surprise."

"Rubio's, a no-frills cantina serving up straightforward Mexican fare. Been there a few times, always ordering the Atlantic salmon burrito - fresh as hell, just wish it was bigger, ya know? Quality seafood ain't always expected at a fast-food joint, but Rubio's delivers. Their salsa selection's got some nice variety, with the roasted chipotle being my go-to. Good spot for a quick lunch."
"Brats and Burgers, you say? I gave it a go. Damn good thing I did. Their curry sauce, it's top-notch. I'll be back for more, that's a fact."

"Two weeks 'til grand opening, I was hesitant to check out the new spot. Glad I did. They got some kinks to work out, brick oven ain't done yet, but what's on the limited menu is top-notch - a big step up from the other place. They'll have 24 beers on tap come opening day, but they got about 15 now, including that hard-to-find Four Peaks Callabru Up N Runnin'. Impressed, and I can't wait for the big day."
"Rushed visit, but damn good grub. Black & blue burger, pulled pork sandwich, blue brisket salad - all winners. Close to the office too. Sorry, gotta bounce."

"Great meal here. Server helped us navigate the menu, recommending the signature pizza and garlic olive oil for the bread. Wish they sold that oil in a bottle. Only issue was the wait, but it was a wild Friday night with rowdy drunks causing a scene. Authentic Italian food, not far from downtown. This place delivers."
"Good joint, tasty drinks, local whiskey. Prices fair, selection vast. Lookin' forward to seein' their aged stuff down the line. Gonna bring me back for the tour next time 'round."

"NW's got a new spot for pet owners who know their shit. I'm talking premium grub like Orijens, Acana, Natural Balance - the works. They got a refrigerated dog section for them raw-feedin' folks too. Treats made in the USA, ya hear me? They got a table full of doggie desserts that look good enough for humans, ninety cents an ounce. Deer antlers, jerky, sausage - they got it all. Variety's the spice of life, right? And they got groomin' services, leashes, collars, dog bowls galore. The owners, Adrienne and Jim, they're solid folk. They support dog rescue, which is near and dear to my heart. I'm stoked to see how them deer antlers go over. Sometimes Momma needs a break, ya know?"

"Mexico City, on Smithfield by the bridge. Best authentic Mexican in Pittsburgh. Friendly staff. Tacos, awesome. Homemade corn tortillas, the key. Fresh, flavorful food. Like Sayulita, Nayarit. Close to the real deal."
"Good guy, the owner. Transferred a handgun at his shop. Even scored a Colt Python while we were at it. I'll be back for more."

"Diane's, a dive bar in Edinburgh, offers a unique experience. Knock-off DVDs and questionable drugs are available, and physical altercations are common. Despite this, I have a fondness for the place and its eclectic clientele, including shady characters and heavy drinkers."
"Food, ambiance, and service - all top-notch. Firecracker shrimp and grilled chicken with cilantro cremation, highly recommended. We'll be back."

We went there on a busy night, and it was packed. But the service and grub were top-notch. We were celebrating our anniversary, and we got the kind of meal we were hoping for. The sommelier was a bit full of himself, but our server was great. The wild mushroom risotto, squid ink rice, and albondigas were all standouts.

"Oishii's got a tight selection of small plates, like Japanese tapas. You'll find killer dishes like orange salmon canapés, lobster with strawberries and shrimp chips, and more. In a city with a rep for weak sushi, Oishii brings the heat. It's still affordable, too. Great spot for groups, with plenty of space and half-priced cocktails on Thursdays."

"Escape the city grind with a 30-minute hike at Exploration Park. The park offers a scenic trail for families and a playground for kids. At the midpoint, take in the stunning view of the Strip or let teens gossip without worrying about eavesdroppers. The summit features a circular terrace and another bench with an even more impressive view of the city. The trail is perfect for beginners and kids, but don't forget to work your way up to bigger challenges. The playground below boasts multiple swings and slides, including a miniature mountain replica for little ones to explore. Get some exercise, keep those New Year's resolutions, and let the kids have fun!"

"Cirque du Soleil, I love it all. But this? This is my favorite. MJ, they did him justice. Brought his world to life. I cried, real tears. Beautiful, fun, emotional. Dancers, gymnasts, all of it - perfection. Don't wanna spoil it, but you gotta see it. Must-see show."

"Lunch in Vegas lacks the power dynamic of other cities. Everyone's on holiday, so there's no need for fancy restaurants. But Milo's, that's a different story. It's my new go-to spot for a great meal and some scene. Their prefix menu is top-notch."

"Daniel G hooked us up, no cover. Security tight on what we could bring, so pack light. By the pool, VIP host invited us to join some guys in their cabana. Hell yeah, we said. Free mojitos, good company, sweet tunes, and no kiddie pool shenanigans. A+ day."
"Chow mein, beef, real good. Not like other places, bland. Orange chicken, A grade. Service, quick."

"Pizza joint had a swell vibe, plenty of options. Spicy sauce, jalapeños, double cheese, sausage, pepperoni, red bells. Real good. Don't need all the fixin's to make it great. Extra charge for wheat or gluten-free crust. Friendly folks."
"Pittsburgh, three weeks of bliss. First bite, knew it'd be tough to leave. Bacon, eggs, cheese, my heart longs for thee. Reunited we shall be, my dear sandwich, too soon."

"First time writing a review. Never been one for words. But this place? Best sushi I've had. Cheapest too. Came on Good Friday, left feeling full and satisfied. Service top-notch, food even better. Fast too. Coming back for sure."

"Vibes: 5 stars. Rad chicks running the show: 5 stars. Coyote Oatie ice cream sundae: 20 stars. 

Heaven in a bowl. Famed sundae lived up to the hype. Cookie crumbled into ice cream and caramel, pure bliss. Support local joints like this over corporate chains any day. 

Planning another visit already. MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!!!"

"Not a car girl, but Lester made it easy. Needed an inspection, he fit me in same day. Evening hours, convenient. Straight shooter, fair price. Labor, $70 hour. Parts, cheaper than others. Replace brake light, $3. Happy with quick, honest service. Lester, the best."
"Give it another shot, friends. New management's brought this joint up a notch. Food's improved, service is top-notch, and happy hour's a real treat. Worth more than six stars, if I'm honest."

"Died and in heaven, I reckon. Place is off the charts, atmosphere-wise. Want to switch tables to take it all in. Staff's top-notch, too. Andrew and Priscilla, they're keepers. Friendly, happy, knowledgeable. Give 'em a raise. Husband had the beef tenderloin, I had the ribeye. Shared a bite or two. Finished with the chocolate bar dessert. Can't put into words how good it was. Want everyone to try it so we can chat about it later. Never wanted to live in Phoenix till now. Come, eat, drink, share, repeat."

"M Resort, one of my top picks in Vegas. Haven't stayed here yet, but they got plenty to offer. Mainly come for the eats. Their buffet, the best in town, no question. Always got my go-to dessert, Creme Brulee. And espresso drinks, too! Hash House, Baby Cakes, Vig Deli, Anthony's Steakhouse, and Burger Joint. Spotless joint, minimal smoke in the casino. Pool area, great. Plenty of seats, pool staff on point. Even the grub at the pool, top-notch. Ravello lounge, good entertainment. Wine and drink selection, solid choices for every taste."

"Aloha Kitchen, a hidden gem off the strip. Adobo fried rice omelette, a taste of home. Reminds me of my mother's cooking. Garlicky, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. Couldn't finish it all, saved some for later. Pork kahlua, tender and smoky. Spam musubi, standard fare. Affordable and delicious meals. A great escape from the casinos. Highly recommended."
"Neighbor referred me to Noble for carpet cleaning. They showed up on time, did a great job, and were polite. Will use them again."
"Waffles, French toast, corned beef - all top-notch grub. Hash browns stole the show, especially with that caramelized onion magic. Our crew of ten devoured it all. Good times."

"Sick of goin' to mass and not gettin' it? This is the place for you, friend. I ain't one for church myself, but Father Nadim's got a way with makin' the gospel relatable. He uses real-life examples, ya know? Makes it easy to understand. And let me tell ya, he's got a way with words. He did a private mass for my daughter's baptism and it was top-notch. Almost brought a tear to my eye, it did. And the guy's got a sense of humor too, which don't hurt nothin'. Me and the missus, we're big fans of this church. Don't say that often, but it's the truth."

"Herb & Rye, I love it. Dark decor, Friday nights with a DJ. Aviation, my go-to drink, three rounds minimum. Food's great too - wings, hot and crispy, beef carpaccio, mussels, steak that's actually worth a damn. Happy hour, don't miss it."
"Parking, good. Paid a buck for thirty minutes, though. That's Scottsdale for you. Nothin's free, not even parkin'. Love the shops, but they need to update their map. Missin' some new spots."

"Back for round two at this joint. Great spot, top-notch service, friendly folks, and a cook who knows how to put on a show. First visit, I was hesitant 'bout the portion sizes, but let me tell you, I could barely polish off my share. That fried rice? Divine. We had a blast, both times."

"Annie, the event coordinator, is a real gem.  Spunky, beautiful, and friendly as hell.  Made me feel right at home.  Tommy's patio is something else.  Feels like you're on an island paradise.  Staff treated me like a regular, and the grub?  Off the charts.  Had the Saba Steak Salad and Island Goat Cheese.  Can't even describe 'em, I'm still drooling.  Steak was cooked to perfection, dressing had a kick from the garlic aioli, and the potato coins?  Nice touch.  Spring mix and romaine were fresh as could be.  Now, the goat cheese...  Whoa.  Just perfect.  Not too strong, just right.  Tortilla strips on the side?  Dangerous.  Mango salsa?  Yeah, I had a spoonful of that too.  Highly recommend Tommy Bahamas.  Get your tickets for the Original Taste this weekend and try 36 restaurants in one shot!"

"Hotel was top-notch. Stayed three nights with the missus. Room was swell, beds were comfy, and the waterfall shower was a real treat. Got free entry to Drai's night and beach club, which was a sweet perk. Breakfast was on the house too, and it was damn good. Can't wait to come back. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only downside was the thin walls, could hear the club's tunes all night, but it wasn't a big deal for us."
"Burgers are decent, prices too. But for a real experience, grab a stool at the bar. You'll strike up a conversation with whoever's next to you, no doubt. Unless you're the dull one, that is."

"Settebello, five stars ain't enough. Carmine, a Neapolitan artist, his pizzas a masterpiece. Passion, just the right toppings, cooked perfect. Even a sophisticated palate, delighted. Bravo, Carmine. See you soon."

"Great bar. Love the menu, always changing, but still got the classics for the regulars. Good drinks, chill atmosphere, 'cept on Saturdays, when it gets packed.  \n\nFew things to know:

Vegans, watch out. Some drinks got eggwhites, honey, dairy, or Campari, and it ain't always on the menu. Ask the bartender, they'll hook you up with a vegan version. 

First Monday of the month, it's Mixology Monday. Guest mixologist brings the heat with four special cocktails featuring the booze of the night. I went for Veev Acai, some other stuff, but it's always good. 

Weeknights, it's a good spot for a date or hangin' with friends. Not too crowded, music's not loud, ambiance is nice. 

Drinks run about ten bucks. They got a temperance menu too, non-alcoholic drinks, mixology style. Good for DD's, preggo's, or Mormons."

"Wings, fresh and unique. Atmosphere? Forget it. Food's the draw here. Brought my wing-lovin' gal to this dive in the sticks. She was wary till she tried 'em. Now we're regulars, Sundays for football. Great wings, that's the truth."
"Tacos, damn good. Ribs, fell off the bone. Lunch, not too busy. Service, top-notch."

"Boss took me here for lunch. Order and pay first. Hamburgers, to die for. Fries, flavorful. Fried Twinkie for dessert. Loved it. Bringing family and friends back. Next time, pictures. Not disappointed."

"Fabulous, every damn time. Doesn't matter who I'm with - mom, boyfriend, friends - this place is our first stop. Hash is top-notch, service is quick and friendly. Great spot, one of my go-to Vegas joints."

"First-time visit to this joint. Impressed by the red, white, and black decor. Food's pricey, around $20 for two burgers, fries, and a drink. Ate outside on a nice day, enjoyed the peanuts on the table while we waited. Clean bathrooms, clean overall. Food was great, bun could've been toasted though. Free refills on drinks, unique machine. Fries were enough for two, girl working said so. We'll be back."

"Been coming here on and off for years. Price was the only thing keeping me away. But they've changed that now. Many choices included. Means I'll be back more often. Spicy chicken breast bowl with brown rice and veggies. Damn good."

"Never had a bad experience here. Food's always good and the hostess is friendly. Went last night, no greeting, slow service due to three waiters. Still left satisfied. Alicia did a great job, kept our waters full, food came promptly. Great customer service keeps me coming back. Thumbs up for the new decor."
"Good joint. Pricey, but grub's top-notch. Desserts too."
"Croissant at Bellagio, years back. Still remember how good. Relived it this weekend. Just as damn good. Regular croissant, dub espresso. Best ever."
"Lindo MIchoacan, stacked with BEST OF LAS VEGAS awards, now has a Henderson spot, views of the city and all. Can't beat great Mexican grub with a view."

"Good grub, made by swell folks in Vegas. Don't let the mall location fool ya. Food's way better than some fancy joint. Fresh ingredients, homemade quality. Try the roasted chicken with paprika and caramelized onions, or the chicken skewers with rice. Greek salad, gyro platter, and baklava for dessert are also top-notch. Support small biz, not corporate chains that prioritize profits over quality. You won't regret it."

"New to town, needed a good salon. Heard raves about Sweet Salon, decided to give it a shot. Adorable joint, great stylist - Paige. Nailed it, knew what I wanted. Affordable too. Recommend it, definitely going back."

"Rented a Spot GPS from LowerGear for my hike through the Grand Canyon, Zion, and Sedona. They shipped it straight to SoCal, where I was staying, and walked me through the setup over the phone. When I was done, I packed it up and sent it back with the return label they provided. Got a thanks-for-your-business email, and that was that. Seamless experience. Helpful folks, too. Even gave me tips on where to find some specialty gear they didn't carry. Wish they had a store in Cali. Definitely using them again for any future GPS needs. Cheers, fellas!"

"Local dive bar, but decent grub. Went last night, had plenty to choose from on the menu. Even got hot green tea, unexpected. Opted for sandwiches, subbed without issue. Waiter was solid, food was hot. Daily menu specials, lots of TVs with different channels, comfy booths, clean bathrooms, ample parking. Not bad."
"Chinese grub in Tempe? This joint's got it. Fresh veggies, flavorful chicken, just-right rice. My top pick for delivery. Period."

"Paninis? Great. Brewed teas? Cheap. Not a bar, more like a coffee joint. Staff's attentive. Good spot for studying or unwinding with a drink and some video poker after a long double shift. Oh, and Mariana the Barista? Top-notch. Friendly as hell. That's why I keep coming back."

"Phoenix Metro Retro, run by Heidi and Douglas, is a haven for mid century modern and Scandinavian furniture enthusiasts. Their collection is impeccable, a testament to their dedication to quality and craftsmanship. Heidi's silver smithing studio, tucked away in the back, is a treasure trove of unique pieces. Her work is exceptional, a reflection of her passion for the craft. The store is a must-visit for anyone seeking a truly special addition to their home. You'll leave with a smile on your face, and perhaps a newfound appreciation for the beauty of Scandinavian design." (487 tokens)
"Good dentist. Good people. Found 'em in Vegas. Moved there, needed dentist. Went to a few. Not good. Then found this one. Friendly folk. Real dentist. Not in it for the cash. Highly recommend."

"I've been to this joint four or five times, and let me tell you, the grub's been top-notch every single visit. Service? Aces, my friend. They treat you like family, and the kiddos get a freebie on the weekends. Can't complain about a thing. This place is the real deal, especially if you're lookin' for a good meal without breakin' the bank."

"Vegas gelato joint. Best in town. Always stop by when I'm in Vegas. Creamy, smooth, delicious - amazing! Never disappointed, except when it's closed. Get the same every time: stracciatella and hazelnut. Consistently good. Reasonable prices, plenty of seating."
"Donuts? Best damn thing I ever had. Ate one and a half before I knew it. Chocolate, of course. Buttermilk, too. Died and gone to heaven. Need to find one near me."
"Panera, a place I love. Ashley Love and Luke, they make my day. Friendly staff, great food, and good vibes. Been coming for years."

"Thai food here is top-notch. Get the Northern Thai menu, it's unlike the usual stuff. 

Service is great, location is convenient even if you need a cab. 

Worth a visit."

"Love this joint. Entrance makes a statement, grub's top-notch, taste is off the charts, staff's friendly, and desserts? Deadly.
