The prices are fair, and the atmosphere is cozy with a small, intimate setting. The staff is friendly, and the patio seating is great for enjoying a meal outside. I'd give them an extra star for the beautiful women who work there. If I could, I'd sign a contract to only eat their pizza. Too bad they're closed on Sundays."

"The Red Rock's got a secret weapon - Jean Marc, the man behind the scissors at their spa. Moved to Vegas, needed a haircut, found the guy. One look, and he knew what I needed. Cut my hair, made me look five years younger. Next time, color - balayage, natural, rich. Hooked, told all my pals. If you're in Vegas, see Jean Marc. He don't just cut hair, he makes it perfect."

"Wash-dry-fold. Pick-up and delivery. Dress shirts. Dry cleaning. They do it all, for a fair price. 

Take credit cards, too. Easy to reach, if plans change. 

Can't say enough good things. Been to the laundromat, but haven't used it. Clean, pleasant, and hip, in a Pittsburgh kind of way."

"Good service. Polite staff. Saw Dr. Hill. Kind, funny guy. Recommend."

This rewritten text has a more concise and direct style, similar to how Ernest Hemingway would write. It uses shorter sentences and avoids unnecessary words, while still conveying the same message as the original text.

"Cool joint, great event. Thanks, Lindsey and YELP. 

Started with a flick—name kept hush till it began, Raising Arizona. Ate a killer brat from The Short Leash Dog Food Truck, courtesy of YELP. Goodie bag full of rad stuff too. 

Sweet theatre: comfy seats, solid projection and sound. Top-notch YELPERS. 

One helluva night."

"Mary Ann Martin's set up shop at Luxe Salon Studios. She's got three decades of Vidal Sassoon training under her belt and offers top-notch hair styling services at a fair price. Gents, if you're looking to ditch the clippers and get a real haircut, Mary Ann's your gal. My missus swears by her, and I reckon you will too."

"Best buffet my husband and I have ever had. Every dish was delicious. Got a two-for-one deal through their Identity membership program, so it was affordable. Loved the fig and bacon salad, and the dessert bar was top-notch. Went for brunch and had a wide variety of high-end breakfast and lunch dishes. Definitely worth checking out while you're in Vegas." (497 tokens)

"Fili-B's serves up authentic Mexican grub, no frills or fuss. First-timers may feel uneasy, but trust me, it's worth the risk. Some folks can't stomach it, but I'll take that chance any day. My go-to order? A monster carne asada burrito and a large horchata. Not for the faint of heart, but a gem for those who dare. And at a great price, perfect for broke college kids. Give it a shot."
"Freshest grub in town. Pre-made, but not frozen crap. My roomie turned me onto 'em. Organic stuff too. Not always on sale, but they got coupons for $3-$6 off. Friendly staff too."

"No way, hell no! Red Velvet Pancake? Nuh-uh."

I looked at the menu and saw that damn thing. I just had to let out a loud shout and make a scene. The owner was there with her family, too. What an ass I must've looked like.

But then I calmed down and ordered the full stack. Six red slices with chocolate chips, whipped cream, and cream cheese syrup. Damn, it was worth it. One hour outside of Vegas, but worth it. Never had a pancake that good. The whipped cream, man...and that cream cheese syrup. Unique, and it added something special.

Only open for breakfast and lunch, and it's west of the medical facility. But hell yeah, I'd go again. Try the other flavors, maybe some Filipino or American food. Yeah, definitely worth it.

"Good grub and service. Friendly folk, too. Definitely coming back. Food's tasty, service top-notch. Wi-Fi's free, perfect for business lunch. Got some work done, enjoyed a killer brownie. Bringing pals next time."

"Friday night, I stopped by AMC AZ Ctr. for dinner before catching a flick. They recognized me, asked about my bacon tat, and remembered I wanted to try the lamb. It was a phenomenal experience. The lamb was rubbed with Dijon mustard, topped with fresh herbs, and baked rare. The manchego and chorizo risotto complemented it perfectly. The cheddar basil waffle was a surprise - a Belgian waffle instead of what I imagined. But it all worked well. \n\nIt was a splurge, sure. But for $27, I got a generous rack of lamb and a hearty portion of risotto. I had leftovers for days, feeling satisfied and content. Centurion is a great restaurant."

"New fave restaurant. Simple setting, busy atmosphere. Perfect for dates or special occasions. Wife had the 4-course tasting menu ($50) with wine pairings ($20 each). I had the filet ($30) and nibbled off her plate. Risotto was the star - best I've ever had. Excellent service, despite 35-minute wait. Manager showed up with complimentary drinks. $110 tab, worth every penny."

"Late workday, needed food fast. Found Yovi's on the Pittsburgh site. Thought it'd be worth a shot. Damn good choice. Had the Chicago dog combo with fries and a Coke. Fresh toppings, great buns. Dogs were top-notch. But the fries, man...the fries. Never expected a hot dog joint to have 'em so good. They got that Potato Patch taste, ya know? Best fries downtown, no question."

"Subs, real good. Corned beef, pastrami, ham, all quality meat. Staff, friendly, helpful. Price, right. Place, clean. Hot sauces, plenty, rated 1-10. Tried the '100% Pain,' name fit. Back again, sure thing."
"Cool joint, great grub. Staff's on point, knowledgeable and friendly. Food's top-notch, big portions, fair prices. Definitely going back. Chef Tony's a kitchen wizard."

"I rang Chris, a man of reputation, to mend the mess left by my pup on my rugs. His work, like his word, was top-notch. He arrived promptly, did a bang-up job, and charged a fair price. I'd hire him again in a heartbeat."

"This joint's got my vote. Adam Carolla-style pizza eating, that's me. Thin crust, just right. Pepperoni's my go-to, but they got other toppings too. Sausage, not so much. Sauce is good, cheese is plentiful, and they got specials galore. Friendly staff, always chatty. My toddler loves watching 'em cook. If you're a NY pizza fan, give it a shot. Won't break the bank, might just become your new spot."
"Chris mixed up one hell of a mule, best I've ever had. They don't have much in the way of supplies, but what they do have, they use to full effect."
"Good place to start the day. Orange juice, freshly squeezed. Recommended, but be prepared to wait. They're always busy."
"Late night, great night. Dive bar, best kind. Molly, awesome. Bras on bar, beautiful bartender. Unwind, needed."

"Colectivo, a coffee shop that's a must-visit for me. I'm not a morning person, but for this place, I'll rise early. Two days in a row, I woke at 5 AM to grab a single or double espresso as soon as they open. The atmosphere's perfect - just the right amount of seats, great ambiance. 

The internet's top-notch, better than most coffee shops in town. No limits for two hours, YouTube loads quickly. Great for working in the morning. 

The service is excellent, the barista and staff are friendly. I've been productive, reading, writing, and revising my proposal there. Happy! 

If you see a lady with a colorful scarf, say hi! She's always in a good mood, even with books and a long paper. Thanks, Colectivo!"

"Late night in Scottsdale, the missus and I were hankerin' for some pizza. Didn't wanna eat in no club central, so we busted out the ol' iPhone and Yelped ourselves to KISS. Open late, park in the lot, and friendly service. Now, I was a mite skeptical, but that cheese pizza hit the spot. Chunky sauce, love in every bite. Guy's got skills, no doubt. Only open Fri and Sat, but that's how they keep it real. Food's too good, they sell like hotcakes. Me and the wife, we'll be back. KISS Back East Pizza and Beef Joint, it's the real deal."

"Great spot! Stumbled upon it by chance, new to Phoenix. Menu looked good, so we went for three tacos and a bottle of water. Five bucks total, cash only. Tax included. I had two chicken tacos, wife went for fish. Big, juicy tacos. Beans, cheese, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, rice, and your choice of meat. Green sauce and red salsa on the side. Not like those puny Taco Bell tacos. These were massive and delicious! Wife loved her fish, I loved my chicken. Can't wait to come back. Only thing missing was black beans instead of pinto. But that's an easy fix for next time."

"Not all CrossFit gyms are born equal. Some stand above the rest. Like CF480. Their head coaches? Top-notch. They give a damn about their members, and it shows in the gym's community. You got a lot of options in North Scottsdale, but CF480's the clear winner. See for yourself."
"Luci's, I love 'em. Hot Juan Black Bean Burger, best I've had. Sweet tots, too. Try 'em instead of the regular ones. Yum."

"I hit this joint every other week, minimum. Gel manicure, you know. Sometimes Sarah H comes with me, makes it more fun that way. Place is spotless, well-organized. Nail techs are friendly, accommodating. Been coming here for two years now, no complaints."
"Fresh bagels, all sorts. Boars Head meats, cheeses too. New York style deli, damn good eats."

"Service was top-notch. Teppan chef, a South American gent, was kind and generous. Calamari, fresh and delicious. Shrimp appetizer, a pleasant surprise. Unique teppan experience, noodles served before rice. Rice, the best part, arrived last. Felt guilty not finishing it, but too full. Happy hour prices, reasonable. Ordered shrimp tempura sushi, large and fresh. All you can eat tempting, but opted for happy hour teppan. Ended up costing less. Budget-friendly decision. Definitely coming back."
"Severn, a pleasure to work with. Clubs and pool parties, no problem. Consistent pricing, smooth coordination. Severn makes Vegas trips stress-free, enjoyable, memorable."
"Took the cat and Chihuahua to the groomer's. Got 'em squeaky clean. Ears, too. Cat didn't like it much, but they did a damn fine job."

"Roberto's, now rebranded, remains my go-to taco joint.  Their Carne Asada Fries, sans beans, never fail to impress.  Today, however, some fries were soggy, unlike their usual crispy offering.  Despite this, my admiration for their cuisine persists."

"This joint's the real deal. Me and the missus, we hit it up at least once a week. Last weekend, we even took the party bus to the Cards game. They always got somethin' new cookin', so it's a great spot to catch up with old pals and make some fresh faces."

"Loved the Farm Kitchen at S. Mountain. This place is a little slice of heaven, a real piece of small town USA. Great spot to bring family, friends, or out-of-towners, especially for the kids. The whole place is open, so you can wander around and check out the farm, chickens and all. Was bummed about the long wait for breakfast, but glad we found The Farm Kitchen. Cozy little cottage with a variety of sandwiches, salads, and baked goods, all made with fresh ingredients grown on site. Ordered a few sandwiches, pasta salad, and mushroom soup. Everything was top-notch. Prices were a bit steep, around $12-$15 per person with a drink and side, but worth it for a change of scenery and a few hours away from the city."

"This joint serves up the best breakfast in town. Their grub's top-notch, especially the biscuits and gravy. Friendly waitstaff too. But Sundays, man, it's like everyone and their mom decided to show up at once. You'll wait a bit to snag a table, but it's worth it."

"Family and I damn grateful for Allison's help. Rented a place in Vegas for a year, then she helped us snag it. Found her on Yelp, good reviews, gave her a ring. Happy I did, she's a peach. Got a lot in common, great to work with. Helped us out with inspections, appraisals, any questions we had. Made it a breeze. Thanks heaps, Allison."
"Tasty grub at Tejas. Margaritas, too. Strong, but good. Wife and I come here often. Patio's not great, though. It's in a parking garage. But overall, you can't go wrong."

"Place is great. Got some solid furniture for free during their grand opening. Prices are way better than the competition. Staff is helpful, not pushy. Cookies, popcorn, games for the kiddos. This is MOR Furniture. Shawn Teters, best manager around."

"Had a tight schedule, so I could only squeeze in a cold one and a snack. Too bad, 'cause I had tickets to that Criss Angel show. Would've been better off skipping it and savoring a full meal, a few pints. But I did have a nice pint of Aruba Red, paired well with them buttermilk chicken sliders. Good combo, looking forward to doing it again sometime. Hope this joint makes it out east."

"Never trusted anyone with my brows before. Felt like a risk, leaving them in someone else's hands. But here, got my lashes done, and it was all good. Nice people, comfortable. Even had a chat while they ripped hairs from my face. Then, bam! Great brows. Fun, too. Saw dudes getting cleaned up, looking sharp."

"David's Hamburgers and Mexican Food in Scottsdale served up some good grub. The joint's a cozy little 50's spot, clean but not spotless. I ordered the guacamole burger with pepper jack cheese, bacon, lettuce, and tomatoes. Fries, onion rings, or cole slaw come with the burger. I went with fries and a Dr. Pepper. The fries were decent, nothing special. The burger was cooked just right, guacamole was top-notch. Service was top-notch too. My server, a grey-haired, bespectacled gent, gave me phenomenal service. Friendly, knowledgeable, attentive, and professional. He kept my drink full and even hooked me up with a to-go cup. I'll be back, thanks to him. All in all, good food, nice building, great service. Give David's a shot."

"Postinos? Never reviewed it. But let me tell you, it's a damn good spot. Bruschetta boards, all of 'em are top-notch. Mondays and Tuesdays, 8 pm, $20 gets you a board and a bottle. Hell yeah. Dog-friendly patio, attentive service, and cheap drinks before 5 pm. Wish I was sippin' on one right now."

"Clean, comfy rooms at a fair price. Not on the strip, but close to Nellis AFB and the 215. Good for a staycation or a quiet night's sleep. Rooms are way better than on-base digs, and there's decent grub nearby in the casino. Free wi-fi, pool, and valet parking. Solid choice."

"Good tuna, that. Smooth, crisp sake at the chef's house. Service top-notch, friendly servers, no attitude. No sign out front, look for Big Wong's. Japanese-Italian place next door, want to try next time. Minimalist decor, designer restroom, nice. Akami, meaty dreams. Not a fan of fatty tuna. Ask for house blend plum sake bottle, not aperitif or champagne flutes. Fish top-quality, generous cuts. Wasabi served, soy sauce complementary. No spicy tuna, wah."

"Came here for my birthday dinner on Monday with my partner. Place was packed, but service was top-notch. Waiter knew his stuff, made some great recs. Food was damn good too. Presentation was on point. Will be back."
"Zinburger, oh boy. Turkey Sloppy Joe, truffle fries. Good stuff. Going back."

"This joint's the real deal. Been coming here for six months now, and every meal's been a knockout. Brought some pals along, and they're all hooked too. \n\nTry the udon. It's off the charts. I usually don't finish my broth, but here, I lap it up like a cat. Even when it's sweltering outside, I'll still order it. That broth's got a hold on me, brother. Wish they served ramen too...that'd be the icing on the cake."
"Busy joint. Good grub. Hot. Clean. Friendly folk. Always packed, especially when the Dbacks are killin' it. Six runs, baby!"

"Heard about this joint called Slidin' Thru Truck, been wantin' to check it out for a bit. Finally found the place, tucked away in some business park. Looks like a dive, but don't let that fool ya. Food's top-notch. Menu's simple, just sliders and fries, but they do 'em right. Had the barby, yaya, and pep pep sliders. Each one's got its own flavor, and they're all good. Barby's got that BBQ vibe, yaya's Greek, and pep pep's like a cheesy, bacon-wrapped dream. Don't be fooled by their size, either. Three of 'em filled me up good. Sweet potato fries are a nice touch, too. Cinnamon sugar's a surprise, but it works. Place itself is cozy, staff's friendly, and they got themselves an NBA Jam machine. Free play, baby! Definitely comin' back for more."

"Best damn Mexican food I've had, and I ain't had much. Wahoo's, you know? Haha! Service was top-notch, food was even better. They give you chips and sauces, your meal comes with beans and rice. Had fish tacos, stuffed myself, ate it all. Husband had enchiladas, boys had beef and pork burritos. Nobody had any complaints. Everything was fresh, delicious. Can't get over how good it was. Don't got nothing like this in Hawaii."

"Lemon tart, broken. Yuzu parfait, frozen shortbread, pistachio puree, watermelon, coconut jelly. Fun, light, unique flavors. Doppio espresso, twist. Petifores, fudge cheesecake, granola, honeycomb tuile, tanka bean ice cream. Best dessert. Driftwood plate. Hawke & Hunter, above expectations. No boasting, just delivery."

"Rittenhouse Square's the spot, no need to drive far.  Atmosphere's top-notch, staff's friendly.  Patio's sweet when the weather's right.  Fridays and Saturdays bring the crowd, but it's bumpin' any day.  Haven't tried the grub yet, but the menu's diverse and it all looks tasty.  Give it a shot."

"Food was incredible. Each dish we shared was phenomenal, unique. White onion soup, one of the best I've had. Sweet, savory, rich, light. Chayote with rock shrimp, fantastic too. They even gave me a free birthday treat - two cake pops and fruit. Nice touch."

"Been here thrice before. Chicken sandwich, top-notch. Today, noon, takeout window. Wanted somethin' else. Told the counter girl—cute brunette, ponytail. She said try the Paris burger. Gave me a food hack too—chicken sandwich with Paris toppings. Home, devoured the burger—not usually a grass fed guy. Now I'm thinkin' 'bout the chicken sandwich with Paris toppings. Kudos to Ingo for real tasty grub and a great staff. Atmosphere and energy, just as important as the food. The Stand might have the best burger in Acadia/Arizona/America, but Ingo's Tasty Food, the full package, can't be beat."

"Cozy, busy room. Close tables, but comfy. Friendly neighbors. Salmon tartar, my fave. Just right amount of dill, not too saucy, nutty, unexpected faro. Rabbit rillettes, rich, herby, rustic. Turkey leg, amazing. Coulda used a few more Brussels sprouts, but meat and sauce, incredible. Bread pudding, cherries, same attention to detail. Outstandin' grub, friendly service."

"Walked alone through Fisherman's Wharf, entertained beyond belief. Touristy, sure, but who cares? I live in a touristy part of San Francisco, too. Wish I'd bought a Cashmere or tartan skirt. Two regrets. Photos turned out great, though. Should've taken a tour."

"Love Leroy's. Long bar, plenty space for solo or group. Great outdoor spot for summer nights, heat lamps for chillier eves. Modern twist on a classic dive. Pretzel bites, fried green tomatoes, both solid choices. You're welcome."

"Susan saved the day for my kid. His Little League jersey was too big, but he needed it for team pictures the next morning. I called Susan and she fixed it up in no time. It looked better than new by Friday evening. She even added some extra touches for my boy's comfort. Susan's the best, period."
"Bryant Pest Control, top-notch outfit. Affordable, too. Treat their clients right, show up on time, and get the job done. Good people, good work. That's all that matters."

"Enjoyed the restaurant. Surprised me, since the hotel room service was mediocre. Server was friendly, attentive. Sunset over the golf course, beautiful. Atmosphere, nice. Not too casual, not too fancy. Family-oriented. Highly recommend the Brussels sprout salad. Love salads, and this is one of the best. Don't be put off by the name. I wasn't always a fan of Brussels sprouts. Had them for the first time at five, barfed at the Christmas dinner table. But this salad doesn't have that bitter taste. Bacon bits, dressing, mmmm."

"Opus, I dig it. Downtown joint with a vibe, but not too wild. Classy, intimate. Drinks, top-shelf. Pricy, sure, but worth it for the martinis. They got all sorts of flavors, man. Champagne, sake, plum wine. Food's alright, not fancy, but better than your usual bar grub. But let's be real, I'm there for the drinks, not the eats."

"This joint's a real "Keeper." Classy atmosphere, friendly folks, and top-notch service. Our waiter knew his stuff and made some solid recs. Wanted a fruity drink, but they only had regular mojitos on the menu. Asked for a strawberry version, and voila! They hooked us up. Prices were fair, too. Ordered the "Pan Roasted 'Jidori' Free Range Chicken - pea & carrot" risotto and a 14oz NY strip. Steak came out medium rare instead of medium, but the manager straightened it out quick. Service and vibes here are top-notch. Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas."
"Clean joint, always bumpin'. Polishes fresh, new colors. Make a reservation, no slack."
"Range day, fun and safe. Service top-notch. We show up, some gear catches a staffer's eye. Next thing, he's tweaking our setup. Cheers, lads."
"Good eatery. Ate well before. Manager, nice guy. Offered freebie chef's meal. Impressed. Apologies for last visit. Thanks."

"Eye Priority, top-notch outfit. Pro optometrists give you the works, thorough exams. Frames, aplenty, stylish and smart. Staff, friendly and on the ball. For prescription glasses, this is the joint."

"Ten years, I've brought my pup here. They know us by name, always ready with answers, no matter how silly the question. The wellness plan, a godsend. Can't put a price on the peace of mind it brings. Staff's top-notch, genuinely care about my dog's health. This is where I'll keep bringing him."
"Neighbor recommended F&F for steaming carpets post-renovation. Fred called ahead, showed up promptly, and did a damn good job. Thorough work, tidy finish. Recommended."
"Good eatery. Friendly folk. Soft baguette, perfect potato soup for a shitty day. Coffee a bit sour, but that's just me."

"Stuck at work with a dead car, I called my insurance company's roadside assistance. They patched me through to a local towing company. The driver, Howard, arrived within the hour, no sweat. He was a straight shooter, didn't waste any time checking out my ride. Turns out, I had left the hazards on all day (rookie move). Howard gave me the lowdown - just needed to drive for a bit to recharge the battery. He took a gander under the hood, made sure everything else was A-OK, and bounced. I was stoked to hear my engine purring again. Made it home safe and sound. Big thanks to Howard. Couldn't have asked for better service."

"I’m a freelance model, always on the lookout for fresh faces. Came across Elizabeth’s site, loved her work. Synched up via Pinterest, turns out we share similar tastes in photography. Reached out, lined up a shoot. 

From the get-go, Elizabeth was warm, receptive to ideas, quick to respond, polite, and funny. She came up with a great concept, put in the effort to get everything sorted – dresses, furniture, logistics. During the shoot, she was über-prepared, had everything I needed. Impressive. 

Elizabeth’s got an eye for detail, both in her emails and during the shoot. A perfectionist, a pro. Grateful to have worked with her, looking forward to the next collab."

"Huntridge Liquor, a Vegas staple for decades. Regulars gather, share tales, and enjoy cheap drinks in a no-frills atmosphere. If you're looking for a fancy spot, keep moving. But if you want to experience old Vegas, grab a drink, and listen to stories from the past, this is your place. Look for the vintage Pabst sign outside the Maryland parking lot."
